analyzed: 'dus pa kha cig la 'byung ba chen po kha cig yod par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //

translated: The sutra on the individual sources states that each of the nine sources, from the eye source to the body source,🔽is a type of form, and that each source is composed of the four great elements as its cause, as is possible.

analyzed: ni sa la sogs pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa'o zhes bshad pa ni ma yin te /

original: dper na sems can thams cad skye gnas bzhi las skyes pa yin no zhes bshad pa na /
analyzed: dper na sems can thams cad skye gnas bzhi las skyes pa yin no zhes bshad pa na /
translated: For example, when it is said that all sentient beings are born from the four modes of birth,

original: sems can re re yang skye gnas bzhi las skyes pa nyid du ni shes par mi bya'o //
analyzed: sems can re re yang skye gnas bzhi las skyes pa nyid du ni shes par mi bya'o //

original: sems can gyi rigs gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni skye gnas bzhi las skyes pa nyid las logs shig na mi gnas pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems can gyi rigs gang ji snyed pa de thams cad ni skye gnas bzhi las skyes pa nyid las logs shig na mi gnas pa lta bu ste /
translated: The reason is that all sentient beings, whatever their type, are born from the four modes of birth, and they do not exist apart from the four modes of birth.

original: de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra'o //

original: don de rtogs pa las rnam pa gzhan du ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir te mi srid pa'i phyir de sems kyi rgyud la 'bras bu 'byin pa'i nus pa skyed par dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no zhes bya bar gzugs bar bya'o //🔽de las skyes pa las zhes bya ba ni de las skyes bas na /
analyzed: don de rtogs pa las rnam pa gzhan du ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir te mi srid pa'i phyir de sems kyi rgyud la 'bras bu 'byin pa'i nus pa skyed par dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no zhes bya bar gzugs bar bya'o // de las skyes pa las zhes bya ba ni de las skyes bas na /

original: de las skyes pas te de la'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pas te de la'o //
translated: From that, the result arises.

original: grong la spyod do zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: grong la spyod do zhes bya ba ni /

original: grong de nyid la spyod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: grong de nyid la spyod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: One does not use the village itself.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: grong nas byung ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: grong nas byung ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: The result that arises from the village.

original: 'on kyang de la gdags so //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la gdags so //
translated: Nevertheless, it is designated in that.

original: de bzhin du pa na bza'o zhes bya ba yang pa na de nyid za ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du pa na bza'o zhes bya ba yang pa na de nyid za ba ni ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, one eats the food. One does not eat the food itself.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: de dag las byung ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las byung ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: The result that arises from that.

original: 'on kyang de la gdags so //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la gdags so //
translated: Nevertheless, it is designated in that.

original: sngon gyi las yin par yang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba yang de ni sngon gyi las ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon gyi las yin par yang rig par bya'o zhes bya ba yang de ni sngon gyi las ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the result of previous action.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: grong nas byung ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: grong nas byung ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the result of what has arisen from the village.

original: 'on kyang de la gdags so //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la gdags so //
translated: But it is designated as that.

original: de'i 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yin no //
translated: It is the result of that.

original: 'on kyang de la gdags pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de la gdags pa yin te /
translated: But it is designated as that.

original: 'dir yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang de bzhin no //
translated: It is the same here.

original: dgongs pa 'dis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgongs pa 'dis 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa yod pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: By this intention, he declares that the past and future exist.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: sngon byung ba nyid kyi gzugs de yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon byung ba nyid kyi gzugs de yod pa yin gyi /
translated: The form that has occurred previously exists.

original: gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not exist by the intrinsic reality of form.

original: 'byung bar gyur pa nyid kyis gzugs de yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'byung bar gyur pa nyid kyis gzugs de yod pa yin gyi /
translated: The form that will occur exists.

original: gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: But it does not exist by the intrinsic reality of form.

original: mig ni ma skyes pa las skye zhing skyes nas kyang 'jig go zhes bya ba 'di yang rigs pa @263b yin no //
analyzed: mig ni ma skyes pa las skye zhing skyes nas kyang 'jig go zhes bya ba 'di yang rigs pa @263b yin no //
translated: It is also reasonable to say that the eye arises from what has not existed and having arisen, it is destroyed.

original: de'i phyir gzhan du na rdzas las yin na ni gzugs ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan du na rdzas las yin na ni gzugs ma 'ongs pa yod do zhes gsungs na /
translated: Therefore, if it were substantial, it would contradict the statement, “Past form exists.”

original: mig ni ma skyes pa las skye zhing zhes bya ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig ni ma skyes pa las skye zhing zhes bya ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And it would contradict the statement, “The eye arises from that which is not yet arisen.”

original: de bzhin du gzugs 'das pa yod do zhes gsungs na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs 'das pa yod do zhes gsungs na /
translated: Similarly, if it were substantial, it would contradict the statement, “Past form exists.”

original: skyes nas kyang 'jig go zhes bya ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: skyes nas kyang 'jig go zhes bya ba dang 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And it would contradict the statement, “Having arisen, it ceases.”

original: 'jig pa med par 'gyur ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig pa med par 'gyur ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it would not cease.

original: de'i phyir mdo sde gzhan las mig skye ba na zhes rgya cher gsungs pa de 'gal ba zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang len btab pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo sde gzhan las mig skye ba na zhes rgya cher gsungs pa de 'gal ba zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang len btab pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the objection that the statement in another sūtra, “When the eye arises,” and so on, is contradictory is also refuted.

original: de lta bas na 'dir yang mngon sum dang 'gal ba med cing snga phyi 'gal ba yang med do //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dir yang mngon sum dang 'gal ba med cing snga phyi 'gal ba yang med do //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction with direct perception and there is no contradiction between past and future.

original: ji skad bshad pa lta bus da ltar byung ba'i gzugs bzhin du yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa lta bus da ltar byung ba'i gzugs bzhin du yod pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is accepted that it exists as it is explained, like present form.

original: de yang de yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de yang de yin te zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: And that is just what it is.

original: de yang de yin zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs la rag las te skye ba zhes gang smras pa de yin no //
analyzed: de yang de yin zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs la rag las te skye ba zhes gang smras pa de yin no //
translated: That is, the phrase “that is so” refers to the statement that “feeling, etc., arise in dependence on form.”

original: de ltar dang / mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar dang / mthong ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “we see that” should be supplied.

original: yang tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs la rag las te skye ba de ltar mthong ba su dag la zhe na /
analyzed: yang tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs la rag las te skye ba de ltar mthong ba su dag la zhe na /
translated: Who sees that feeling, etc., arise in dependence on form?

original: gang dag gzugs las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams te /
analyzed: gang dag gzugs las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams te /
translated: Those who are not free from attachment to form.

original: gzugs las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de dag gzugs dang ltan cig tu mngon par 'grub pa na de ltar ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzugs las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de dag gzugs dang ltan cig tu mngon par 'grub pa na de ltar ma mthong ngo //
translated: Those who are not free from attachment to form do not see that when they are established together with form.

original: gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni gzugs med bzhin du lus mngon par 'grub pa yin pas rjes su dpag pa de mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams ni gzugs med bzhin du lus mngon par 'grub pa yin pas rjes su dpag pa de mi 'thad de /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to form are established with a body that is formless. Therefore, that inference is not valid.

original: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams gnyis su tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs la rag las te mthong zhes te /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang gzugs kyi khams gnyis su tshor ba la sogs pa gzugs la rag las te mthong zhes te /
translated: We see that in the two realms of desire and form, feeling, etc., arise in dependence on form.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su yang gzugs med par tshor ba la sogs par skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su yang gzugs med par tshor ba la sogs par skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de'o //
translated: And in the formless realm, feeling, etc. would not arise as form.

original: 'on te de ltar mi 'dod na ni yang na gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no zhes bya bar khas blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te de ltar mi 'dod na ni yang na gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral ba yin no zhes bya bar khas blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: But if you do not accept this, then you should not accept that one is free from attachment to form.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba dgra bcom pa kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: khams gsum las 'dod chags dang bral ba dgra bcom pa kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: One would be an arhat free from attachment to the three realms,

original: gzugs kyi khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba gzugs med pa na spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams las 'dod chags dang bral ba gzugs med pa na spyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who is free from attachment to the form realm does not exist in the formless realm.

original: yang na gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni yin la /
analyzed: yang na gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral ba ni yin la /
translated: Or, one would be free from attachment to form,

original: gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral ba de la yang phyis gzugs med pa'i khams su gzugs mngon par 'grub pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar khas blang bar @264a * //🔽bya grang na /
analyzed: gzugs las 'dod chags dang bral ba de la yang phyis gzugs med pa'i khams su gzugs mngon par 'grub pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar khas blang bar @264a * // bya grang na /
translated: and you should accept that form is actualized in the formless realm later, when one is free from attachment to form.

original: de yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: de yang mi rigs te /
translated: But that is illogical.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni 'di nyid du rab tu grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni 'di nyid du rab tu grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the formless meditative attainments are well known in this very realm.

original: 'di ltar gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni gzugs kho na las 'dod chags dang bral ba yin gyi /🔽tshor ba la sogs pa dag las ni ma yin par 'dod pa'i khams sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams ni gzugs kho na las 'dod chags dang bral ba yin gyi / tshor ba la sogs pa dag las ni ma yin par 'dod pa'i khams sam /
translated: Thus, the formless meditative attainments are free from attachment to form alone,

original: gzugs kyi khams 'di nyid du rab tu grags pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams 'di nyid du rab tu grags pa'i phyir mi rigs so //
translated: but not to feeling, etc. because they are well known in the desire realm or in this very form realm.

original: 'di'i phyir yang mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang mi rigs te /
translated: This is also unreasonable because

original: 'dod pa rnams la rnam par sun 'byin par byed pa na 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la rnam par sun 'byin par byed pa na 'dod pa rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba yin la /
translated: when one is disgusted with the desire realm, one is free from attachment to the desire realm,

original: gzugs rnams la rnam par sun 'byin par byed pa na ni gzugs rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs rnams la rnam par sun 'byin par byed pa na ni gzugs rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but when one is disgusted with the form realm, it is unreasonable to say that one is not free from attachment to the form realm.

original: 'on te gzugs rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba las kyang phyis gzugs mngon par 'grub pa kho na yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te gzugs rnams las 'dod chags dang bral ba las kyang phyis gzugs mngon par 'grub pa kho na yin par 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that form is produced again after one becomes free from attachment to form,

original: de lta na ni 'phags pa dgra bcom pa la yang phung po mngon par grub pa yongs su zin kyang thar pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rigs so //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'phags pa dgra bcom pa la yang phung po mngon par grub pa yongs su zin kyang thar pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rigs so //
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that even though the aggregates of an arhat are produced, he would not be liberated.

original: 'bras bu 'byin pa la ni de rnams kyi las stobs dang stobs med pa yin par brtag par bya'i //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byin pa la ni de rnams kyi las stobs dang stobs med pa yin par brtag par bya'i //
translated: You should consider the strength or weakness of the karma of those who produce their effects.

original: de ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni mi rigs so //
analyzed: de ni rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba yin no zhes brjod pa ni mi rigs so //
translated: It is incorrect to say that this contradicts an inference.

original: ji ltar na 'bras bu 'byin pa la ser sna can gtong ba de rnams kyi las stobs dang stobs med pa yin par brtag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'bras bu 'byin pa la ser sna can gtong ba de rnams kyi las stobs dang stobs med pa yin par brtag par bya zhe na /
translated: How can you consider the strength or weakness of the karma of those who produce their effects?

original: ser sna can rnams kyi ser snas longs spyod kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las gang yin pa de lan cig snod khyad par can la phul ba las skyes pa'i las stobs dang ldan pas gegs byas pas de ma thag pa'i tshe rabs la rnam par smin par mi
analyzed: ser sna can rnams kyi ser snas longs spyod kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las gang yin pa de lan cig snod khyad par can la phul ba las skyes pa'i las stobs dang ldan pas gegs byas pas de ma thag pa'i tshe rabs la rnam par smin par mi
translated: The powerful karma of stingy people that leads to poverty is obstructed by the powerful karma of giving to a special recipient, so it does not immediately ripen in the next life.

original: 'gyur ro // gal te des ma byas na ni de ma thag tu smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gyur ro // gal te des ma byas na ni de ma thag tu smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they do not give, it will ripen immediately.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyams su myong nas ni smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyams su myong nas ni smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having experienced the result, it ripens.

original: de bzhin du gtong ba rnams kyi las longs spyod chen po nyid 'grub par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de yang gzhan dag longs spyod dang bral ba las stobs dang ldan pa gang yin pa des gegs byas pa'i phyir de ma thag pa'i tshe rabs la phyug po🔽nyid du mi 'thob bo //

analyzed: mngon par shes pa myur ba ste /

analyzed: gzhan dag na re ste / bye brag tu smra ba dag na re skye ba'i kun du sbyor ba ni spangs la mngon par 'grub pa'i kun du sbyor ba ni ma spangs pa zhes bya ba'i spangs pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba'i srid par nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i nyon mongs pa de so

analyzed: bar ma dor ni zad pa'i zhes bya ba ni bar mdor yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no //

analyzed: yin pa'i sems ji ltar nyes par spyad par 'thad /

analyzed: par 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing 'thung ba de ni rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa yin te /

original: dbyar tshul dang / nye ba 'khor dang / legs mthong chen po dang / mig chung gi mdo sde la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbyar tshul dang / nye ba 'khor dang / legs mthong chen po dang / mig chung gi mdo sde la sogs pa lta bu'o //

original: de lta bas na 'di dag dang / mdo sde'i khungs gzhan mang po dag gis zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di dag dang / mdo sde'i khungs gzhan mang po dag gis zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it says, “by these and many other sources in the sutras.”

original: yang dag par bsdus pa'i bzhi po 'od srungs chen po la sogs pa dgra bcom pa rnams kyis mdzad pa gang yin pa de yang da ltar nyams so //
analyzed: yang dag par bsdus pa'i bzhi po 'od srungs chen po la sogs pa dgra bcom pa rnams kyis mdzad pa gang yin pa de yang da ltar nyams so //
translated: The four collections compiled by the arhats such as Mahākāśyapa have also declined.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do we know?

original: sde ba gzhan dag las lung dang / le'u dang mdo rnam par gzhag pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sde ba gzhan dag las lung dang / le'u dang mdo rnam par gzhag pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'di ltar sde pa gzhan dag las te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sde pa gzhan dag las te /
translated: It is like this: in other schools.

original: slob dpon gyi rigs gzhan dag las lung rnam par gzhan pa tha dad pa de dag kha cig las ni lung bzhi'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi rigs gzhan dag las lung rnam par gzhan pa tha dad pa de dag kha cig las ni lung bzhi'o //

original: kha cig las ni lnga'o //
analyzed: kha cig las ni lnga'o //
translated: some have five.

original: de bzhin du lung dang le'u las le'u rnam par gzhag pa tha dad cing /
analyzed: de bzhin du lung dang le'u las le'u rnam par gzhag pa tha dad cing /
translated: Similarly, there are different traditions of scripture and of chapter.

original: mdo rnam par gzhag pa tha dad do //
analyzed: mdo rnam par gzhag pa tha dad do //
translated: There are different traditions of Sutra.🔽Moreover, there is the extensive passage beginning with:🔽Moreover, there is the extensive passage beginning with:

original: gzhan yang lung dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba dang / gzhan yang sil bu dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas so //
analyzed: gzhan yang lung dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba dang / gzhan yang sil bu dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas so //
translated: Moreover, there is the extensive passage beginning with:

original: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa /🔽ma byung ba /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa / ma byung ba /
translated: All dharmas are without self-existence,🔽unoriginated,

original: ma 'gags pa /
analyzed: ma 'gags pa /
translated: undestroyed,

original: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
analyzed: gzod ma nas zhi ba /
translated: primordially peaceful,

original: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: and all dharmas are by nature in a state of Nirvana.🔽The phrase:🔽desiring to enter into the Bodhisattva stage of faultlessness,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pas 'jug par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skyon med pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyon med pas 'jug par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi skyon med pa ste /
translated: refers to the faultless stage of the Bodhisattvas.

original: mthong ba'i lam la 'jug par 'dod pa ni mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la 'jug par 'dod pa ni mngon sum du bya bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: The phrase wishing to enter the path of insight means wishing to perceive directly.

original: dor bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gtong bar 'dod pa'o /
analyzed: dor bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gtong bar 'dod pa'o /
translated: The phrase wishing to abandon means wishing to relinquish.

original: 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi sems mi sgro bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni 'chal pa'i shes rab ni spro ba ste /
analyzed: 'chal pa'i shes rab kyi sems mi sgro bar 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni 'chal pa'i shes rab ni spro ba ste /
translated: The phrase wishing to avoid a defiled mind means wishing to avoid a defiled understanding.

original: rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Defiled understanding is a kind of defilement that is synonymous with discursive thought.

original: de ni 'di skad du rnam par rtog par rnam par mi rtog par 'dod pas zhes bya bar bstan pa yin no //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du rnam par rtog par rnam par mi rtog par 'dod pas zhes bya bar bstan pa yin no // 'di lta ste /
translated: This is what is being taught: wishing to avoid discursive thought, that is, wishing to avoid a defiled understanding.

original: sha'i spyan ni bdag cag lta bu la yod pa gang yin pa'o //🔽lha'i spyan ni mngon par shes pa'i spyan te /
analyzed: sha'i spyan ni bdag cag lta bu la yod pa gang yin pa'o // lha'i spyan ni mngon par shes pa'i spyan te /
translated: The phrase the eye of flesh refers to the eye that is possessed by those like us.

original: bsam gtan dang po la @266b sogs pa'i sa ba'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po la @266b sogs pa'i sa ba'o //
translated: The divine eye is the eye of superknowledge, which is based on the first meditative absorption and the other stages.

original: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi spyan ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i shes rab kyi spyan ni zag pa med pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The eye of wisdom of the noble ones is uncontaminated knowledge.

original: chos kyi spyan ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: chos kyi spyan ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes te /
translated: The eye of reality is the knowledge that is attained subsequent to the transcendent.

original: gang gis chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis chos rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: It is that by which one discriminates phenomena.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan ni shes bya thams cad la rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa'o //🔽de la sogs pa ni bstan ma thag pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan ni shes bya thams cad la rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa'o // de la sogs pa ni bstan ma thag pa ste /
translated: The eye of the Buddha is the knowledge of all things in all their modes.

original: yang de nyid las bshad pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro //🔽gzhan yang sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags pa la sogs pa yang bstan te /
analyzed: yang de nyid las bshad pa zhes bya ba dang sbyar ro // gzhan yang sdig pa thams cad so sor bshags pa la sogs pa yang bstan te /
translated: The rest of the terms are as they have been explained in the immediately preceding text.🔽The text continues:🔽Moreover, it teaches the confession of all sins, etc.

original: de nyid las sdig pa thams cad so sor 'chags so //🔽bsod nams thams cad kyi rjes su yi rang ngo //
analyzed: de nyid las sdig pa thams cad so sor 'chags so // bsod nams thams cad kyi rjes su yi rang ngo //
translated: The text says: I confess each and every sin.🔽I rejoice in all merits.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba 'debs so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la gsol ba 'debs so //
translated: I beseech all Buddhas to set the wheel of the Law in motion.

original: bdag gi ye shes rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu gyur cig ces 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bdag gi ye shes rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu gyur cig ces 'byung ngo //
translated: May my knowledge be perfected in enlightenment.

original: gal te ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid med pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: If one says that the teaching of the non-substantiality of the dharmas, etc.🔽is not of definitive meaning,

original: nges pa'i don bshad pa med par yang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'am tshigs su bcad pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don bshad pa med par yang zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'am tshigs su bcad pa'o //
translated: then one is saying that the Sutras and the Verses are not of definitive meaning.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis ni sgra ji bzhin gyi don du nges par gzung bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis ni sgra ji bzhin gyi don du nges par gzung bar mi bya ste /
translated: These two verses should not be taken literally.

original: mdo sde gzhan dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They contradict other scriptures.🔽For example, they contradict the sutra that states:

original: 'di ltar 'di la kha cig mtshams med pa lnga'i las gang dag yin pa byas shing bstsags pas lus zhig ma thag tu sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mdo sde 'di dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la kha cig mtshams med pa lnga'i las gang dag yin pa byas shing bstsags pas lus zhig ma thag tu sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i mdo sde 'di dang 'gal lo //
translated: “There are some who, having committed and accumulated the five heinous actions, are reborn in the hells immediately upon the dissolution of their bodies.”

original: mdo gzhan 'di dang 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mdo gzhan 'di dang 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: They also contradict another sutra that states:

original: pha dang ma ni gsad bya zhing zhes bya ba sgra ji bzhin gyi don du nges par gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: pha dang ma ni gsad bya zhing zhes bya ba sgra ji bzhin gyi don du nges par gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not take the words ‘one should kill one’s father and mother’ literally.🔽For example, the sutra states:🔽‘Whoever lacks faith in virtuous qualities is a person who lacks faith and is subject to degeneration.’

original: 'di ltar btsun pa gang su yang rung ba dge ba'i chos rnams la dad pa ma mchis pa de ni gang zag ma dad pa yongs su nyams pa'i chos can no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du dge slong dag gang dag byas pa shes pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar btsun pa gang su yang rung ba dge ba'i chos rnams la dad pa ma mchis pa de ni gang zag ma dad pa yongs su nyams pa'i chos can no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du dge slong dag gang dag byas pa shes pa /
translated: And: ‘Monks, those who are grateful and appreciative are grateful and appreciative even for a small service.

original: byas pa tshor ba de dag ni nga'i yin no zhes rgya cher 'byung ba ni mdo 'di dang yang 'gal lo //🔽mdo 'di dang 'gal ba'i phyir //
analyzed: byas pa tshor ba de dag ni nga'i yin no zhes rgya cher 'byung ba ni mdo 'di dang yang 'gal lo // mdo 'di dang 'gal ba'i phyir //
translated: The statement I am the one who experiences the results of those actions is also contradicted by this sutra.

original: ma dad byas pa mi shes dang // zhes bya ba sgra ji bzhin gyi don du nges par gzung bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: ma dad byas pa mi shes dang // zhes bya ba sgra ji bzhin gyi don du nges par gzung bar mi bya'o //
translated: Because it contradicts this sutra, the statement The Tathagata is the one who performs the action and the one who experiences the result should not be taken literally.

original: 'di 'gal du zin kyang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni nyan thos dag na re'o //
analyzed: 'di 'gal du zin kyang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni nyan thos dag na re'o //
translated: The statement Even if it does contradict the sutra is a response by the Sravakas.

original: de ni de dag gi shes rab kyi nyes pa yin pa'am zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni slob dpon gyi zhal nas so //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi shes rab kyi nyes pa yin pa'am zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni slob dpon gyi zhal nas so //
translated: The statement This is a fault of their wisdom is from the master.

original: gong du 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba mngon par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gong du 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba mngon par sbyar ro //
translated: The word because is supplied.

original: ji ltar 'gal zhe na /🔽mdo gzhan las gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs @267a * //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gal zhe na / mdo gzhan las gang dag de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs @267a * //
translated: How does it contradict?🔽Because it contradicts another sutra, which states:

original: pa'i don dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas so //
analyzed: pa'i don dang zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung bas so //
translated: Those who understand the meaning of what is taught by the Tathagata...

original: dgongs pa'i rnam grangs kyi rtag pa gsungs pa yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad ces bya ba'i rtag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa gsung ba yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgongs pa'i rnam grangs kyi rtag pa gsungs pa yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad ces bya ba'i rtag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa gsung ba yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He proclaims the permanence of the transcendent state, and he proclaims the permanence of the teaching of nirvana.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum pa yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'char bar mdzad pas kun nas nyon mongs pa gsung pa ste /🔽kun nas nyon mongs pa gsung ba de yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum pa yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa ni kun nas nyon mongs pa 'char bar mdzad pas kun nas nyon mongs pa gsung pa ste / kun nas nyon mongs pa gsung ba de yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: He proclaims the arising of the three afflictions, and he proclaims the teaching of the afflictions.🔽He proclaims the teaching of the afflictions.

original: sdig pa'i chos rnams chad pa gsung ba yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: sdig pa'i chos rnams chad pa gsung ba yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: He proclaims the teaching of the cessation of evil dharmas.

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa dag ni mi bya ba yin pa /🔽mi bya bar gsung bas na mi bya bar gsung pa ste /
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa dag ni mi bya ba yin pa / mi bya bar gsung bas na mi bya bar gsung pa ste /
translated: Killing and so on are not to be done.🔽He proclaims what is not to be done.

original: mi bya bar gsung ba yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: mi bya bar gsung ba yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: He proclaims what is not to be done.

original: 'di ni log par lta ba can yin no zhes de skad gsungs pas na log par lta ba can yin par gsungs ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni log par lta ba can yin no zhes de skad gsungs pas na log par lta ba can yin par gsungs ba'o //
translated: He is a holder of wrong views, because he has said that.

original: log par lta ba can yin pa nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: log par lta ba can yin pa nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: He is a holder of wrong views, because he has admitted that.

original: gzhan la dad par mi mdzad pas na ma dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la dad par mi mdzad pas na ma dad pa yin te /
translated: He is without faith, because he has no faith in others.

original: de ltar na ma dad pa yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na ma dad pa yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: He is without faith, because he has admitted that.

original: byas pa mi shes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: byas pa mi shes pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa shes pa ste /
translated: He is ignorant of what has been done, because he knows nirvāṇa.

original: de ni ma byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It has not been done.

original: de ltar na byas pa mi shes pa yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na byas pa mi shes pa yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: He is ignorant of what has been done, because he has admitted that.

original: yang srid pa'i mtshams sbyor ba 'joms par mdzad bas na khyim 'bugs pa yin te /
analyzed: yang srid pa'i mtshams sbyor ba 'joms par mdzad bas na khyim 'bugs pa yin te /
translated: He is a house-breaker, because he destroys the connection with rebirth.

original: de ltar na khyim 'bugs pa yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na khyim 'bugs pa yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: He is a house-breaker, because he has admitted that.

original: bcom ldan 'das de ni skyugs pa bza' ba ste srid pa na skyugs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de ni skyugs pa bza' ba ste srid pa na skyugs pa ste /
translated: The Blessed One is one who eats vomit, because he eats the vomit of existence.

original: de spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de spangs pa yin no //
translated: He has abandoned that.

original: de ltar skyugs pa za ba yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar skyugs pa za ba yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he has taken the vow to eat vomit.

original: gang la khams gsum pa 'dir go skabs bcom pa yod pa de ni go skabs bcom pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la khams gsum pa 'dir go skabs bcom pa yod pa de ni go skabs bcom pa yin te /
translated: One who has destroyed the opportunity in this three-world existence has destroyed the opportunity.

original: de ltar na go skabs bcom pa yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na go skabs bcom pa yin par nyid zhal gyis 'che bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he has taken the vow to destroy the opportunity.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The Tathagata, etc.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bstan pa de dag la ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni bstan pa de dag la ste /
translated: The Tathagata has no such teachings,

original: rtag pa la sogs pa bstan pa de dag la med cing me snang ngo //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa bstan pa de dag la med cing me snang ngo //

analyzed: da ni de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs nas gsungs pa yin no //

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni @267b dgongs pa de gang gis te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni @267b dgongs pa de gang gis te /

translated: When he explains the intended meaning in his mind, he teaches the intended meaning so that sentient beings will understand that intended meaning and abandon their manifest conceit.

analyzed: yang na 'dod na ni zhes bya ba ni sgra ji bzhin gyi don ma yin pa nyid du'o //
translated: Or, if one wishes, it is not the literal meaning.

original: yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin ba'ang yin te zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' spangs nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin ba'ang yin te zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang chad pa'i mtha' spangs nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is neither existent nor nonexistent, because it is taught to avoid the extremes of eternalism and nihilism.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

translated: Because all these phenomena arise in dependence on causes. All these phenomena, such as formations, arise in dependence on causes such as ignorance.

original: de'i phyir 'di la bdag med cing zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la bdag med cing zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said in detail that “there is no self in this.”

analyzed: mi mos pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i nyes pa zhes bya ba ni mi dad pa'i gnas su gyur pa'i nyes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: brtsal ba nyams pa'i nyes pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i chos rnams la lhag par gnas pa nyams pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: chos la khong khro sgrib par 'gyur ba yin zhes bya ba ni chos la yang khong khro bar 'gyur zhing de la yang sgrib par 'gyur ro //
translated: the loss of the mind that delights in the Dharma.🔽The phrase “the loss of the mind that delights in” means🔽the loss of the mind that delights in the Dharma.

analyzed: kun du sbyor ba las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba ni kun du rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid la dgongs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
