original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams ni nyon mongs pa can rnams so //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams dang zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams ni nyon mongs pa can rnams so //
translated: “The phenomena of complete affliction” are the afflicted phenomena.

original: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i chos dge ba rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams la yang zhes bya ba ni rnam par byang ba'i chos dge ba rnams so //
translated: “The phenomena of complete purification” are the virtuous phenomena of complete purification.

original: med pa nyid du mtshan mar bzung nas zhes bya ba ni 'du shes kyis med pa nyid du mtshan mar bzung nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: med pa nyid du mtshan mar bzung nas zhes bya ba ni 'du shes kyis med pa nyid du mtshan mar bzung nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Having apprehended non-existence as a sign” means having apprehended non-existence with discrimination.

original: lta ba ma yin par lta ba zhes bya ba ni lta ba yod pa bzhin du mi lta'o zhes lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta'o //
analyzed: lta ba ma yin par lta ba zhes bya ba ni lta ba yod pa bzhin du mi lta'o zhes lta ba la lta ba ma yin par lta'o //
translated: “The view that it is not a view” is the view that a view is not a view, as if a view exists.

original: skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba ni skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba la sogs pa skur ba 'debs pa gsum po gang yin pa de dag ste /
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba zhes bya ba ni skur pa 'debs pa'i lta ba la sogs pa skur ba 'debs pa gsum po gang yin pa de dag ste /
translated: “The view that denies” is the three denials, such as the view that denies.

original: der lta ba ni skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: der lta ba ni skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: The view that it does not exist is the view that denies.

original: bdag gam gzhan gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag gam gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas @268a * //
analyzed: bdag gam gzhan gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag gam gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas @268a * //
translated: For the sake of self or other means that it is done for the sake of oneself or another.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the expression.

original: de ni bdag gam gzhan gyi phyir re zhig theg pa dman pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas ni bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni bdag gam gzhan gyi phyir re zhig theg pa dman pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas ni bstan pa yin no //
translated: The teaching is given by the words for the sake of self or other, one should not resort to the inferior vehicle, and so on.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i lta ba'i tshul nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa de gnyi ga yang 'di la yod pa 'di ni nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i lta ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i lta ba'i tshul nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa de gnyi ga yang 'di la yod pa 'di ni nges par 'byin pa ma yin pa'i lta ba'o //
translated: The view that is taught is not a means of emancipation. The view that is not a means of emancipation is present in both of these views.

original: thag ring du zhes bya ba ni rgyang ring du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thag ring du zhes bya ba ni rgyang ring du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Far away means at a great distance.

original: ston pa zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ston pa zhes bya ba ni gsal bar byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Teacher means one who makes clear.

original: bkur sti byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gang zhig med par lta ba de la brten pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gang zhig med par lta ba de la brten pa'o //
translated: One does not honor means one does not rely on the view that denies the existence of that.

original: chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las ci 'dra ba zhig dus tshad med par sgrib pa yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyis phongs par 'gyur ba'i las ci 'dra ba zhig dus tshad med par sgrib pa yongs su 'dzin par byed pa ste /
translated: What is the action of being deprived of the Dharma? It is the action of taking up the obscurations for a long time.

original: dus tshad med par sgrib pa yongs su 'dzin par byed pas na dus tshad med par sgrib pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: dus tshad med par sgrib pa yongs su 'dzin par byed pas na dus tshad med par sgrib pa yongs su 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is the action of taking up the obscurations for a long time.

original: dus tshad med par sgrib pa yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'i las dang 'jig rten kun du sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: dus tshad med par sgrib pa yongs su 'dzin par byed pa'i las dang 'jig rten kun du sbyor bar byed do //
translated: It is the action of being bound to the world for a long time.

original: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni de la mi skye ba'i chos ni brgyad de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos la bzod pa 'thob bo zhes bya ba ni de la mi skye ba'i chos ni brgyad de / 'di lta ste /
translated: The acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas is the acceptance of the non-arising of the eight dharmas.🔽What are the eight dharmas?

original: 'khor ba gzod ma nas mi skye ba'i chos ni 'khor bar sngon skyes skyes pa gang dag yin pa'i chos de dag kho na mi skye ba dang / 'khor bar sngon gang dag ma skyes pa nga'i chos kyi tshul sngon ma byung ba rnams kyang mi skye ba dang /
analyzed: 'khor ba gzod ma nas mi skye ba'i chos ni 'khor bar sngon skyes skyes pa gang dag yin pa'i chos de dag kho na mi skye ba dang / 'khor bar sngon gang dag ma skyes pa nga'i chos kyi tshul sngon ma byung ba rnams kyang mi skye ba dang /
translated: The non-arising of samsara is the non-arising of those dharmas that have already arisen in samsara, and the non-arising of those dharmas that have not yet arisen in samsara, which have not appeared in the way of the Dharma before.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rang gi mtshan nyid kyis mi skye ba dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rang gis mi skye ba dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid dngos po gzhan du mi skye ba dang / dgra bcom pa la phyis kun nas nyon mongs pa mi skye ba dang /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid rang gi mtshan nyid kyis mi skye ba dang / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid rang gis mi skye ba dang / yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid dngos po gzhan du mi skye ba dang / dgra bcom pa la phyis kun nas nyon mongs pa mi skye ba dang /
translated: The non-arising of the imagined reality by virtue of its own characteristic, the non-arising of the other-dependent reality by virtue of its own nature, the non-arising of the reality of the perfected by virtue of being another entity, the non-arising of the afflictions in the arhat after his enlightenment,

original: sangs rgyas dang chos kyi sku rnams la khyad par du mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos kyi sku rnams la khyad par du mi skye ba ste /
translated: and the non-arising of the special qualities of the Buddha and the Dharma Body.

original: mi skye ba'i chos brgyad po 'di dag la bzod pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: mi skye ba'i chos brgyad po 'di dag la bzod pa 'thob bo //
translated: One attains the acceptance that these eight dharmas are non-arisen.

original: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba nyid ni rang gi dngos po yongs su gtong ba nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba nyid ni rang gi dngos po yongs su gtong ba nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The complete giving of all possessions is synonymous with the complete giving of one’s own body.

original: rgyu ci zhig gis na bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ci zhig gis na bdog pa thams cad yongs su gtong ba yin zhe na /
translated: By what cause does one give all possessions?

original: lta ba spangs pas te /
analyzed: lta ba spangs pas te /
translated: By abandoning views.

original: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir lta ba yongs su spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with completely abandoning the views of “I” and “mine.”

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzugs na spyod pa'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa nyid ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi gzugs na spyod pa'i tshul khrims yongs su dag pa yin no //
translated: The purity of morality itself is the purity of morality of the bodhisattvas in the form realm.

original: rgyu ci zhig gis na de rnams kyi de yongs su dag pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu ci zhig gis na de rnams kyi de yongs su dag pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: By what cause is that purity of theirs?

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu zhi bas te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu zhi bas te /
translated: By the pacification of all addictions.

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims @268b kun nas slong bar byed pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims @268b kun nas slong bar byed pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: by the abandonment of the addictions of the desire realm which instigate immorality.

original: bzod pa'i stobs dang ldan pa nyid ni rgyu gang gis na byang chub sems dpa' bzod pa'i stobs dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: bzod pa'i stobs dang ldan pa nyid ni rgyu gang gis na byang chub sems dpa' bzod pa'i stobs dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: By what cause is the bodhisattva endowed with the power of patience?

original: chos la 'jug pas te /
analyzed: chos la 'jug pas te /
translated: By the penetration of the Dharma.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid rtogs pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i chos nyid rtogs pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: by the realization of the reality of dependent origination.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid ni rgyu gang gis na byang chub sems dpa' rnams brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid ni rgyu gang gis na byang chub sems dpa' rnams brtson 'grus brtsams pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of the bodhisattvas’ undertaking of effort?

original: dben ba'i chos la mos pa ste /
analyzed: dben ba'i chos la mos pa ste /
translated: It is the faith in the Dharma of solitude.

original: stong pa nyid kyi chos la mos pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi chos la mos pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the faith in the Dharma of emptiness.

original: de rnams kyi sems ni de la mos pas rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i stobs skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sems ni de la mos pas rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i stobs skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Their minds, which are faithful to that, generate the power of nondistraction.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bzhi po gzhan dag dang yang ldan no zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bzhi po gzhan dag dang yang ldan no zhes rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: The bodhisattvas also have the other four.

original: rgyu gang gis na byams pa chen po zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis na byams pa chen po zhes bya zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of their great love?

original: sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su skyob pa nyid kyis te /
translated: It is the protection of all sentient beings.

original: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis bdag gis sems can 'di dag thams cad yongs su bskyab par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis bdag gis sems can 'di dag thams cad yongs su bskyab par bya ba yin no //
translated: By the method of etymological interpretation, they think, “I must protect all these sentient beings.”

original: rgyu gang gis na snying rje chen po yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis na snying rje chen po yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of their great compassion?

original: 'khor ba las yongs su mi skyo ba nyid kyis te /
analyzed: 'khor ba las yongs su mi skyo ba nyid kyis te /
translated: It is the non-discouragement with regard to cyclic existence.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'khor ba las yongs su mi skyo'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'khor ba las yongs su mi skyo'o //
translated: Bodhisattvas are not completely disgusted with cyclic existence.

original: rgyu gang gis na dga' ba chen po yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis na dga' ba chen po yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it great delight?

original: chos la dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba nyid kyis te /🔽chos la dga' ba yang yin la rab tu dga' ba yang yin pas dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba'o //
analyzed: chos la dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba nyid kyis te / chos la dga' ba yang yin la rab tu dga' ba yang yin pas dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba'o //
translated: It is the delight and joy in the Dharma.🔽Delight and joy are delight and joy.

original: chos rnams la dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bas na chos la dga' ba dang rab tu dga' bas te des so //
analyzed: chos rnams la dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' bas na chos la dga' ba dang rab tu dga' bas te des so //
translated: It is delight and joy in the Dharma, and it is by means of that.

original: 'dir yang 'di ltar yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'di ltar yang shes par bya ste /
translated: Here, it should be understood as follows:

original: gal te dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba yin la /🔽bde ba yin yang dga' ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni yid bde ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig kho na la bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba yin la / bde ba yin yang dga' ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni yid bde ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig kho na la bya'o //
translated: If it is delight and joy,🔽then it is pleasure.🔽But delight is to be understood as a certain specific kind of mental pleasure.

original: rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i khyad par gang yin pa de yang yid bde ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig yin te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba zhes bya ba'i khyad par gang yin pa de yang yid bde ba'i khyad par 'ga' zhig yin te /
translated: And joy is to be understood as a certain specific kind of mental pleasure.

original: mdo las rab tu dga' ba las dga' ba skye ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las rab tu dga' ba las dga' ba skye ba'i phyir ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a sutra declares, “because joy arises from supreme joy.

original: rgyu gang gis ni btang snyoms chen po yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis ni btang snyoms chen po yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of great equanimity?

original: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba spangs pas te /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba spangs pas te /
translated: It is the abandonment of attachment and anger,

original: de gnyis ka spangs pas btang snyoms la gnas pa yin no //🔽mdo sde gzhan gyi khyad par gzhan mang po dag las zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gzhan dag gi mdo sde'i @269a * //
analyzed: de gnyis ka spangs pas btang snyoms la gnas pa yin no // mdo sde gzhan gyi khyad par gzhan mang po dag las zhes bya ba ni mdo sde gzhan dag gi mdo sde'i @269a * //
translated: because one who has abandoned both of them abides in equanimity.🔽In other sutras, there are many other distinctive features.

original: khyad par de dag las mdo sde'i tshig gang dag 'byung ba de dag ni mdo sde gzhan gyi khyad par te /
analyzed: khyad par de dag las mdo sde'i tshig gang dag 'byung ba de dag ni mdo sde gzhan gyi khyad par te /
translated: The words of other sutras are distinctive features of other sutras.

original: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu yin no //
translated: They are like the statement, “All phenomena are essenceless.

original: dgongs pa med par mkhas pa su zhig smra bar byed do //
analyzed: dgongs pa med par mkhas pa su zhig smra bar byed do //
translated: What wise person would say that without intending anything?

original: 'dir dgongs pa ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med /
analyzed: 'dir dgongs pa ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med /
translated: Here, the intended meaning is that there is essencelessness in terms of characteristic,

original: skye ba ngo bo nyid med don dam ngo bo nyid med do zhes ngas bshad de zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: skye ba ngo bo nyid med don dam ngo bo nyid med do zhes ngas bshad de zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: I have explained that the imaginary nature is the identity-unreality, the relative nature is the production-unreality, and the perfect nature is the ultimate-unreality.

original: de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa ni kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa ni kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: Among them, the identity-unreality is the imaginary nature.

original: skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi'o //
analyzed: skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi'o //
translated: The production-unreality is the relative nature.

original: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i'o //🔽mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ba nas /
analyzed: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i'o // mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ba nas /
translated: The ultimate-unreality is the perfect nature.

original: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med ces bya ba'i bar gyi yi ge'i don ci zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med ces bya ba'i bar gyi yi ge'i don ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the syllables in the passage from “identity-unreality” up to “ultimate-unreality”?

original: rang gi dngos po ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi dngos po ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Own-state is identity.

original: 'di la ngo bo nyid med pas ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la ngo bo nyid med pas ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: Since this does not exist, it is identity-unreality.

original: de'i dngos po ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa ste /🔽mtshan nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa ste / mtshan nyid gzugs la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'o //
translated: Its state is the production-unreality.🔽The identity of the characteristics such as form is the identity-unreality.

original: de'i dngos po ni mtshan nyid med pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni mtshan nyid med pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi'o //
translated: Its state is the ultimate-unreality.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gang las skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gang las skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa ste /
translated: The other-dependent is the lack of essential nature in terms of origination.

original: de'i dngos po ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: Its reality is the lack of essential nature in terms of origination.

original: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa de ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa de ni don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: The ultimate lack of essential nature is the lack of essential nature in terms of the ultimate.

original: de yang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dag ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid dag ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid mi mthun pa nyid yin no //
translated: Moreover, the other-dependent natures are the lack of essential nature in terms of the characteristics of object and subject, which are discordant characteristics.

original: de ltar byas na chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na chos rnams ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, phenomena are without essential nature.

original: gang dag ngo bo nyid med pa de dag ni ma skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag ngo bo nyid med pa de dag ni ma skyes pa yin no //
translated: Those that are without essential nature are unoriginated.

original: gang dag ma skyes pa de dag ni ma 'gags pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag ma skyes pa de dag ni ma 'gags pa yin no //
translated: Those that are unoriginated are unceased.

original: gang dag ma 'gags pa de dag ni gzod ma nas zhi ba yin no //
analyzed: gang dag ma 'gags pa de dag ni gzod ma nas zhi ba yin no //
translated: Those that are unceased are primordially peaceful.

original: gang dag gzod ma nas zhi ba de dag ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes rab tu bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang dag gzod ma nas zhi ba de dag ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes rab tu bstan pa yin no //
translated: Those that are primordially peaceful are naturally liberated.

original: de dag brtags pa bzhin du med //
analyzed: de dag brtags pa bzhin du med //
translated: They do not exist as they are imagined.

original: ces bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba de dag byis pa rnams kyis ji ltar brtags pa de ltar med do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba de dag byis pa rnams kyis ji ltar brtags pa de ltar med do //
translated: As such, the mind and mental factors do not exist as they are imagined by the childish.

original: de dag med pa 'ong ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag brjod du med pa'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: de dag med pa 'ong ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de dag brjod du med pa'i ngo bor ro //
translated: And their nonexistence does not come about, i.e., they are not nonexistent in the nature of the inexpressible.

original: gal te chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med par gyur na /
translated: If all things are essenceless,🔽then this error would arise:

original: dngos po thams cad med pa'i phyir //🔽kun nas nyon mongs dag pa med //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad med pa'i phyir // kun nas nyon mongs dag pa med //
translated: Because all things would be nonexistent,

original: ces bya ba'i skyon 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i skyon 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: there would be neither affliction nor purity.

original: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes pa //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad ma skyes pa //
translated: All things are unarisen

original: zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'dus byas rnams so //
translated: means all conditioned things.

original: gal te kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad ma @269b skyes pa yin na ci la brten nas rnam par rtog pa skye zhe na /
analyzed: gal te kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis chos thams cad ma @269b skyes pa yin na ci la brten nas rnam par rtog pa skye zhe na /
translated: If all things are unarisen by the imaginary nature, on what basis do conceptual thoughts arise?

original: gzhan gyi dbang la zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang la zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The root text states, “They arise in dependence on the dependent nature.”

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la brten nas rnam par rtog pa ste der rnam par rig pa skye'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la brten nas rnam par rtog pa ste der rnam par rig pa skye'o //
translated: Conceptual thoughts, i.e., the representations of those objects, arise in dependence on the dependent nature.

original: nam zhig gzhan gyi dbang dag ste /
analyzed: nam zhig gzhan gyi dbang dag ste /
translated: When the other-dependent is purified,

original: ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rnam par rtog dang bral ba na //
analyzed: rnam par rtog dang bral ba na //
translated: It is free from conceptualization.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po dang bral ba'o //🔽shin tu gyur pa de bzhin nyid la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po dang bral ba'o // shin tu gyur pa de bzhin nyid la gnas pa'o //
translated: It is free from the nature of the grasped and the grasper.🔽It is the transformation of the basis, and it is the reality realm.

original: de lta bu ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid shin tu gyur pa dang de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni gzhan gyi dbang gi mtshan nyid shin tu gyur pa dang de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid la gnas pa yin no //
translated: This is the other-dependent nature as the transformation of the basis and as the reality realm.

original: phyi rol don mthong brtags na ni //
analyzed: phyi rol don mthong brtags na ni //
translated: When the other-dependent is examined,

original: phyi rol gyi don gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa mthong na ste dmigs na brtags pa ni ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa mthong na ste dmigs na brtags pa ni ste /
translated: When the external object is seen, that is, when form, sound, etc., are perceived, it is examined.

original: brtags par bya ba gang yin pa ni kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: brtags par bya ba gang yin pa ni kun du brtags pa'i rang bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that what is to be examined is the imagined nature.

original: gzhan gyi dbang ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang ni /
translated: The other-dependent is

original: rtogs pa gang gis rtog byed pa //🔽zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa gang gis rtog byed pa // zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The imagination that imagines that.🔽This is the other-dependent nature as the transformation of the basis and as the reality realm.

original: phyi rol don mthong log pa ste //
analyzed: phyi rol don mthong log pa ste //
translated: The external object is seen as false.

original: zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni phyi rol gyi don gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa mthong ba ni log pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni phyi rol gyi don gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa mthong ba ni log pa yin no //
translated: The passage from “The seeing of external objects such as form, sound, etc. is false” is the refutation of the existence of external objects.

original: ji ltar log pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar log pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it false?

original: 'di ltar gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i don med kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa'i don med kyi /
translated: Because there are no external objects such as form, sound, etc.

original: de ni sems 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: de ni sems 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: It is only mind.

original: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa snang ba'i rnam par rig pa tsam skye'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra la sogs pa snang ba'i rnam par rig pa tsam skye'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that a mere representation of form, sound, etc. arises.

original: de ltar / rigs pas rnam par gzhigs na ni //
analyzed: de ltar / rigs pas rnam par gzhigs na ni //
translated: Thus, “When analyzed by reason,

original: gzung ba dang ni 'dzin ba 'gag / ces bya ba ni gzung ba gang yin pa dang / 'dzin pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga spangs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽ji ltar byis pas brtags pa ltar //
analyzed: gzung ba dang ni 'dzin ba 'gag / ces bya ba ni gzung ba gang yin pa dang / 'dzin pa gang yin pa de gnyi ga spangs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // ji ltar byis pas brtags pa ltar //
translated: the apprehended and the apprehender cease.” The meaning is that both the apprehended and the apprehender are abandoned.🔽As it is said,

original: phyi rol gyi ni don med do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi ni don med do //
translated: “There are no external objects as imagined by the childish.”

original: gal te phyi rol gyi don med na ji ltar der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye zhe na /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi don med na ji ltar der snang ba'i rnam par shes pa skye zhe na /
translated: If there are no external objects, how does a consciousness appearing as those arise?

original: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
analyzed: bag chags kyis ni dkrugs pa'i sems //
translated: “The mind disturbed by the imprints”

original: don du snang ba shin tu 'byung //
analyzed: don du snang ba shin tu 'byung //
translated: In reality, it is the appearance of the object.

original: rnam par rig pa'i bag chags kyis dkrugs pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i bag chags kyis dkrugs pa ste /
translated: It is disturbed by the latent impressions of representations.

original: bsgos pa'i sems kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rab tu 'byung ngo //
analyzed: bsgos pa'i sems kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rab tu 'byung ngo //
translated: The consciousness that enters the ālaya consciousness, which is the consciousness infused with the latent impressions, arises.

original: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la de ltar bsgos pas gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bas na kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la de ltar bsgos pas gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, the meaning is that the consciousness that enters, which apprehends forms and so on, arises because it is infused in the ālaya consciousness in that way.

original: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni rgyu yin la /
translated: In that regard, the ālaya consciousness is the cause.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba'i 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni bdag po'i rkyen yin no //
translated: The simultaneously arising consciousness that enters is the dominant condition.

original: bshad pa 'di dag thams @270a * //
analyzed: bshad pa 'di dag thams @270a * //
translated: The meaning of all these explanations

original: cad kyi don gyi mtshams sbyar ba ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: cad kyi don gyi mtshams sbyar ba ni mi rung ste /
translated: is not connected.

original: kha cig theg pa chen po'i mdo sde kha cig las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig theg pa chen po'i mdo sde kha cig las 'byung ngo //
translated: Some say it is found in some Mahāyāna sūtras.

original: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i mdo sde zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang / gzugs can snying po bsu ba dang / mi'i mdo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la sogs pa'i mdo sde zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid dang / gzugs can snying po bsu ba dang / mi'i mdo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sutras of emptiness and so on are the sutras of emptiness, the sutra of the welcome guest, the sutra of man, and so on.

original: srid pa bar mdo dang ldan pa'i mdo sde gang dag ce na /
analyzed: srid pa bar mdo dang ldan pa'i mdo sde gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the sutras that teach the intermediate existence?

original: srid pa bdun zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ste /🔽srid pa bdun zhes bya ba'i mdo dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i mdo dang / 'gro ba'i mdo dang mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo sde zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i mdo sde rnams ni sa ston pa'i sde la sogs pa rnams kyis khas mi len te /
analyzed: srid pa bdun zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ste / srid pa bdun zhes bya ba'i mdo dang / phyir mi 'ong ba'i mdo dang / 'gro ba'i mdo dang mngal du 'jug pa'i mdo sde zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i mdo sde rnams ni sa ston pa'i sde la sogs pa rnams kyis khas mi len te /
translated: The sutras of the seven existences and so on.🔽The sutras of the seven existences, the sutra of the nonreturner, the sutra of the reincarnating being, and the sutra of entry into the womb are not accepted by the sects of the Sthaviravadins, such as the Mahishasakas, the Kaurukullas, the Avantaka, the VatsIputriyas, the Dharmaguptakas, and the MahiSasakas.

original: sa ston pa'i sde dang / chos srung ba'i sde dang / 'od srungs kyi sde la sogs pa de rnams kyis khas mi len pas de dag sangs rgyas kyi gsung du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa ston pa'i sde dang / chos srung ba'i sde dang / 'od srungs kyi sde la sogs pa de rnams kyis khas mi len pas de dag sangs rgyas kyi gsung du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since they are not accepted by the sects of the Sthaviravadins, such as the Mahishasakas, the sutras of the seven existences and so on are not the word of the Buddha.

original: sde pha phan tshun tha dad pa'i mdo sde gang dag yin pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sde pha phan tshun tha dad pa'i mdo sde gang dag yin pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The sutras that are not accepted by the sects are the sutras of the seven existences and so on.

original: chos kyi phyag rgya'i mdo dang / 'gro ba'i mdo sde la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi phyag rgya'i mdo dang / 'gro ba'i mdo sde la sogs pa'o //
translated: the Dharmamudrā Sūtra, the Lokaprajñapti Sūtra, etc.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung mtha' dag ni deng song mi snang ngo zhes de skad kyang bstan zin to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung mtha' dag ni deng song mi snang ngo zhes de skad kyang bstan zin to //
translated: We have already shown that the entire teaching of the Buddha is no longer extant.

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung gang mi snang ba de ni slob dpon gyi rigs 'gas kyang yongs su ma bzung bas de dag sangs rgyas kyi gsung du mi 'gyur ro //🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung gang mi snang ba de ni slob dpon gyi rigs 'gas kyang yongs su ma bzung bas de dag sangs rgyas kyi gsung du mi 'gyur ro // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: That which is not the teaching of the Buddha is not accepted by any of the schools.

original: de sangs rgyas kyi gsung yin zhe na /
analyzed: de sangs rgyas kyi gsung yin zhe na /
translated: How do you know that it is the teaching of the Buddha?

original: chen po bstan pa tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chen po bstan pa tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the teaching of the Buddha, it is authoritative.

original: 'di ltar mdo las chen po bstan pa tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo las chen po bstan pa tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: The sūtras say, “The teaching of the great vehicle is authoritative.

original: nag po bstan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nag po bstan pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not the teaching of Māra.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How do we know this?

original: rgya cher gsungs nas /
analyzed: rgya cher gsungs nas /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: 'di la kun dga' bo dge slong zhig 'ongs nas de 'di skad ces /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di la kun dga' bo dge slong zhig 'ongs nas de 'di skad ces / 'di lta ste /
translated: ‘Ānanda, if a monk comes and says,

original: 'di ni chos yin /
analyzed: 'di ni chos yin /
translated: “This is the Dharma,

original: 'di ni 'dul ba yin /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dul ba yin /
translated: this is the Vinaya,

original: 'di ni ston pa'i bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ston pa'i bstan pa yin te /
translated: this is the Teacher’s teaching,”

original: bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du thos shing mngon sum du bzung ba yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das las mngon sum du thos shing mngon sum du bzung ba yin no zhes zer na /
translated: I have heard it directly from the Blessed One and I have taken it up directly.”

original: dge slong de'i bshad pa de la spro bar yang mi bya zhing smad par yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong de'i bshad pa de la spro bar yang mi bya zhing smad par yang mi bya'o //
translated: The monk should neither praise nor disparage the explanation of that monk.

original: spro bar yang ma byas shing smad par yang ma byas par mdo sde la 'jug par bya /
analyzed: spro bar yang ma byas shing smad par yang ma byas par mdo sde la 'jug par bya /
translated: Without praising or disparaging it, he should apply it to the sūtras.

original: 'dul ba la snang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba la snang bar bya'o //
translated: He should illuminate it in the Vinaya.

original: chos nyid dang mthun par bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyid dang mthun par bya'o //
translated: He should bring it into accord with reality.

original: gal te mdo sde la 'jug par byas /
analyzed: gal te mdo sde la 'jug par byas /
translated: If, when he applies it to the sūtras,

original: 'dul ba la snang bar byas pa las /
analyzed: 'dul ba la snang bar byas pa las /
translated: illuminates it in the Vinaya,🔽and brings it into accord with reality,

original: mdo sde la mi 'jug /'dul ba la mi snang /
analyzed: mdo sde la mi 'jug /'dul ba la mi snang /
translated: it does not fit with the sūtras, does not illuminate the Vinaya,

original: chos nyid dang mi mthun par /
analyzed: chos nyid dang mi mthun par /
translated: and is not in accord with reality,

original: dge slong de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa gor ma chag par chos 'di dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs ba ma @270b yin zhing tshe dang ldan pa nyid kyis nye bar bzung ba yin te /
analyzed: dge slong de la 'di skad ces tshe dang ldan pa gor ma chag par chos 'di dag ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs ba ma @270b yin zhing tshe dang ldan pa nyid kyis nye bar bzung ba yin te /
translated: then that monk should say to him, ‘Venerable, this is certainly not something that the Blessed One has said. It is something that you have taken up.

original: 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni mdo sde la 'jug par byas /
analyzed: 'di ltar chos 'di dag ni mdo sde la 'jug par byas /
translated: Because when you apply it to the sūtras,

original: 'dul ba la snang bar byas pa las /
analyzed: 'dul ba la snang bar byas pa las /
translated: The Vinaya is illuminated by the Sūtra.

original: mdo sde la mi 'jug /'dul ba la mi snang /🔽chos nyid dang mi mthun pas 'di ni chos ma yin /🔽'di ni 'dul ba ma yin /
analyzed: mdo sde la mi 'jug /'dul ba la mi snang / chos nyid dang mi mthun pas 'di ni chos ma yin / 'di ni 'dul ba ma yin /
translated: If it does not enter into the Sūtra, if it does not appear in the Vinaya,🔽if it is not in conformity with the nature of things, one should understand that this is not the Dharma, this is not the Vinaya,🔽this is not the Master’s doctrine.

original: 'di ni ston pa'i bstan pa ma yin no snyam du shes par bya ste dor bar bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ston pa'i bstan pa ma yin no snyam du shes par bya ste dor bar bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should reject it.

original: 'o na 'phags pa'i bden pa'i mdo sde la 'jug pa ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'o na 'phags pa'i bden pa'i mdo sde la 'jug pa ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: But, one would say, the Sūtra of the Four Truths enters into the Sūtra,

original: rgya cher gsungs nas /
analyzed: rgya cher gsungs nas /
translated: for the Fortunate One said:

original: dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dag go //
analyzed: dge slong dag bzhi po 'di dag ni 'phags pa'i bden pa dag go //
translated: “Monks, these four noble truths are the noble truths of suffering, of the origin of suffering, of the cessation of suffering, of the path which leads to the cessation of suffering.”

original: bzhi po gang dag ce na /
analyzed: bzhi po gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the four?

original: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / kun 'byung ba dang / sdug bsngal 'gog pa dang / sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: The noble truth of suffering, of the origin of suffering, of the cessation of suffering, of the path which leads to the cessation of suffering.

original: nyon mongs pa 'dul ba la snang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa 'dul ba ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa 'dul ba la snang zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa 'dul ba ni nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po gang yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase “in order to subdue the mental afflictions” means that the Mahāyāna is the antidote to the mental afflictions.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid dang mi mthun pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes bya ba'i chos nyid dang mi mthun pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos nyid dang mi mthun pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni 'di yod pas 'di 'byung zhes bya ba'i chos nyid dang mi mthun pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase “it is not contrary to the principle of dependent origination” means that it is not contrary to the principle that “when this exists, that comes to be.”

original: gal te 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you object that the Mahāyāna is not the Buddha’s word because it contradicts the nature of reality,

original: nyes pa de ni sngar bsal zin to //
analyzed: nyes pa de ni sngar bsal zin to //
translated: we have already refuted that fault.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How have we done so?

original: gal te de lta bu'i rang bzhin dang 'gal ba'i phyir theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi gsung ma yin na khyed la grags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung gang yin pa gzhan yang de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta bu'i rang bzhin dang 'gal ba'i phyir theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi gsung ma yin na khyed la grags pa'i sangs rgyas kyi gsung gang yin pa gzhan yang de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi gsung du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the Mahāyāna is not the Buddha’s word because it contradicts the nature of reality, then the Buddha’s word that you accept would also not be the Buddha’s word.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Because it contradicts the nature of reality.

original: de lta bu'i tshig rnams ni zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa de lta bu'i rnam pa'i tshig rnams so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshig rnams ni zhes bya ba ni chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa de lta bu'i rnam pa'i tshig rnams so //
translated: Such words as “all phenomena are essenceless” are words of that kind.

original: rang bzhin gyis mig skyon can du gyur pa dag la zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis mig skyon can du gyur pa dag la'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mig skyon can du gyur pa dag la zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis mig skyon can du gyur pa dag la'o //
translated: To those whose eyes are naturally defective means to those whose eyes are naturally defective.

original: de med pa nyid yin pa dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de dag la der 'dzin pa bsal ba'i phyir gzugs de med pa nyid yin par bstan pa de dang 'dra'o //🔽mgo smos pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni gang dag don rnam par ma phye ba mi rtogs pa de dag ni mgo smos pa mi shes pa ste /🔽mgo smos pa mi shes pa de rnams brjod du med pa'i chos gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de med pa nyid yin pa dang 'dra bar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de dag la der 'dzin pa bsal ba'i phyir gzugs de med pa nyid yin par bstan pa de dang 'dra'o // mgo smos pa mi shes pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni gang dag don rnam par ma phye ba mi rtogs pa de dag ni mgo smos pa mi shes pa ste / mgo smos pa mi shes pa de rnams brjod du med pa'i chos gang yin pa ste /
translated: Just as that nonexistence of form is taught in order to eliminate the apprehension of form as existing in those whose eyes are defective, so too is the nonexistence of the object of negation taught in order to eliminate the apprehension of true existence.🔽Those who do not understand the mere mention of the name are those who do not understand the meaning without an explanation.

original: brjod du med @271a * //
analyzed: brjod du med @271a * //
translated: Those who do not understand the mere mention of the name are those who do not understand the inexpressible phenomenon without an explanation.

original: pa'i ngo bo'i chos de med par 'dzin ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo'i chos de med par 'dzin ba bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to eliminate the apprehension of the non-existence of that dharma which is the nature of the perfected.🔽Thus, the extreme of superimposition for some, etc.

original: de ltar na kha cig gi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar bstan pa de ltar na kha cig gi sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' ni sgro 'dogs pa nyid mtha' yin pas sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: de ltar na kha cig gi zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni ji ltar bstan pa de ltar na kha cig gi sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' ni sgro 'dogs pa nyid mtha' yin pas sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' ste /
translated: The extreme of superimposition is the superimposition itself, because it is an extreme.

original: kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: kun du brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'dzin pa gang yin pa de spangs pa yin no //
translated: That which is the apprehension of the imagined nature is eliminated.

original: kha cig gi skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' ni skur pa nyid mtha' yin te /
analyzed: kha cig gi skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' ni skur pa nyid mtha' yin te /
translated: The extreme of denial for some is the denial itself, because it is an extreme.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la skur pa 'debs pa spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la skur pa 'debs pa spangs pa yin no //
translated: That which is the denial of the dependent nature is eliminated.

original: smos pa'i rnam pa bstan pa ni don rnam par ma phye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: smos pa'i rnam pa bstan pa ni don rnam par ma phye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of the terms is the teaching without differentiating the meaning.

original: mdor bsdus pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni gang zag cig 'jig rten du 'byung ba na zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus pa'o //

original: de'i don rjes su mthun pa nyid ni mi mthun pa med pa'i don du de bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i don rjes su mthun pa nyid ni mi mthun pa med pa'i don du de bstan par rig par bya'o //

original: dgongs pa sna tshogs kyi thabs te /
analyzed: dgongs pa sna tshogs kyi thabs te /

analyzed: dgongs pa sna tshogs kyi thabs de dang mthun pa nyid du mgo smos pa'i rnam pa bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: bsgrim pa drag pos de kho na nyid rtogs pa ni bsgrim pa drag pos de kho na nyid rtogs pa ste /

analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa nyid la ni gzung bar bya ste /

original: de'i phyir de dag las grol bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag las grol bar bya'o //

analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhi po de dag la yang sems nye bar gzhag par gnas shing byang chub kyi bar yan lag bdun yang bsgoms nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'chang rgya bar 'gyur ba 'di ni
translated: And they abide in the four establishments of mindfulness, and having cultivated the seven factors of enlightenment, they will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gnas yod do zhes 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gnas yod do zhes 'byung ba yin te /
translated: This is possible.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams dang nyan thos rnams su rnam par thar pa'i thabs mtshungs par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams dang nyan thos rnams su rnam par thar pa'i thabs mtshungs par bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the methods of liberation of the buddhas and śrāvakas are taught to be the same.

original: dgra bcom pa'i mdo las kyang rgya cher gsungs nas /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i mdo las kyang rgya cher gsungs nas /
translated: The Arhat Sūtra also says extensively:

original: dge slong dag gzugs la yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / len pa med par rnam par thar pa las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag gzugs la yid 'byung ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / len pa med par rnam par thar pa las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Monks, one who is disgusted with form, who is free from attachment, who has stopped, and who has taken nothing up is called a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly awakened buddha.

original: dge slong dag tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / len pa med par rnam par thar pa las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / len pa med par rnam par thar pa las de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so zhes bya'o //
translated: “Monks, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One is so called because of his disenchantment, freedom from attachment, cessation, and non-grasping in relation to feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness.

original: dge slong dag dge slong yang gzugs la skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / len pa med par rnam par thar pa las dgra bcom pa shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong yang gzugs la skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / len pa med par rnam par thar pa las dgra bcom pa shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: “Monks, a monk is called an arhat liberated by wisdom because of his disenchantment, freedom from attachment, cessation, and non-grasping in relation to form.

original: dge slong dag / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / len pa med par rnam par thar ba las dgra bcom pa shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la skyo ba dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / 'gog pa dang / len pa med par rnam par thar ba las dgra bcom pa shes rab kyis rnam par grol ba zhes bya'o //
translated: “Monks, one who is disenchanted with feeling, perception, volitional formations, and consciousness, who is dispassionate toward them, who is released from them, and who does not grasp anything, is called an arhat liberated by wisdom.

original: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams su rnam par grol ba'i thabs mtshungs par bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: de ltar na sangs rgyas rnams dang / nyan thos rnams su rnam par grol ba'i thabs mtshungs par bstan pa yin no /
translated: Thus, the liberation of the Buddhas and the liberation of the disciples are taught to be the same.

original: // / rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa /
analyzed: // / rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of the rational system of exposition

original: bam po bcu gsum pa / sang rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba ni khyad par yod de /
analyzed: bam po bcu gsum pa / sang rgyas rnams kyi rnam par grol ba ni khyad par yod de /
translated: The liberation of the Buddhas is distinguished.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa las ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have abandoned the afflictions together with their traces, and because they have abandoned the obstructions to the knowable.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni @274b nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnams spangs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis ni @274b nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa rnams spangs pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the Bhagavān Buddhas have abandoned the afflictions along with their traces,

original: dgra bcom pa rnams kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa rnams kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: but the Arhats have not.

original: 'di ltar gnas brtan mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa pi lin da bat+sas chu bo gang g'a la dmangs mo sdod cig ces gsungs nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnas brtan mngon par shes pa drug dang ldan pa pi lin da bat+sas chu bo gang g'a la dmangs mo sdod cig ces gsungs nas /
translated: Thus, the elder Pūrṇa, who possessed the six higher knowledges, said to a low-caste woman on the bank of the Ganges, “Stop!”

original: yang dmangs mo bzod pa gyis shig ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dmangs mo bzod pa gyis shig ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Then he said, “Be patient!”

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa las kyang yin te /
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pa las kyang yin te /
translated: They also abandon the obscurations to omniscience,

original: shes bya thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they fully and completely awaken to all aspects of all objects of knowledge.

original: thabs kyi khyad par yang yod de /
analyzed: thabs kyi khyad par yang yod de /
translated: There is also a difference in method,

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa la khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa la khyad par yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is a difference in the foundations of mindfulness and so on.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba dang / dbang bo dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi phyir ro //🔽sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni mtshungs pa nyid kyang yod pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang yang dag par spong ba dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang ba dang / dbang bo dang / stobs dang / byang chub kyi yan lag la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi phyir ro // sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni mtshungs pa nyid kyang yod pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: because of the distinctions of the applications of mindfulness, right efforts, bases of supernatural power, faculties, powers, limbs of enlightenment, etc.

original: mtshungs pa nyid ni ji ltar nyan thos rnams kyi nyon mongs pa phra rgyas dang bcas pa spangs pa yin pa ltar sangs rgyas kyi yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid ni ji ltar nyan thos rnams kyi nyon mongs pa phra rgyas dang bcas pa spangs pa yin pa ltar sangs rgyas kyi yang de bzhin no //
translated: The equality of the buddhas also exists, i.e., just as the disciples have abandoned the passions along with their latent tendencies, so also the buddhas.

original: ji ltar nyan thos rnams kyis sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung pa spangs pa dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pa dang / lam bsgoms pa ltar sangs rgyas kyis kyang de bzhin du'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ni mtshungs pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos rnams kyis sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa dang / kun 'byung pa spangs pa dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du byas pa dang / lam bsgoms pa ltar sangs rgyas kyis kyang de bzhin du'o zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ni mtshungs pa nyid yin no //
translated: Just as the disciples have fully understood suffering, abandoned the origin, manifested the cessation, and cultivated the path, so also the buddhas. Such is equality.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa nyid ni nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The superiority of the Buddha is due to the abandonment of the defilements together with their traces, etc.

original: skal pa mnyam pa nyid du gshegs pas zhes bya bas ni 'dra ba nyid du gshegs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skal pa mnyam pa nyid du gshegs pas zhes bya bas ni 'dra ba nyid du gshegs nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The expression “having gone to the same place” means “having gone to the same place as them.”

original: ji ltar rmad du byung ba dang po'i mdo las byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rmad du byung ba dang po'i mdo las byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: As it is said in the Ārya-adbhuta-dharma-sūtra:

original: ji skad du zhe na /🔽rgya cher gsungs nas /
analyzed: ji skad du zhe na / rgya cher gsungs nas /
translated: What is that?

original: kun dga' bo ngas rgyal rigs kyi 'khor brgya phrag du ma lta bu'i phyir phyin pa mngon par shes te /
analyzed: kun dga' bo ngas rgyal rigs kyi 'khor brgya phrag du ma lta bu'i phyir phyin pa mngon par shes te /
translated: The Buddha said: “Ānanda, I have supernormal knowledge of the past lives of many hundreds of thousands of kṣatriyas.

original: da phyin pa na de rnams kyi chu zheng ci 'dra ba yin pa nga'i chu zheng yang de 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: da phyin pa na de rnams kyi chu zheng ci 'dra ba yin pa nga'i chu zheng yang de 'dra ba yin no //
translated: When I go there, my height and breadth are the same as theirs.

original: de rnams kyi kha dog rgyas pa ci 'dra ba yin pa nga'i kha dog rgyas pa yang de 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi kha dog rgyas pa ci 'dra ba yin pa nga'i kha dog rgyas pa yang de 'dra ba yin no //
translated: My complexion is the same as theirs.

original: de rnams kyi sgra 'byin pa ci 'dra ba yin pa nga'i sgra 'byin pa yang de dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyi sgra 'byin pa ci 'dra ba yin pa nga'i sgra 'byin pa yang de dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: My voice is the same as theirs.

original: de dag gi don gang brjod pa nga yang don de nyid brjod do //
analyzed: de dag gi don gang brjod pa nga yang don de nyid brjod do //
translated: I also speak about whatever they speak about.

original: de dag gi don gang mi brjod pa de nga yang mi brjod do //
analyzed: de dag gi don gang mi brjod pa de nga yang mi brjod do //
translated: I also do not speak about whatever they do not speak about.

original: phyis de rnams la chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
analyzed: phyis de rnams la chos kyi gtam gyis yang dag par bstan /
translated: Later, I taught them with a Dharma discourse,🔽I inspired them to take it up,

original: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs @275a * //
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du bcug / yang dag par gzengs @275a * //
translated: I encouraged them,

original: bstod / yang dag par mgu bar byas nas mi snang bar byas so //🔽nga mi snang bar gyur kyang mi snang bar gyur pa de lha'am /
analyzed: bstod / yang dag par mgu bar byas nas mi snang bar byas so // nga mi snang bar gyur kyang mi snang bar gyur pa de lha'am /
translated: I delighted them, and then I disappeared.

original: mi su yin snyam du mi shes so //
analyzed: mi su yin snyam du mi shes so //
translated: Even though I disappeared, they did not know who that god or human was that had disappeared.

original: rgyal rigs kyi 'khor du ji lta ba bzhin du bram ze'i 'khor du yang de bzhin du rgya cher sbyar ro //
analyzed: rgyal rigs kyi 'khor du ji lta ba bzhin du bram ze'i 'khor du yang de bzhin du rgya cher sbyar ro //
translated: Just as with the assembly of kṣatriyas, the same should be applied extensively to the assembly of brahmins.

original: gang zag kun rdzob tu yod kyi rdzas su ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zag kun rdzob tu yod kyi rdzas su ni ma yin no //
translated: The person exists conventionally, but not substantially.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽phung po rnams la de'i ming gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / phung po rnams la de'i ming gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that?🔽Because his name is designated in dependence on the aggregates.

original: gzugs la sogs pa phung po rnams la gang zag ces ming du gdags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa phung po rnams la gang zag ces ming du gdags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the name “person” is designated in dependence on the aggregates such as form.

original: de gnyis kyi zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni las dang rnam par smin pa de gnyis kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni de'i yul te 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni las dang rnam par smin pa de gnyis kyi rang gi mtshan nyid ni de'i yul te 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa'i yul ma yin no //
translated: The phrase “the intrinsic reality of those two” refers to the intrinsic reality of karma and its result, which is not the domain of transcendent knowledge.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes de'i yul ni brjod du med pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes de'i yul ni brjod du med pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The domain of that transcendent knowledge is the inexpressible universal characteristic.

original: de bzhin du yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du yul yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “in the same way” means “because it is the domain.”

original: mig dang rna ba sna yang tshad ma yin //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba sna yang tshad ma yin //
translated: The eye, ear, and nose are not valid cognitions.

original: zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “the eye, ear, and nose are not valid cognitions” means that the consciousnesses of the eye, etc., are not valid cognitions.

original: gnas kyis gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas kyis gnas pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase “because it is taught that the resident is dependent on the abode” means that the resident is dependent on the abode.

original: thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid du ni med pa kho na yin la zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
analyzed: thams cad rang gi mtshan nyid du ni med pa kho na yin la zhes bya ba ni kun brtags pa 'ba' zhig ma yin gyi /
translated: The phrase “all are nonexistent in terms of their intrinsic reality” means that they are not only imagined.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum char yang rang gi mtshan nyid du med pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum char yang rang gi mtshan nyid du med pa kho na yin no //
translated: All three natures are only without intrinsic identity.

original: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i tshig rnams la sogs pa sgra ji bzhin pa nyid kyi don yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa de lta bu'i tshig rnams la sogs pa sgra ji bzhin pa nyid kyi don yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The words “all things are without intrinsic identity” and so on are said to have a literal meaning.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni de skad ces smra ba de dag la ji ltar bstan pa'i brtsad pa 'di yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni de skad ces smra ba de dag la ji ltar bstan pa'i brtsad pa 'di yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro /
translated: “ In regard to them” means that in regard to those who speak in this way, this debate as taught will also arise.

original: ji skad bstan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is taught?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam pa stong pa nyid la las kyang yod /🔽rnam par smin pa yang yod la zhes bya ba rgya cher bstan ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam pa stong pa nyid la las kyang yod / rnam par smin pa yang yod la zhes bya ba rgya cher bstan ma thag pa'o //
translated: The Blessed One has just taught the ultimate emptiness, where there is karma,🔽and there is ripening.

original: gzhan yang kun rdzob ces bya ba yang brjod pa yin la ste ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang kun rdzob ces bya ba yang brjod pa yin la ste ngag gi rnam par rig byed kyi mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: Moreover, the conventional is also expressed, that is, the definition of verbal manifest action.

original: de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mthun pa ni nyes par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang mthun pa ni nyes par bshad pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which is in conformity with the defilement is the wrong explanation.

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log bar g-yem pa ston pa'i brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log bar g-yem pa ston pa'i brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the expression which teaches the taking of life, taking what is not given, and sexual misconduct.

original: rnam par byang ba dang mthun pa ni legs par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang mthun pa ni legs par bshad pa yin no //
translated: That which is in conformity with purification is the right explanation.

original: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam las ldog par ston pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dang / rnam par thar @275b zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyi lam las ldog par ston pa dang / bsam gtan dang / gzugs med pa dang / rnam par thar @275b zhes bya ba'i don bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the expression which teaches the avoidance of the unwholesome paths of action, and the teaching of the meaning of the meditative development of the meditative absorptions, the formless attainments and the liberations.

original: sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i dpon yang 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa nas sems can rnams sgrol bar byed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs chen po'i dpon yang 'khor ba'i 'brog dgon pa nas sems can rnams sgrol bar byed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He is the leader of the great multitude of sentient beings and he delivers sentient beings from the wilderness of samsara.

original: rnam pa la sogs pa rnams kyi don bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa la sogs pa rnams kyi don bstan par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the aspects and so on should be stated.

original: gang ye shes kyi rnam pas sam bsgom pa'i rnam pas kyang rungs dang po la 'jug pa de ni rnam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang ye shes kyi rnam pas sam bsgom pa'i rnam pas kyang rungs dang po la 'jug pa de ni rnam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is the entry into the first, whether by way of the aspects of direct intuition or by way of the aspects of meditative development, is described as the aspect.

original: grong khyer du 'jug pa'i lam gyi rnam pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: grong khyer du 'jug pa'i lam gyi rnam pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the form of the path to enter a city.

original: de nyid 'jug pa ni 'thob pa ste //
analyzed: de nyid 'jug pa ni 'thob pa ste //
translated: The very entry is the attainment,

original: grong khyer du 'jug pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: grong khyer du 'jug pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the entry into a city.

original: zhugs nas kyang 'bras bu chen po'i phan yon 'grub cing yang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni sa yongs su sbyor ba'i chos grub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhugs nas kyang 'bras bu chen po'i phan yon 'grub cing yang dag par 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni sa yongs su sbyor ba'i chos grub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And having entered, the great fruit of benefit is accomplished, and the accomplishment of the perfect accomplishment is the accomplishment of the dharmas of thorough preparation.

original: 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid 'jug par sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'grub pa zhes bya ba ni de dag nyid 'jug par sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment is the establishment of those very entries.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ni sangs rgyas mang po ba ltar snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de la ni sangs rgyas mang po ba ltar snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: For the bodhisattva who abides in this bodhisattva stage, many buddhas appear.

original: lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis so zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i don bstan pa ni gnas pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: lta ba rgya chen po dang / smon lam gyi stobs kyis so zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i don bstan pa ni gnas pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The meaning of what is said in the sutra through the power of vast view and aspiration is taught by the phrase in that abode, etc.

original: snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bltar snang bar zhes bya bar 'brel to //
analyzed: snang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bltar snang bar zhes bya bar 'brel to //
translated: Appears means appears to the view.

original: rgya che ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgya che ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate its vastness,

original: thos pa dang bsam pa'i sgo nas so ;
analyzed: thos pa dang bsam pa'i sgo nas so ;
translated: it is said that it is through hearing and reflection.🔽The phrase “with a mind that is devoted” means that, even without hearing, one can develop devotion by thinking, “Innumerable Blessed Buddhas reside in the various world systems.”🔽In order to demonstrate its vastness,🔽it is said that it is “with a mind that possesses vast faith.”🔽The phrase “with a mind that is devoted” means that, even without hearing, one can develop devotion by thinking, “Innumerable Blessed Buddhas reside in the various world systems.”🔽In order to demonstrate its vastness,🔽it is said that it is “with a mind that possesses vast faith.”

original: / sems kyis mos pas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir thos pa med kyang de lta na 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa bzhugs so zhes rang nyid mos par byed pa'o //
analyzed: / sems kyis mos pas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir thos pa med kyang de lta na 'jig rten gyi khams sna tshogs na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das dpag tu med pa bzhugs so zhes rang nyid mos par byed pa'o //

translated: “Phenomena are essenceless, phenomena are unarisen,” and so on.

original: bram ze'i khye'u bla ma nas bzung ste yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar du sprul pa tsam zhig yin par bstan pa ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u bla ma nas bzung ste yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa chen po'i bar du sprul pa tsam zhig yin par bstan pa ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is it that the Buddha taught that from the Brahmin youth Varaprabha up to the Great Final Nirvana he was merely an emanation?

original: bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs kyi drung na bram ze'i khye'u bla ma tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa sprul pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'od srungs kyi drung na bram ze'i khye'u bla ma tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa sprul pa yin par bstan to //
translated: In the presence of the Bhagavat Kasyapa, the Brahmin youth Varaprabha was taught to be an emanation.

original: de nas dga' ldan du lha'i bu tog dkar por skye ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de nas dga' ldan du lha'i bu tog dkar por skye ba yin par bstan to //
translated: Then, he was taught to be born as the god Sutejas in Tuṣita.

original: der yang lha'i rigs drug po dag la bka' stsal nas 'dir byon te /
analyzed: der yang lha'i rigs drug po dag la bka' stsal nas 'dir byon te /
translated: There, he spoke to the six classes of gods and came here.

analyzed: zas gtsang ma'i sras byang chub sems dpa' don thams cad grub pa yin par bstan to //
translated: He was taught to be the son of Śuddhodana, the Bodhisattva Sarvarthasiddha.

original: bltams pa dang / skyo ba dang / khab nas nges par 'byung nas gzhan mu stegs can rnams las byang chub kyi lam tshol ba la zhugs pa yin par bstan to //

translated: He was born, left home, and after renouncing the world, he set out to seek the path of enlightenment from non-Buddhist ascetics.

original: rim gyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: rim gyis mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhing mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin par bstan to //
translated: He gradually attained perfect enlightenment and demonstrated perfect buddhahood.

original: dad pa la sogs pa'i khyad par skyes pa'i phyir te /

analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / chos dang / dge 'dun yid la byed pa bstan pa ni dkon mchog dang zhes bya bas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The sutra’s statement that one should bring to mind the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṅgha is indicated by “the Jewels.”

analyzed: 'di ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa yid la byed par shes rab bya ste /

original: dka' ba spyad pas dag par thugs su chud pa'i phyir de'i 'dod pa na spyod pa'i tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa la lta bar 'gyur ro //

translated: Because he understands that purity comes from difficult practice, he has the view that the moral discipline and ascetic practice of the desire realm are supreme.

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas 'dod chags dang bral ba dag ni dka' ba spyad pas dag par mi rtogs te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas 'dod chags dang bral ba dag ni dka' ba spyad pas dag par mi rtogs te /
translated: Those who are free from attachment to the desire realm do not understand that purity comes from difficult practice.

original: de'i sa pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba de ni de rnams la kun du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sa pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag la dag par 'dzin pa'i phyir tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa'i lta ba de ni de rnams la kun du 'byung ba'o //
translated: Because it grasps the five aggregates appropriated in that realm as pure, that view that grasps morality and asceticism as paramount arises in relation to them.

original: 'gyur ba ni 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul lo //
analyzed: 'gyur ba ni 'gyur ba'i ngang tshul lo //
translated: Change is the nature of change.

original: mi ston kyang zhes bya ba ni gsal bar mi mdzad kyang ngo //
analyzed: mi ston kyang zhes bya ba ni gsal bar mi mdzad kyang ngo //

translated: The course of action is the form of action.🔽The emanations that are equal in status to those to be trained should be connected with those to be trained who are equal in status to the emanations.

original: de dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rigs la sogs pa dam bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gdul ba rnams dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rigs la sogs pa ni de dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rigs la sogs pa ste /

translated: Those of the same status as those to be trained are those of the same status as those to be trained.

analyzed: de dam bcas pa ni de dang skal ba mnyam pa'i rigs la sogs pa dam bcas pa'o //
translated: The vow is the vow to attain the family of the same destiny, etc.

analyzed: gzhan du na 'char ka dang / ci zhig gsung ba'i mdo la sogs pa de dag dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //

translated: The Udayana Sūtra says, after extensively teaching the Dharma, “You, a blind fool, think you can debate the Abhidharma and Vinaya with the bhikṣu Śāriputra?” and it uses harsh words.
