translated: Later, one becomes a person who has the fortune of great poverty.🔽In the same way, Venerable, one who seeks prosperity

original: dar ba tshor ba bdag gis gcer bu byis pa /🔽rmongs pa / mi gsal ba /
analyzed: dar ba tshor ba bdag gis gcer bu byis pa / rmongs pa / mi gsal ba /
translated: I, who seek prosperity, have served a naked child

original: mi mkhas pa la don ma mchis par dang / don ma mchis par bsnyen bkur bgyis pa las bdag gis dar ba de yang ma thob la /
analyzed: mi mkhas pa la don ma mchis par dang / don ma mchis par bsnyen bkur bgyis pa las bdag gis dar ba de yang ma thob la /
translated: who is ignorant, unclear, and unskilled, without purpose and without benefit. I did not obtain that prosperity.

original: slad kyis phongs pa chen po'i skal ba can du gyur to zhes 'byung ba @277b yin no //
analyzed: slad kyis phongs pa chen po'i skal ba can du gyur to zhes 'byung ba @277b yin no //
translated: Later, I became a person who has the fortune of great poverty.

original: de bzhin du mdo sde gzhan las kyang tshig rtsub pho la sogs pa bshad do /
analyzed: de bzhin du mdo sde gzhan las kyang tshig rtsub pho la sogs pa bshad do /
translated: In the same way, other sūtras explain harsh words and so on.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: rgya cher gsungs nas /
analyzed: rgya cher gsungs nas /
translated: Having spoken extensively,

original: sh'a ri'i bu dang mdo gal gyi bu des pa gnyis la yang nga re zhig dge slong gi dge 'dun mi gtong na ro mchil ma mid pa khyod la lta mos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu dang mdo gal gyi bu des pa gnyis la yang nga re zhig dge slong gi dge 'dun mi gtong na ro mchil ma mid pa khyod la lta mos kyang ci dgos zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa 'byung ba yin no //
translated: and the Buddha said to the two, Sariputra and Maudgalyayana, “I will not send the community of monks for a while, so what need is there to mention your swallowing a dead mouse?”🔽And so on.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo sde dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i le'u la sogs pa dag las ji ltar 'os par nges par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i mdo sde dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i le'u la sogs pa dag las ji ltar 'os par nges par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: And in the Skill in Means Sutra, the Chapter on the Transcendent and so on, one should hold fast to the appropriate passages.

original: de'i dgos pa ni nged kyis gzhung mngas kyis dogs pas ma bris so //
analyzed: de'i dgos pa ni nged kyis gzhung mngas kyis dogs pas ma bris so //
translated: But I will not write about the purpose of that, fearing prolixity.🔽Is it like a white and a black side?

original: ci'o thug dang khvar 'dra ba nyid yin nam zhes bya ba ni ci dkar po'i phyogs dang / nag po'i phyogs su 'dra ba nyid yin nam zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: ci'o thug dang khvar 'dra ba nyid yin nam zhes bya ba ni ci dkar po'i phyogs dang / nag po'i phyogs su 'dra ba nyid yin nam zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The intention is: Is it like a white side and a black side?

original: mchod sbyin can gyi sdug bsngal gyis 'chi bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: mchod sbyin can gyi sdug bsngal gyis 'chi bar byed pa'am /
translated: The sacrificer dies from the pain.

original: bsad pas zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni mchod sbyin yod pa ni mchod sbyin can te des so //
analyzed: bsad pas zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni mchod sbyin yod pa ni mchod sbyin can te des so //
translated: “By killing” and so on means that the sacrificer, who is one who sacrifices, does so.

original: mchod sbyin can gyi sdug bsngal gyis 'chi bar byed pa zhes bya ni sdug bsngal gyis 'chi bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mchod sbyin can gyi sdug bsngal gyis 'chi bar byed pa zhes bya ni sdug bsngal gyis 'chi bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “By the suffering of the sacrificer, one dies” means that one dies by the suffering of the sacrificer.

original: mtho ris sam thar pa 'thob po snyam pa ni gti mug yin no //
analyzed: mtho ris sam thar pa 'thob po snyam pa ni gti mug yin no //
translated: The thought that one will attain heaven or liberation is delusion.

original: las dang 'bras bu phyin ci log pa las mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu phyin ci log pa las mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one is attached to the perversion of the effect of action.

original: 'di ltar las dang 'bras bu phyin ci log pa la mngon par zhen par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar las dang 'bras bu phyin ci log pa la mngon par zhen par byed de /
translated: Thus, one is attached to the perversion of the effect of action.

original: de ltar na re zhig des gsod par byed pa de rnams kyi gti mug yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig des gsod par byed pa de rnams kyi gti mug yin no //
translated: In this way, delusion is the cause of the killing of those who kill.

original: bdag las 'dis ma tho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro snyam pa ni gti mug dang chags pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag las 'dis ma tho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ro snyam pa ni gti mug dang chags pa yin no //
translated: The thought that “by this action I will go to heaven” is delusion and attachment.

original: dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs byas te zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i sems kyi gnas skabs byas te'am /
analyzed: dge ba'am lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs byas te zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i sems kyi gnas skabs byas te'am /
translated: The phrase “having made it virtuous or neutral” means having made it virtuous or neutral.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs byas te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i sems kyi gnas skabs byas te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “having made it into a virtuous or indeterminate state of mind” means having made it into a virtuous state of mind or having made it into an indeterminate state of mind.

original: ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni ma chags pa dang zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “accompanied by nonattachment, etc.” means accompanied by nonattachment, nonhatred, and nondelusion.

original: ji skad gsungs pa'i mdo sde yang 'char ka'i mdo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad gsungs pa'i mdo sde yang 'char ka'i mdo la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sutra passage that is being referred to is the Ārāḍa Sūtra, etc.

original: der nges par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byed pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i lus pas zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba der nges par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las de byed pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni der nges par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byed
analyzed: der nges par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byed pa la mngon du phyogs pa'i lus pas zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba der nges par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las de byed pa la mngon du phyogs pa ni der nges par myong bar 'gyur ba'i las byed
translated: The phrase “one who is about to perform an action that is certain to be experienced in hell” means that a person is about to perform an action that is certain to be experienced in hell.

original: pa la mngon du phyogs pa'o //🔽de lta bas na nges par myong bar 'gyur ba'i @278a * //
analyzed: pa la mngon du phyogs pa'o // de lta bas na nges par myong bar 'gyur ba'i @278a * //
translated: and is about to do so.

original: las byed pa la mngon du phyogs ba de bas so //
analyzed: las byed pa la mngon du phyogs ba de bas so //
translated: Therefore, the karma that is certain to be experienced is about to be done.

original: gang zhe na lus so //
analyzed: gang zhe na lus so //
translated: What is that? The body.

original: sbyor ba de ni skyon can na mtshon 'debs par byed ces bya ba ni mtshon kyang 'chi ba'i phyir mgrin par 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: sbyor ba de ni skyon can na mtshon 'debs par byed ces bya ba ni mtshon kyang 'chi ba'i phyir mgrin par 'debs par byed do //
translated: That preparation is faulty, and the killing is done with a weapon, meaning that the killing is done with a weapon to the throat.

original: dge slong gis dge slong gsod ces bya ba ni dge slong gis dge slong gsod par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong gsod ces bya ba ni dge slong gis dge slong gsod par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The monk kills the monk means that the monk kills the monk.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rgya chen po la mos pa yin pas byang chub sems dpa' de rnams la sprul pa sh'akya thub pa sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa yin no zhes de ltar bstan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni rgya chen po la mos pa yin pas byang chub sems dpa' de rnams la sprul pa sh'akya thub pa sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa yin no zhes de ltar bstan par bya ba yin no //
translated: Since the bodhisattvas have vast aspirations, those bodhisattvas should be taught that the emanation Shakyamuni is an emanation of the Buddha.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid dang / mthu'i bdag nyid chen po'i khyad bar bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid dang / mthu'i bdag nyid chen po'i khyad bar bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to teach the greatness of the Buddha's essence and power.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid chen po'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir dang / mthu'i bdag nyid chen po'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid kyi bdag nyid chen po'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir dang / mthu'i bdag nyid chen po'i khyad par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate the superiority of the greatness of the intrinsic reality of the Buddha and in order to demonstrate the superiority of the greatness of his power.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba bstan pa'i mdo sde bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba bstan pa'i mdo de las sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid dang / mthu'i bdag nyid chen po'i khyad par bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba bstan pa'i mdo sde bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba bstan pa'i mdo de las sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid dang / mthu'i bdag nyid chen po'i khyad par bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: Just as in the Sutra Teaching the Tathāgata’s Inconceivable Secret, just as in that sutra the superiority of the greatness of the intrinsic reality of the Buddha and the superiority of the greatness of his power are demonstrated.

original: gzhan du na ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni gzhan du na de ltar ma bstan na ni de rnams de ltar sems mngon par 'du byed par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni gzhan du na de ltar ma bstan na ni de rnams de ltar sems mngon par 'du byed par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, if they were not taught in this way, they would not conceive of him in this way.

original: bdag cag kyang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / mthu'i bdag nyid chen po'i khyad par dang ldan par gyur cig snyam du de ltar sems bskyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / mi rigs par 'gyur ba ji skad du bstan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang
analyzed: bdag cag kyang sangs rgyas rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / mthu'i bdag nyid chen po'i khyad par dang ldan par gyur cig snyam du de ltar sems bskyed par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go / mi rigs par 'gyur ba ji skad du bstan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes dang
translated: The inappropriateness that is taught is that bodhisattvas would come close to the gnosis of omniscience

original: / nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa dang nye bar gyur pa'i zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / nyon mongs pa bag chags dang bcas pa spangs pa dang nye bar gyur pa'i zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ste /
translated: and the relinquishment of affliction together with its propensities.

original: gal te 'di thams cad sprul pa yin no zhes ma bstan na byang chub sems dpa' the tshom thams cad gcod pa de dag gis ji ltar len 'debs par 'gyur /🔽nyan thos gang dag de lta bu la mos pa'i skal ba can de dag ni de nyid las te /
analyzed: gal te 'di thams cad sprul pa yin no zhes ma bstan na byang chub sems dpa' the tshom thams cad gcod pa de dag gis ji ltar len 'debs par 'gyur / nyan thos gang dag de lta bu la mos pa'i skal ba can de dag ni de nyid las te /
translated: If it had not been taught that all of this is an emanation, how would those bodhisattvas who cut through all doubts have asked about it?

original: theg pa chen po las thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: theg pa chen po las thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those śrāvakas who are fortunate enough to have conviction in that way will hear it from that very Mahāyāna.

original: gang dag skal ba med pa de rnams la ni bstan pa skyon du 'gyur ro /
analyzed: gang dag skal ba med pa de rnams la ni bstan pa skyon du 'gyur ro /
translated: For those who are not fortunate, the teaching becomes a fault.

original: rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa las le 'ur bcad pa bzhi pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa las le 'ur bcad pa bzhi pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The explanation of the fourth chapter in the rational system of exposition is completed.

original: // / dgos pa la sogs pa'i rim pas ni dgos pa dang / bsdus pa'i don dang / tshig gi don dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / brgal @278b ba dang / lan te rim pa de lta bus so //
analyzed: // / dgos pa la sogs pa'i rim pas ni dgos pa dang / bsdus pa'i don dang / tshig gi don dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang / brgal @278b ba dang / lan te rim pa de lta bus so //
translated: By the order of purpose and so on means by the order of purpose, summarized meaning, meaning of the words, connection, objections, and replies.

original: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / log pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis sems zhum pa dang / rnam par g-yengs ba rnams la zhes bya ba ni rmugs pa dang / gnyid kyis sems zhum pa rnams la rnam pa gsum dag gis gus par mnyan pa dang ldan pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang gnyid dang / log pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis sems zhum pa dang / rnam par g-yengs ba rnams la zhes bya ba ni rmugs pa dang / gnyid kyis sems zhum pa rnams la rnam pa gsum dag gis gus par mnyan pa dang ldan pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: For those whose minds are depressed or distracted by lethargy, sleep, and wrong thoughts, means that for those whose minds are depressed by lethargy and sleep, the teaching should be done with three aspects, endowed with respectful listening.

original: ya mtshan zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni ya mtshan gyi gtam nye bar sgrub pa nyid dang / rab tu dga' ba'i gtam nye bar sgrub pa nyid dang / skyo ba'i gtam nye bar sgrub pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ya mtshan zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni ya mtshan gyi gtam nye bar sgrub pa nyid dang / rab tu dga' ba'i gtam nye bar sgrub pa nyid dang / skyo ba'i gtam nye bar sgrub pa nyid kyis so //
translated: The Discourse on the Marvelous states:🔽“The marvelous, the delightful, and the sorrowful are to be accomplished by means of the marvelous, the delightful, and the sorrowful.”

original: ya mtshan dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / skyo ba'i gtam nye bar sgrub pa dang rnam pa gsum dag gis gus par mnyan pa dang ldan pa bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: ya mtshan dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / skyo ba'i gtam nye bar sgrub pa dang rnam pa gsum dag gis gus par mnyan pa dang ldan pa bshad par bya'o //
translated: The marvelous, the delightful, and the sorrowful are to be accomplished by means of the three kinds of discourses, the marvelous, the delightful, and the sorrowful.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽gnyid dang rmugs pa dang ldan pa rnams la ya mtshan skyed pa'am /🔽rab tu dga' bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gnyid dang rmugs pa dang ldan pa rnams la ya mtshan skyed pa'am / rab tu dga' bar bya ba'am /
translated: Why is this?

original: skyo ba'i gtam byas te /
analyzed: skyo ba'i gtam byas te /
translated: For those who are drowsy and dull, the marvelous, the delightful, and the sorrowful are to be accomplished by means of the marvelous, the delightful, and the sorrowful.

original: gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes 'og nas ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes 'og nas ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is this?

original: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams la skyo ba'i gtam nye bar bsgrub pa nyid kyis bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: log pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyis sems rnam par g-yengs pa rnams la skyo ba'i gtam nye bar bsgrub pa nyid kyis bshad par bya'o //
translated: For those whose minds are distracted by false conceptualization, the sorrowful is to be accomplished by means of the sorrowful.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sems g-yengs pa rnams la skyo ba'i gtam bya ste /
analyzed: sems g-yengs pa rnams la skyo ba'i gtam bya ste /
translated: For those whose minds are distracted, one should speak of disenchantment.

original: skyo ba rnams sems rtse gcig pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir ro zhes 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyo ba rnams sems rtse gcig pa nyid du bya ba'i phyir ro zhes 'og nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said below, “for those who are disenchanted, in order to make their minds one-pointed.”

original: 'di yang dag par 'dzud pa ni yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang dag par 'dzud pa ni yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the correct introduction, which should be understood as the correct instigation.

original: sdud par byed pa'am 'jig rten pa'i don gzhan ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdud par byed pa'am 'jig rten pa'i don gzhan ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the non-differentiation of the mundane and supramundane aims.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyangs kyi yon tan lnga po yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i dum bu 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbyangs kyi yon tan lnga po yongs su bstan to //
translated: “By this” means that by this part of the sutra, the five qualities of the Tathagata’s voice are revealed.

original: rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: rab tu bstan to //
translated: They are demonstrated.

original: rgya che ba nyid ni 'brug sgra ltar zab pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //🔽snyan pa nyid ni snyan cing 'jebs la rnar snyan pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: rgya che ba nyid ni 'brug sgra ltar zab pa zhes bya ba 'dis so // snyan pa nyid ni snyan cing 'jebs la rnar snyan pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: Their greatness is demonstrated by the phrase, “like the sound of a great drum.”🔽Their pleasantness is demonstrated by the phrase, “pleasing, delightful, and charming.”

original: rigs pa'i don dang ldan pa nyid ni yid du 'ong zhing dga' bar byed pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: rigs pa'i don dang ldan pa nyid ni yid du 'ong zhing dga' bar byed pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: Their appropriateness of meaning is demonstrated by the phrase, “captivating and pleasing to the mind.”

original: gzung sla ba nyid ni rnam par gsal zhing rnam par rig par bya zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: gzung sla ba nyid ni rnam par gsal zhing rnam par rig par bya zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: Ease of retention is indicated by the words clear and intelligible.

original: sna tshogs ci 'dod pa nyid ni mnyan par 'os shing mi mthun pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: sna tshogs ci 'dod pa nyid ni mnyan par 'os shing mi mthun pa med pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: Varied eloquence is indicated by the words worthy of hearing and free from disharmony.

original: ci 'dod pa nyid ni mang ba nyid do //
analyzed: ci 'dod pa nyid ni mang ba nyid do //
translated: The word “varied” means abundant.

original: ji ltar na go rims bzhin du 'gyur zhe na /🔽rgya che ba nyid ni mnyan pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: ji ltar na go rims bzhin du 'gyur zhe na / rgya che ba nyid ni mnyan pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba nas /
translated: How are these seven kinds of eloquence respectively related to the seven branches of worship?

original: sna tshogs ci 'dod pa nyid ni yongs su smin par byed pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba'i bar du'o //🔽dus su gtam bya ba dang / @279a * //
analyzed: sna tshogs ci 'dod pa nyid ni yongs su smin par byed pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba'i bar du'o // dus su gtam bya ba dang / @279a * //
translated: Abundance is related to the branch of worship consisting of hearing, and so on up to varied eloquence, which is related to the branch of worship consisting of bringing to maturity.🔽The words “at the proper time” and “respectfully” are as already explained.

original: gus pa dang go rims dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji skad bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gus pa dang go rims dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji skad bstan pa yin no //
translated: The words “in order” and so on are as already explained.

original: sri zhu dang zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ni ji skad bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sri zhu dang zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa ni ji skad bstan pa yin no //
translated: The words “with devotion” and so on are as already explained.

original: yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa 'di gang la yang dag par 'dzin du bcug ce na /
analyzed: yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa 'di gang la yang dag par 'dzin du bcug ce na /
translated: With regard to the phrase “one should cause them to take up the correct practice,” what is the correct practice that one should cause them to take up?

original: tshig bdun dag gis te /
analyzed: tshig bdun dag gis te /
translated: It is the correct practice of the seven kinds of eloquence.

original: gang dag gis she na /
analyzed: gang dag gis she na /
translated: By what means?

original: ma chags pa'i sems zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
analyzed: ma chags pa'i sems zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas /
translated: Beginning with the phrase “a mind free from desire,”

original: rgyud gcig tu gyur pa'i sems zhes bya ba'i tshig bdun po 'di dag gis ni sgrib pa lnga po yongs su spong ba la ste /
analyzed: rgyud gcig tu gyur pa'i sems zhes bya ba'i tshig bdun po 'di dag gis ni sgrib pa lnga po yongs su spong ba la ste /
translated: up to the phrase “a mind that is unified,” these seven phrases are for the complete abandonment of the five hindrances.

original: sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod pa la bdun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom ste sgrib pa lnga po spong ba 'di la yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa yin no //
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga ni 'dod pa la bdun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom ste sgrib pa lnga po spong ba 'di la yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa yin no //
translated: The five hindrances are desire for sensual pleasure, malice, torpor and sleep, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.

original: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa rnam pa gnyis su byas te'o //
analyzed: rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa rnam pa gnyis su byas te'o //
translated: Torpor and sleep, and restlessness and remorse, are each made into two.

original: de ltar na sgrib pa lnga po 'di dag kyang tshig bdun dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na sgrib pa lnga po 'di dag kyang tshig bdun dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, these five hindrances are included in these seven phrases.

original: de la ma chags pa'i sems zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa yongs su spong ba la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa nas /
analyzed: de la ma chags pa'i sems zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa'i sgrib pa yongs su spong ba la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa nas /
translated: Here, the phrase “a mind free from desire” is for the complete abandonment of the hindrance of desire for sensual pleasure.

original: rgyud gcig tu gyur pa'i sems zhes bya ba 'dis ni the tshom gyi sgrib pa yongs su spong ba la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'i bar yin no //
analyzed: rgyud gcig tu gyur pa'i sems zhes bya ba 'dis ni the tshom gyi sgrib pa yongs su spong ba la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'i bar yin no //
translated: This is how the bodhisattva introduces beings to the elimination of the obscurations of doubt.🔽Four verses on the analysis of the bodhisattvas spiritual gene.

original: tshig bzhi dag gis te /
analyzed: tshig bzhi dag gis te /
translated: The spiritual gene of the bodhisattvas is shown by four verses.

original: dge ba'i sems dang / bye brag phyed pa'i sems dang / gus pa'i sems dang / mos pa'i sems zhes bya ba 'di rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems dang / bye brag phyed pa'i sems dang / gus pa'i sems dang / mos pa'i sems zhes bya ba 'di rnams kyis so //
translated: It is the spiritual gene of the bodhisattvas that is the cause of the four kinds of faith, the four kinds of thorough cognition, the four kinds of respect, and the four kinds of interest.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyi lta bu'i gang zag bzhi bstan pa gang yin pa dag ste /🔽bzhi gang dag ce na /🔽khyi bzhi rgya cher gsungs nas de bzhin du 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la yang rngon pa'i khyi lta bu'i gang zag bzhi po 'di dag yod cing bdog pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis khyi lta bu'i gang zag bzhi bstan pa gang yin pa dag ste / bzhi gang dag ce na / khyi bzhi rgya cher gsungs nas de bzhin du 'phags pa'i chos 'dul ba la yang rngon pa'i khyi lta bu'i gang zag bzhi po 'di dag yod cing bdog pa yin no //
translated: The four kinds of faith are faith in the enlightenment of the buddhas, faith in the teaching of the universal vehicle, faith in the universal vehicle itself, and faith in the bodhisattvas who are the disciples of the universal vehicle.🔽The four kinds of thorough cognition are thorough cognition of the Dharma, thorough cognition of the meaning, thorough cognition of the teaching, and thorough cognition of clear realization.🔽The four kinds of respect are respect for the Dharma, respect for the meaning, respect for the teaching, and respect for clear realization.

original: bzhi gang dag ce na /
analyzed: bzhi gang dag ce na /
translated: The four kinds of interest are interest in the Dharma, interest in the meaning, interest in the teaching, and interest in clear realization.

original: rngon pa'i khyi dus ma yin par rtug pa lta bu'i gang zag dang / rngon pa'i khyi se gol la lta ba lta bu'i gang zag dang / rngon pa'i khyi 'khor ba lta bu'i gang zag dang / rngon pa'i khyi dam du 'dzin pa lta bu'i gang zag go //
analyzed: rngon pa'i khyi dus ma yin par rtug pa lta bu'i gang zag dang / rngon pa'i khyi se gol la lta ba lta bu'i gang zag dang / rngon pa'i khyi 'khor ba lta bu'i gang zag dang / rngon pa'i khyi dam du 'dzin pa lta bu'i gang zag go //
translated: The person who is like a hunting dog that defecates at the wrong time, the person who is like a hunting dog that looks at a fingernail, the person who is like a hunting dog that chases after a ring, and the person who is like a hunting dog that is held back by a leash.

original: rngon pa'i khyi dus ma yin par rtug pa lta bu'i gang zag gang zhe na /
analyzed: rngon pa'i khyi dus ma yin par rtug pa lta bu'i gang zag gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the person who is like a hunting dog that defecates at the wrong time?

original: dge slong dag 'di na dge slong gi mdun du gang zag chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug la /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di na dge slong gi mdun du gang zag chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug la /
translated: Monks, here a person sits in front of a monk in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: dge slong gis de la chos thog mar dge ba /
analyzed: dge slong gis de la chos thog mar dge ba /
translated: The monk teaches him the Dharma that is good in the beginning,

original: bar du dge ba /
analyzed: bar du dge ba /
translated: good in the middle,

original: tha mar dge ba /🔽don bzang po /
analyzed: tha mar dge ba / don bzang po /
translated: and good in the end,

original: tshig 'bru bzang po /
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po /
translated: with its own meaning, with its own phrasing,

original: ma 'dres pa /🔽@279b yongs su rdzogs pa /🔽yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa / @279b yongs su rdzogs pa / yongs su dag pa /
translated: unadulterated,🔽complete,🔽pure,

original: yongs su byang ba /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba /
translated: and purified.

original: tshangs par spyod pa yang dag par rab tu bstan pa ston pa /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa yang dag par rab tu bstan pa ston pa /
translated: He teaches the pure life.

original: de ni de'i tshe 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rtog par byed /
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la rtog par byed /
translated: At that time, he thinks thoughts of desire,

original: gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par rtog par byed pas de gang gi don du dge slong gi mdun du 'dug pa'i don de mi 'thob ste /
analyzed: gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa la rnam par rtog par byed pas de gang gi don du dge slong gi mdun du 'dug pa'i don de mi 'thob ste /
translated: He does not obtain the purpose for which he sits in the presence of the monk.

original: dper na rngon pa'i khyi dus ma yin par rtug pa ni gang gi tshe rngon pas phag gam ri dags la btang ba na /
analyzed: dper na rngon pa'i khyi dus ma yin par rtug pa ni gang gi tshe rngon pas phag gam ri dags la btang ba na /
translated: For example, it is like a hunter’s dog that defecates at the wrong time when the hunter sends it out to hunt wild pigs or deer.

original: de de'i tshe bshad par byed /
analyzed: de de'i tshe bshad par byed /
translated: At that time, it is said:

original: gci bar byed pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: gci bar byed pa lta bu ste /
translated: It defecates and urinates.

original: nga gang zag de la de dang 'dra bar smra'o //
analyzed: nga gang zag de la de dang 'dra bar smra'o //
translated: I say that person is like that.

original: 'di ni rngon pa'i khyi dus ma yin par rtug pa'i gang zag lta bu zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rngon pa'i khyi dus ma yin par rtug pa'i gang zag lta bu zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called “a person who is like a hunter’s dog that defecates at the wrong time.”

original: rngon pa'i khyi se gol la lta ba lta bu'i gang zag gang zhe na /
analyzed: rngon pa'i khyi se gol la lta ba lta bu'i gang zag gang zhe na /
translated: “What is a person who is like a hunter’s dog that looks at a firebrand?”

original: dge slong dag 'di na dge slong gi mdun du gang zag chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug la /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di na dge slong gi mdun du gang zag chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug la /
translated: “Monks, in this case a person sits in the presence of a monk to listen to the Dharma.

original: dge slong gis de la chos thog mar dge ba nam /
analyzed: dge slong gis de la chos thog mar dge ba nam /
translated: The monk teaches him the Dharma, which is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its own meaning, with its own phrasing, and with its own Dharma.

original: de ni de'i tshe gang zag chos smra ba'i gdong du lta ba dang / se gol la lta bar byed pas de gang gi don du dge slong gi mdun du 'dug pa'i don de mi thob ste /
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe gang zag chos smra ba'i gdong du lta ba dang / se gol la lta bar byed pas de gang gi don du dge slong gi mdun du 'dug pa'i don de mi thob ste /
translated: At that time, the person who is a Dharma teacher looks at the face of the person who is listening to the Dharma and looks at the snapping of the fingers.🔽For example, a hunter’s dog looks at the snapping of the fingers.

original: dper na rngon pa'i khyi se gol la lta ba de gang gi tshe rngon pas phag gam ri dags la btang na /
analyzed: dper na rngon pa'i khyi se gol la lta ba de gang gi tshe rngon pas phag gam ri dags la btang na /
translated: When the hunter sends it out to hunt wild pigs or deer,

original: de de'i tshe rngon pa'i gdong du lta ba dang / se gol la lta bar byed de /🔽de gang gi don du rngon pas phag gam /
analyzed: de de'i tshe rngon pa'i gdong du lta ba dang / se gol la lta bar byed de / de gang gi don du rngon pas phag gam /
translated: at that time the dog looks at the face of the hunter and looks at the snapping of the fingers.🔽For the sake of which the hunter sends it out to hunt wild pigs or deer,

original: ri dvags la btang ba'i don de dag mi thob pa rang 'dra bar /
analyzed: ri dvags la btang ba'i don de dag mi thob pa rang 'dra bar /
translated: it does not obtain that purpose.

original: nga gang zag de la de dang 'dra bar smra'o //
analyzed: nga gang zag de la de dang 'dra bar smra'o //
translated: I say that the person is like that.

original: 'di ni rngon pa'i khyi se gol la lta ba lta bu'i gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rngon pa'i khyi se gol la lta ba lta bu'i gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: This is called the person who is like a hunter’s dog that looks at the snapping of the fingers.

original: rngon pa'i khyi 'khor ba lta bu'i gang zag gang zhe na /
analyzed: rngon pa'i khyi 'khor ba lta bu'i gang zag gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the person who is like a hunter’s dog that chases after a corpse?

original: dge slong dag 'di na dge slong gi mdun du gang zag chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug la /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di na dge slong gi mdun du gang zag chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug la /
translated: Bhikṣus, here a person sits in front of a bhikṣu in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: dge slong gis de la chos thog mar dge ba nas /
analyzed: dge slong gis de la chos thog mar dge ba nas /
translated: The monk teaches him the Dharma that is good in the beginning,

original: des chos de dam du mi 'dzin /🔽brtan par mi 'dzin /
analyzed: des chos de dam du mi 'dzin / brtan par mi 'dzin /
translated: but he does not hold it well,🔽does not hold it firmly,

original: legs par gzung bar mi 'dzin /
analyzed: legs par gzung bar mi 'dzin /
translated: does not hold it properly,

original: bzung ba yang chud za bar byed pas de gang gi don du dge slong gi mdun du 'dug pa'i don de des ma thob ste /
analyzed: bzung ba yang chud za bar byed pas de gang gi don du dge slong gi mdun du 'dug pa'i don de des ma thob ste /
translated: and he loses what he has learned. Thus, he does not attain the goal for which he sits in the presence of the monk.🔽For example, it is like a hunting dog that is let off its leash.

original: dper na rngon pa'i khyi 'khor ba de ni gang gi tshe rngon pas phag gam ri dgas la btang ba na /
analyzed: dper na rngon pa'i khyi 'khor ba de ni gang gi tshe rngon pas phag gam ri dgas la btang ba na /
translated: When the hunter sends it after a boar or a deer,

original: de de'i tshe phag gam ri dvags kyi nye 'khor na 'khor zhing dam du mi 'dzin /
analyzed: de de'i tshe phag gam ri dvags kyi nye 'khor na 'khor zhing dam du mi 'dzin /
translated: it circles around the boar or the deer, but does not hold it well,

original: brtan por mi 'dzin /
analyzed: brtan por mi 'dzin /
translated: does not hold it firmly,

original: legs par gzung bar mi 'dzin /
analyzed: legs par gzung bar mi 'dzin /
translated: does not hold it properly,

original: bzung ba yang gtong bar byed pa dang 'dra bar nga gang zag de la de dang 'dra bar sma'o //🔽'di ni rngon pa'i khyi 'khor ba @280a * //
analyzed: bzung ba yang gtong bar byed pa dang 'dra bar nga gang zag de la de dang 'dra bar sma'o // 'di ni rngon pa'i khyi 'khor ba @280a * //
translated: and it lets go of what it has seized. I say that this person is like that.

original: lta bu'i gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: lta bu'i gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: This is called “the person who is like a hunting dog that is let off its leash.”

original: rngon pa'i khyi dam du 'dzin pa lta bu'i gang zag gang zhe na /
analyzed: rngon pa'i khyi dam du 'dzin pa lta bu'i gang zag gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the person who is like a hunting dog that is held on a leash?”

original: dge slong dag 'di na dge slong gi mdun du gang zag chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug la /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di na dge slong gi mdun du gang zag chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug la /
translated: “Monks, here a monk sits in the presence of a monk in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: dge slong gis de la chos thog mar dge ba nas tshangs par spyod pa rab tu bstan pa'i bar du ston na /
analyzed: dge slong gis de la chos thog mar dge ba nas tshangs par spyod pa rab tu bstan pa'i bar du ston na /
translated: The monk teaches him the Dharma, starting with the topics that are wholesome, up to the pure and celibate life.

original: de chos de dam du 'dzin /🔽brtan por 'dzin /
analyzed: de chos de dam du 'dzin / brtan por 'dzin /
translated: He holds that Dharma tightly,🔽he holds it firmly,

original: legs par gzung bar 'dzin /
analyzed: legs par gzung bar 'dzin /
translated: he holds it well,

original: bzung ba yang chud mi za bar byed pas des gang gi don du dge slong gi mdun du 'dug pa'i don de thob ste /
analyzed: bzung ba yang chud mi za bar byed pas des gang gi don du dge slong gi mdun du 'dug pa'i don de thob ste /
translated: and he does not let go of what he has held.

original: dper na rngon pa'i khyi dam du 'dzin pa ni gang gi tshe mngon pas phag gam ri dgas la btang ba na des de'i tshe phag gam ri dgas kyi nye 'khor bskor nas dam du 'dzin /
analyzed: dper na rngon pa'i khyi dam du 'dzin pa ni gang gi tshe mngon pas phag gam ri dgas la btang ba na des de'i tshe phag gam ri dgas kyi nye 'khor bskor nas dam du 'dzin /
translated: For example, a hunter’s dog holds tightly. When the hunter sends it out to catch a pig or a deer, it circles around the pig or the deer, holding tightly,

original: brtan por 'dzin /
analyzed: brtan por 'dzin /
translated: holding firmly,

original: legs par gzung bar 'dzin /
analyzed: legs par gzung bar 'dzin /
translated: holding well,

original: bzung ba dang mi gtong ba dang 'dra bar nga gang zag de la de dang 'dra bar smra'o //
analyzed: bzung ba dang mi gtong ba dang 'dra bar nga gang zag de la de dang 'dra bar smra'o //
translated: and does not let go of what it has held. I say that this person is like that.

original: 'di ni rngon pa'i khyi dam du 'dzin pa lta bu'i gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rngon pa'i khyi dam du 'dzin pa lta bu'i gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: This is the person who is like the hunter’s dog.

original: gsum ni nag po'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni snga ma rnams so //
analyzed: gsum ni nag po'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni snga ma rnams so //
translated: The first three are favorable to the dark side.

original: gcig ni dkar po'i phyogs dang mthun pa ste tha ma'o //🔽go rims bzhin du de lta bu nyid yongs su spangs pa la yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa yin la /
analyzed: gcig ni dkar po'i phyogs dang mthun pa ste tha ma'o // go rims bzhin du de lta bu nyid yongs su spangs pa la yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa yin la /
translated: The last one is favorable to the bright side.

original: de lta bu nyid la yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa yin no //🔽tshig lhag ma zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni tshig lhag ma bcu drug po gang dag la zhes bya ba ni legs par rnam par gnas pa'i sems dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
analyzed: de lta bu nyid la yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa yin no // tshig lhag ma zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni tshig lhag ma bcu drug po gang dag la zhes bya ba ni legs par rnam par gnas pa'i sems dang zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /
translated: In order, one should cause them to take up the avoidance of that kind of practice, and one should cause them to take up that kind of practice.🔽The remaining words are the sixteen remaining words.

original: yid la byed pa drag po'i sems zhes bya ba'i bar tshig bcu drug po 'di dag gis rnam pa bcu drug po dag la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: yid la byed pa drag po'i sems zhes bya ba'i bar tshig bcu drug po 'di dag gis rnam pa bcu drug po dag la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The sixteen words beginning with “a well-ordered mind” and ending with “a mind of intense mental attention” cause them to take up the sixteen kinds of practice.

original: bcu drug po gang dag la zhe na /
analyzed: bcu drug po gang dag la zhe na /
translated: What are the sixteen kinds of practice?

original: don rgyas pa las 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus rnam pa bcu drug po gang dag gis chos mnyan par bya bar gsungs pa dus su chos mnyan par bya bar ba dang / gus pa dang / nyan par gus pa dang / ma rangs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: don rgyas pa las 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus rnam pa bcu drug po gang dag gis chos mnyan par bya bar gsungs pa dus su chos mnyan par bya bar ba dang / gus pa dang / nyan par gus pa dang / ma rangs pa med pa dang /
translated: The extensive meaning is the sixteen aspects by which the noble Shariputra taught listening to the Dharma: listening to the Dharma at the right time, with respect, with devoted listening, without displeasure,

original: bsgo ba bzhin byed pa dang / klan ka mi tshol ba dang / chos la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / gang zag chos smra ba la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos la brnyas pa med pa nyid dang / gang zag chos smra ba la brnyas pa med pa nyid dang /
analyzed: bsgo ba bzhin byed pa dang / klan ka mi tshol ba dang / chos la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / gang zag chos smra ba la gus pa nye bar gzhag pa dang / chos la brnyas pa med pa nyid dang / gang zag chos smra ba la brnyas pa med pa nyid dang /
translated: acting according to the instructions, not seeking faults, establishing respect for the Dharma, establishing respect for the person teaching the Dharma, not disparaging the Dharma, not disparaging the person teaching the Dharma,

original: bdag nyid la brnyas pa med pa nyid dang / kun du shes par bya ba'i sems dang / sems rtse gcig tu bya ba nyid dang / rna blags pa dang / sems kun du @280b btud pa dang / sems thams cad kyis bsams nas chos mnyan par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid la brnyas pa med pa nyid dang / kun du shes par bya ba'i sems dang / sems rtse gcig tu bya ba nyid dang / rna blags pa dang / sems kun du @280b btud pa dang / sems thams cad kyis bsams nas chos mnyan par bya ba yin no //
translated: not disparaging oneself, with a mind to fully understand, with a one-pointed mind, with ears attentive, with a fully inclined mind, and listening to the Dharma with all one's heart.

original: ji ltar na chos mnyan pa rnam pa bcu drug la yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na chos mnyan pa rnam pa bcu drug la yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does he cause them to take up the sixteen kinds of listening to the Dharma?

original: de la chos mnyan pa dang mthun pa'i spyod lam la rnam par gnas pa'i phyir legs par rnam par gnas pa'i sems so zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: de la chos mnyan pa dang mthun pa'i spyod lam la rnam par gnas pa'i phyir legs par rnam par gnas pa'i sems so zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ste /
translated: Here, the mind is well-established because it is situated in a posture that is suitable for listening to the Dharma.

original: de ltar na de rnams kyi de dag la go rims bzhin du yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de rnams kyi de dag la go rims bzhin du yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he causes them to take up these sixteen aspects in that order.

original: lhag ma ni go sla ba'i phyir ma bshad do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla ba'i phyir ma bshad do //
translated: The rest is easy to understand and therefore needs not be explained.

original: lhag ma ni gang zhe na /🔽zhum pa med pa'i sems zhes bya ba nas brtsams te /🔽yid la byed pa drag po'i sems zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: lhag ma ni gang zhe na / zhum pa med pa'i sems zhes bya ba nas brtsams te / yid la byed pa drag po'i sems zhes bya ba'i bar ro //
translated: What is the rest?🔽It is the passage that begins with the phrase “a mind that is not fainthearted” and ends with the phrase “a mind that is intensely focused.”

original: de la zhum pa med pa'i sems zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni bdag nyid la brnyas pa med pa nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa 'di la yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa yin no //
analyzed: de la zhum pa med pa'i sems zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis ni bdag nyid la brnyas pa med pa nyid ces bya ba'i rnam pa 'di la yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa yin no //
translated: In this passage, the phrase “a mind that is not fainthearted” indicates that he causes them to take up the form of self-confidence.

original: yid la byed na drag po zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis ni sems thams cad kyis bsams nas zhes bya ba 'di la yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa yin no //
analyzed: yid la byed na drag po zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis ni sems thams cad kyis bsams nas zhes bya ba 'di la yang dag par 'dzin du bcug pa yin no //
translated: The phrase if one attends to it, it is called 'intense' correctly interprets the phrase having reflected with all one's mind.

original: de lta bu ni yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa nyid kyis son no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa nyid kyis son no //
translated: One who is thus engaged is one who has been caused to take up the correct view.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dag gis zhes bya ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid kyis so //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dag gis zhes bya ba'i rnam par g-yeng ba dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid kyis so //
translated: By the words distraction, lethargy, and sleep, it is meant that one should avoid the three faults of laxity, excitement, and sleep.

original: de'i skyon yongs su spang ba'i phyir ji skad bstan pa'i skyon gsum po de yongs su spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i phyir nyon la legs par rab tu yid la byos shig ces gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i skyon yongs su spang ba'i phyir ji skad bstan pa'i skyon gsum po de yongs su spang ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i phyir nyon la legs par rab tu yid la byos shig ces gsungs pa yin te /
translated: In order to eliminate those faults, the Blessed One said, Therefore, listen well and pay attention!

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: as it occurs in the sutra.

original: de rnams las bar ma ni thams cad las tha chad yin no //
analyzed: de rnams las bar ma ni thams cad las tha chad yin no //
translated: Among those, the middling is the worst of all.

original: gang gis nye bar bzung ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis nye bar bzung ba'o //
translated: It is that by which one is taken up.

original: de'i gnyen por zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni de'i gnyen po ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni de'i gnyen po ste /
translated: The phrase the antidote to that is explained in detail.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag de lta bu gsum po'i gnyen por go rims bzhin du de'i phyir nyon la zhes bya bas mnyan pa la yang dag par 'dzud par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag de lta bu gsum po'i gnyen por go rims bzhin du de'i phyir nyon la zhes bya bas mnyan pa la yang dag par 'dzud par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The Blessed One, as an antidote to those three types of persons, respectively, says, “Therefore, listen well” in order to induce them to listen.

original: legs par rab tu yid la byos shig ces bya ba nas legs par dang / rab tu yid la bya ba la yang dag par rab tu 'dzud par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: legs par rab tu yid la byos shig ces bya ba nas legs par dang / rab tu yid la bya ba la yang dag par rab tu 'dzud par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: He says, “Keep it well in mind” in order to induce them to keep it well and to keep it in mind.

original: rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: The explanation of the presentation is as follows.

original: rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni ji skad bstan pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa re re dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa 'di ni ji skad bstan pa'i phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa re re dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This presentation should be applied to each of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, and so on as they have been explained.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: phung po rnam par gzhag pa dang / khams rnam par gzhag pa dang / skye mched rnam par gzhag pa nas /
analyzed: phung po rnam par gzhag pa dang / khams rnam par gzhag pa dang / skye mched rnam par gzhag pa nas /
translated: The presentation of the aggregates, the presentation of the elements, the presentation of the sense bases,

original: dad pa'i sems rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: dad pa'i sems rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: up to the presentation of the mind of faith.

original: @281a * // de ni rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: @281a * // de ni rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: That is the presentation.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa dag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi ji ltar rigs bar rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log pa ston pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa dag gi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi ji ltar rigs bar rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log pa ston pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: The same is true of the teaching of the characteristics of the aggregates, elements, sense bases, etc., and of the dharmas of defilement and purification, whether in general or in particular, and of the characteristics of cause and effect, without error.

original: bdag nyid du smra ba'i nye bar len pa spong ba yongs su ston pa de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid du smra ba'i nye bar len pa spong ba yongs su ston pa de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos rnams kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: The teaching of the abandonment of the appropriation of the self-doctrine is also the establishment of the dharmas of defilement and purification.

original: ma thos par thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma thos par thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who has not heard will come to hear.

original: 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang / lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa spong ba gang yongs su ston par ni mi mdzad de /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang / lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa spong ba gang yongs su ston par ni mi mdzad de /
translated: But he does not teach the abandonment of the appropriation of desire, the appropriation of views, and the appropriation of morality and vows.

original: 'di ltar mu stegs can dag kyang de spong bar smra'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mu stegs can dag kyang de spong bar smra'o //
translated: Because the tirthikas also speak of the abandonment of these.

original: 'di ltar mdo sde las kyang dge sbyong ngam bram ze gang la la dag 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang / lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa spong ba dang yongs su shes pa 'dogs par byed kyi bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo sde las kyang dge sbyong ngam bram ze gang la la dag 'dod pa'i nye bar len pa dang / lta ba'i nye bar len pa dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyi nye bar len pa spong ba dang yongs su shes pa 'dogs par byed kyi bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'byung ba yin no //
translated: “Monks, some śramaṇas and brāhmaṇas abandon the appropriation of desire, the appropriation of view, and the appropriation of morality and ascetic practices, but they do not abandon the appropriation of the doctrine of self.🔽”

original: gang zag slob ba dang / mi slob pa nas smon nas mi shes pa la sogs pa yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang zag slob ba dang / mi slob pa nas smon nas mi shes pa la sogs pa yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is a learner or a nonlearner, etc., will also obtain the noncognizer through prayer.

original: yongs su byang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dri ma med par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su byang bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dri ma med par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “It will be purified” means it will be made stainless.

original: yang ci'i phyir gus par chos mnyan par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gus par chos mnyan par bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one listen to the Dharma with respect?

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa 'dis so //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni tshigs su bcad pa 'dis so //
translated: “This” refers to this verse.

original: ji ltar go rims bzhin du zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar go rims bzhin du zhe na /
translated: How?

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba rnyed pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba rnyed pa ni /
translated: One who obtains the right view

original: thos pas chos rnams shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: thos pas chos rnams shes par 'gyur //
translated: knows the Dharma through listening.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the phrase: “by the power of hearing.”

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang brten pas sdig pa las yang dag par rgal ba ni thos pas sdig las ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig 'dis yongs su bstan to //🔽lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la yang dag par brten pas 'dod pa yang dag bar rgol ba ni /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang brten pas sdig pa las yang dag par rgal ba ni thos pas sdig las ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig 'dis yongs su bstan to // lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa la yang dag par brten pas 'dod pa yang dag bar rgol ba ni /
translated: “By the power of hearing, one turns away from evil” indicates that one crosses over evil by relying on the training in superior morality.

original: thos pas don med spong bar 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: thos pas don med spong bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan to //
translated: “By the power of hearing, one abandons the meaningless” indicates that one crosses over desire by relying on the training in superior mind.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la yang dag par brten pas yang srid pa las yang dag par brgal zhes bya ba ni thos pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig gis yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la yang dag par brten pas yang srid pa las yang dag par brgal zhes bya ba ni thos pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig gis yongs su bstan to //
translated: “By the power of hearing, one attains nirvana” indicates that one crosses over future rebirth by relying on the training in superior wisdom.

original: yang nyon mongs pa'i gnod pa'i rgyus @281b yin gyi 'dod pa'i gnod pa'i rgyus ni ma yin te /🔽ji skad du /
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa'i gnod pa'i rgyus @281b yin gyi 'dod pa'i gnod pa'i rgyus ni ma yin te / ji skad du /
translated: Moreover, one crosses over the harm of the afflictions, not the harm of desire.🔽As it is said:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: “It is like this:

original: 'di ni kha cig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ni kha cig ces bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba nas /
translated: This is the one who is called, etc.

original: 'dod pa don med par gyur pa rnams rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan ma thag pas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa don med par gyur pa rnams rab tu spong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan ma thag pas so //
translated: up to: he abandons the useless desires.

original: tshig bzhi dag gis go rims bzhin du yang dag pa'i lta ba rnyed pa dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'i phan yon rnam pa bzhi yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: tshig bzhi dag gis go rims bzhin du yang dag pa'i lta ba rnyed pa dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'i phan yon rnam pa bzhi yongs su bstan to //
translated: The four lines beginning with “having attained the right view” indicate the four benefits in the order in which they are mentioned.

original: yang phan yon rnam pa bzhi yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: yang phan yon rnam pa bzhi yongs su bstan te /
translated: Four more benefits are indicated.

original: tshig dang pos ni dad pa rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: tshig dang pos ni dad pa rnyed pa'o //
translated: The first line indicates the attainment of faith.

original: tshig gnyis pas ni rab tu 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: tshig gnyis pas ni rab tu 'byung ba'o //
translated: The second line indicates going forth.

original: tshig gsum pas ni dbang po'i sgo bsrung ba nyid la sogs pa'i rim pas zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gsum pas ni dbang po'i sgo bsrung ba nyid la sogs pa'i rim pas zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung pa'o //
translated: The third line indicates the stages of guarding the sense doors, etc.

original: tshig bzhi pas ni 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: tshig bzhi pas ni 'phags pa'i bden pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: The fourth line indicates the noble truths.

original: n+ya gro dha la sogs pa'i mdo sde rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: n+ya gro dha la sogs pa'i mdo sde rnams kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: This should be established by the Nyagrodha and other sutras.

original: ji skad du zhe na /
analyzed: ji skad du zhe na /
translated: How is it established?

original: n+ya gro dha 'jig rten 'dir ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /🔽bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: n+ya gro dha 'jig rten 'dir ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa / bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: “In this world, a teacher, a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly awakened one, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a sugata,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /🔽skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa / skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
translated: a knower of the world,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten 'dir 'byung zhing de'i chos thog mar dge ba /🔽bar du dge ba /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten 'dir 'byung zhing de'i chos thog mar dge ba / bar du dge ba /
translated: an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a blessed lord, appears in the world.

original: tha mar dge ba /🔽don bzang po //
analyzed: tha mar dge ba / don bzang po //
translated: He teaches the Dharma that is good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end.

original: tshig 'bru bzang po //🔽ma 'dres pa /🔽yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: tshig 'bru bzang po // ma 'dres pa / yongs su dag pa /
translated: It has good meaning, good phrasing,

original: yongs su byang ba /🔽tshangs par spyod pa yang dag par rab tu bstan pa ston la khyim bdag gam /
analyzed: yongs su byang ba / tshangs par spyod pa yang dag par rab tu bstan pa ston la khyim bdag gam /
translated: and expresses the pure, complete,🔽and refined spiritual life.

original: khyim bdag gi bu gang zhig chos de nyan pa des chos de thos nas dad pa rnyed do //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi bu gang zhig chos de nyan pa des chos de thos nas dad pa rnyed do //
translated: When a householder or householder’s son hears that Dharma, he gains faith.

original: de dad pa rnyed pa de dang ldan pas 'di ltar slob ste /
analyzed: de dad pa rnyed pa de dang ldan pas 'di ltar slob ste /
translated: Endowed with that faith, he trains like this:

original: khyim na gnas pa ni nyam nga ba rdul gyi gnas yin gyi /
analyzed: khyim na gnas pa ni nyam nga ba rdul gyi gnas yin gyi /
translated: “Living in a house is a dusty place of trouble,

original: rab tu byung ba ni skabs yod pa yin no //🔽khyim pa khyim na gnas pas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ma 'dres pa /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni skabs yod pa yin no // khyim pa khyim na gnas pas ji srid 'tsho'i bar du ma 'dres pa /
translated: but going forth is an opportunity.🔽“It is not easy for a householder to practice the holy life perfectly, in its entirety, and entirely pure for as long as life lasts.

original: yongs su rdzogs pa yongs su dag pa yongs su byang ba tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya ba 'di sla ba ma yin gyi ma la bdag longs spyod kyi phung po mang yang rung nyung yang rung ba spangs /
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa yongs su dag pa yongs su byang ba tshangs par spyod pa spyad par bya ba 'di sla ba ma yin gyi ma la bdag longs spyod kyi phung po mang yang rung nyung yang rung ba spangs /
translated: So, whether my possessions are many or few, I will give them up,

original: nye du'i 'khor mang yang rung nyung yang rung ba yang spangs nas /
analyzed: nye du'i 'khor mang yang rung nyung yang rung ba yang spangs nas /
translated: and whether my circle of relatives is large or small, I will give them up,

original: skra dang kha spu bregs te gos dur smrig bgos nas yang dag pa kho nar dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung bar bya'o snyam du des de ltar so sor rtog nas longs spyod kyi phung po mang yang rung nyung yang rung ba nas /
analyzed: skra dang kha spu bregs te gos dur smrig bgos nas yang dag pa kho nar dad pas khyim nas khyim med par rab tu byung bar bya'o snyam du des de ltar so sor rtog nas longs spyod kyi phung po mang yang rung nyung yang rung ba nas /
translated: shave off my hair and beard, don the yellow robe, and go forth from home to homelessness.”

original: yang dag pa kho nar dad pas khyim nas khyim med par @282a * //🔽rab tu 'byung bar byed do //🔽de de ltar rab tu byung ba dang lus dang ngag gis bsdams shing gnas la yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba la yongs su sbyor bar byed do //🔽de srog gcod pa spangs nas /
analyzed: yang dag pa kho nar dad pas khyim nas khyim med par @282a * // rab tu 'byung bar byed do // de de ltar rab tu byung ba dang lus dang ngag gis bsdams shing gnas la yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba la yongs su sbyor bar byed do // de srog gcod pa spangs nas /
translated: and with right faith he goes forth from home to homelessness.🔽Having gone forth, he lives restrained by the restraint of the rules, with good conduct, seeing danger in the slightest faults, observing the commitments he has taken on toward his preceptors and teachers, and toward his fellow monks living in harmony.

original: srog gcod pa las slar ldog ste /
analyzed: srog gcod pa las slar ldog ste /
translated: He gives up killing living beings and turns away from killing living beings.

original: dbyug ba spangs shing mtshon cha spangs la ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan zhing sems can 'byung po thams cad la snying brtse ba dang ldan pa dang / than srog chags grog sbur yan chad la yang srog gcod pa las slar ldog par byed do //
analyzed: dbyug ba spangs shing mtshon cha spangs la ngo tsha shes pa dang ldan zhing sems can 'byung po thams cad la snying brtse ba dang ldan pa dang / than srog chags grog sbur yan chad la yang srog gcod pa las slar ldog par byed do //
translated: He gives up sticks and swords, is full of sympathy for all living beings, and has conscientious scruples.

original: ma byin par len pa spangs nas ma byin par len pa las slar ldog ste /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa spangs nas ma byin par len pa las slar ldog ste /
translated: He gives up taking what is not given and turns away from taking what is not given.

original: byin pa len pa dang / sbyin pa la dga' ba dang / byin pa dang bor ba 'dod pa dang / mi rku ba dang / bdag nyid brkam chags mi byed pa'i kha na ma tho ba med par ma byin par len pa las slar ldog par byed do //
analyzed: byin pa len pa dang / sbyin pa la dga' ba dang / byin pa dang bor ba 'dod pa dang / mi rku ba dang / bdag nyid brkam chags mi byed pa'i kha na ma tho ba med par ma byin par len pa las slar ldog par byed do //
translated: He gives up taking what is not given and turns away from taking what is not given.

original: mi tshangs par spyod pa spangs nas /🔽mi tshangs par spyod pa las slar ldog ste /
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pa spangs nas / mi tshangs par spyod pa las slar ldog ste /
translated: He gives up sexual misconduct and turns away from sexual misconduct.

original: tshangs par spyod pa dang / mi chags par spyod pa dang / dag pa dang grong ba'i chos las ldog par byed do //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa dang / mi chags par spyod pa dang / dag pa dang grong ba'i chos las ldog par byed do //
translated: He practices pure conduct, celibacy, and avoids impure conduct.

original: brdzun du smra ba spangs nas brdzun du smra ba las slar ldog ste /
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba spangs nas brdzun du smra ba las slar ldog ste /
translated: He gives up false speech and turns away from false speech.

original: yid brtan par bya ba dang / yid ches par bya ba dang yid gcugs pa'i gnas dang / 'jig rten las mi slu zhing brdzun du smra ba las ldog par byed do //
analyzed: yid brtan par bya ba dang / yid ches par bya ba dang yid gcugs pa'i gnas dang / 'jig rten las mi slu zhing brdzun du smra ba las ldog par byed do //
translated: He is trustworthy, reliable, and honest, and does not deceive the world.

original: phra ma spangs nas phra ma las ldog ste /
analyzed: phra ma spangs nas phra ma las ldog ste /
translated: He gives up malicious speech and turns away from malicious speech.

original: de 'di dag las thos nas 'di dag dang dbye ba'i phyir de dag la mi smra /
analyzed: de 'di dag las thos nas 'di dag dang dbye ba'i phyir de dag la mi smra /
translated: Having heard it from them, he does not repeat it elsewhere in order to divide them from those others.

original: de dag las thos nas de dag dang dbye ba'i phyir 'di dag la mi smra zhing bye ba rnams kyang sdums byed /🔽mthun pa rnams kyi rjes su mthun par byed /
analyzed: de dag las thos nas de dag dang dbye ba'i phyir 'di dag la mi smra zhing bye ba rnams kyang sdums byed / mthun pa rnams kyi rjes su mthun par byed /
translated: Having heard it from those others, he does not repeat it to them in order to divide them from those others.🔽He reconciles those who are divided.

original: mthun pa la kun du dga'/
analyzed: mthun pa la kun du dga'/
translated: He approves of those who are in agreement.

original: mthun pa la dga'/
analyzed: mthun pa la dga'/
translated: He delights in those who are in agreement.

original: mthun par bya ba'i phyir tshig smra zhing phra ma las slar ldog par byed do //
analyzed: mthun par bya ba'i phyir tshig smra zhing phra ma las slar ldog par byed do //
translated: He speaks words that accord with agreement, and turns away from divisive speech.

original: tshig rtsub po spangs nas tshig rtsub po las slar ldog ste /
analyzed: tshig rtsub po spangs nas tshig rtsub po las slar ldog ste /
translated: Having abandoned harsh speech, he turns away from harsh speech.

original: tshig zher 'debs pa dang / rtsub pa dang / drag pa dang / pha rol nang par byed pa dang / skye bo mang po mi 'dod pa dang / skye bo mang po la mi sdug pa dang / skye bo mang po la mi dga' ba dang /
analyzed: tshig zher 'debs pa dang / rtsub pa dang / drag pa dang / pha rol nang par byed pa dang / skye bo mang po mi 'dod pa dang / skye bo mang po la mi sdug pa dang / skye bo mang po la mi dga' ba dang /
translated: He speaks words that are gentle, pleasing to the ear, and lovable, that reach the heart, are desirable, pleasing, and agreeable to people at large, that are not hurtful to others, and that do not enrage.

analyzed: de gang dang gang du 'gro bar lhung bzed dang bcas pa chos gos dang bcas te /

analyzed: dper na 'dab chags bya ni gang dang gang du 'phur bar 'dab ma dang bcas pa /

analyzed: de bzhin du gos lus khebs pas mgu zhing chog shes /

analyzed: zas lto 'grangs pas mgu zhing chog shes la /
translated: He is satisfied and content with food that fills his stomach.

original: gang dang gang du 'gro bar lhung bzed dang bcas chos gos dang bcas so //
analyzed: gang dang gang du 'gro bar lhung bzed dang bcas chos gos dang bcas so //

analyzed: de 'phags pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po 'di dang ldan pas dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsrungs shing gnas te /
