translated: and the evil unwholesome mental states of covetousness and unhappiness do not remain in his mind.

original: de rnams bsdams pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po sdom par byed do //
analyzed: de rnams bsdams pa'i phyir mig gi dbang po sdom par byed do //
translated: He guards the faculty of the eyes.

original: mig gi dbang po ji ltar sdom par byed pa bzhin du /
analyzed: mig gi dbang po ji ltar sdom par byed pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as he guards the faculty of the eyes,

original: rna ba nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du yang de bzhin du sdom par byed do //
analyzed: rna ba nas yid kyi dbang po'i bar du yang de bzhin du sdom par byed do //
translated: In the same way, he should restrain his ear faculty and so on up to his mind faculty.

original: 'phags pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po de dang ldan pa dang / dbang po'i sgo bsrungs pa de nyid kyis 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang shes bzhin du gnas par byed /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po de dang ldan pa dang / dbang po'i sgo bsrungs pa de nyid kyis 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang shes bzhin du gnas par byed /
translated: Endowed with that aggregate of noble morality and with that guarding of the sense doors, he should be mindful when going out and coming back;

original: 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / mi nyal ba dang / smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / gnyid dang / dub pa bsangs pa na shes bzhin du gnas par byed do //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / 'greng ba dang / 'dug pa dang / nyal ba dang / mi nyal ba dang / smra ba dang / mi smra ba dang / gnyid dang / dub pa bsangs pa na shes bzhin du gnas par byed do //
translated: he should be mindful when looking ahead and looking aside; he should be mindful when bending and stretching his limbs; he should be mindful when wearing his robes and carrying his alms bowl; he should be mindful when eating, drinking, chewing, and tasting; he should be mindful when defecating and urinating; he should be mindful when walking, standing, sitting, sleeping, waking, talking, and remaining silent.

original: de 'phags pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po dang ldan pa dang / dbang po'i sgo bsrungs pa 'di nyid dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas dgon pa dang / @283b nags tshal dang / ri khrod dang / bas mtha'i gnas mal dag tu gnas par byed cing de dgon par phyin kyang rung shing drung du phyin kyang rung skyil mo krung bcas nas lus drang por bsrang ste /🔽dran pa mngon du bzhag nas 'dug par byed do //
analyzed: de 'phags pa'i tshul khrims kyi phung po dang ldan pa dang / dbang po'i sgo bsrungs pa 'di nyid dang dran pa dang shes bzhin dang ldan pas dgon pa dang / @283b nags tshal dang / ri khrod dang / bas mtha'i gnas mal dag tu gnas par byed cing de dgon par phyin kyang rung shing drung du phyin kyang rung skyil mo krung bcas nas lus drang por bsrang ste / dran pa mngon du bzhag nas 'dug par byed do //
translated: Even when he has gone to the forest, or to the foot of a tree, or to an empty room, he sits down with his legs crossed, holding his body erect, and establishing mindfulness in front of him.

original: de 'jig rten la brnab sems spangs nas brnab sems dang bral ba'i sems kyis lan mang du gnas shing brnab sems la sems yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: de 'jig rten la brnab sems spangs nas brnab sems dang bral ba'i sems kyis lan mang du gnas shing brnab sems la sems yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
translated: He abandons worldly covetousness and, with a mind free of covetousness, he dwells pervading the entire world with a mind imbued with friendliness, boundless, vast, measureless, without enmity, without ill will, without rivalry, without contention.

original: 'jig rten la gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom spangs nas som nyi las rgal zhing the tshom las rgal ba dang / dge ba'i chos sems la yid gnyis med cing the tshom las sems yongs su spyod bar byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten la gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa dang / the tshom spangs nas som nyi las rgal zhing the tshom las rgal ba dang / dge ba'i chos sems la yid gnyis med cing the tshom las sems yongs su spyod bar byed do //
translated: He abandons malice, drowsiness, restlessness, regret, and doubt in the world, and having crossed over uncertainty and crossed over doubt, he has no doubt about virtuous qualities and his mind is completely purified of doubt.

original: sgrib pa lnga po sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga po sems nye bar nyon mongs par byed pa /
translated: The five hindrances are mental afflictions.

original: phongs pas nyam chung bar byed pa /
analyzed: phongs pas nyam chung bar byed pa /
translated: They are the weakness of poverty.🔽They are not the side of nirvana that is in accord with poverty.

original: phongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun par mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin par 'gyur ba spangs nas 'dod pa las dben pa /
analyzed: phongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun par mya ngan las 'das pa ma yin par 'gyur ba spangs nas 'dod pa las dben pa /
translated: He abandons them and is secluded from desire,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa /🔽dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos las dben pa rtog pa dang bcas pa / dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: secluded from evil, unwholesome states.🔽He has applied thought and has sustained thought.

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having attained the first absorption, which is accompanied by applied and sustained thought, with joy and bliss born of seclusion.

original: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste /
analyzed: de rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral zhing nang yongs su dang ste /
translated: He is devoid of applied thought and sustained thought, and his mind is internally serene.

original: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud gcig tu gyur pas rtog pa med pa /
translated: It is nonconceptual because the mind is one-pointed.🔽

original: dpyod pa med pa /
analyzed: dpyod pa med pa /
translated: Since the mind has become one-pointed, there is no thought and no analysis.

original: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan gnyis pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: With joy and bliss born of concentration, he achieves and remains in the second meditative concentration.

original: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang / shes bzhin can yin te /
analyzed: de dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang bral bas btang snyoms la gnas shing dran pa dang / shes bzhin can yin te /
translated: Free from attachment to joy, he remains in equanimity, mindful and aware,

original: bde ba lus kyis myong ba /🔽'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: bde ba lus kyis myong ba / 'phags pa rnams kyis gang de dran pa dang ldan pa /
translated: experiencing bliss with the body.

original: bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba la gnas pa btang snyoms pa'o zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: The noble ones describe this as “mindful, blissful abidance in equanimity.”

original: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: dga' ba med pa'i bsam gtan gsum pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: With no attachment to joy, he achieves and remains in the third meditative concentration.

original: de bde ba yang spangs te /
analyzed: de bde ba yang spangs te /
translated: He abandons bliss,

original: snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang / mi bde ba yang nub pas bde ba yang ma yin pa /🔽sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa /
analyzed: snga nas sdug bsngal yang spangs shing yid bde ba dang / mi bde ba yang nub pas bde ba yang ma yin pa /🔽sdug bsngal yang ma yin pa /
translated: and previously abandoned suffering. With the disappearance of mental pleasure and displeasure,🔽he achieves and remains in the fourth meditative concentration, which is neither blissful nor suffering, and is endowed with pure mindfulness and equanimity.

original: btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: btang snyoms dang dran pa yongs su dag pa bsam gtan bzhi pa rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: He dwells having attained the fourth meditation, which is purified in terms of equanimity and mindfulness.

original: des de ltar sems mnyam par gzhag cing yongs su dag pa /
analyzed: des de ltar sems mnyam par gzhag cing yongs su dag pa /
translated: In this way, his mind becomes concentrated, purified,

original: yongs su byang ba dang nyon mongs pa med pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / drang por gyur pa @284a * //
analyzed: yongs su byang ba dang nyon mongs pa med pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang bral ba dang / drang por gyur pa @284a * //
translated: luminous, unblemished, supple, wieldy, firm, and imperturbable.

original: dang / las su rung bar gnas pa dang / mi g-yo ba thob pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes par bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la sems mngon par gtod cing /
analyzed: dang / las su rung bar gnas pa dang / mi g-yo ba thob pa dang / zag pa zad pa shes par bya ba'i mngon par shes pa la sems mngon par gtod cing /
translated: He directs his mind to the supernormal knowledge with the knowledge of the destruction of the defilements.

original: des 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: des 'di ni sdug bsngal 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: He knows as it really is: “This is suffering, an āryan truth.”

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the origin of suffering.🔽This is the cessation of suffering.

original: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'di ni sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam 'phags pa'i bden pa'o zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: This is the path leading to the cessation of suffering, which is an āryan truth.”

original: de de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ba na 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa las /
analyzed: de de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong ba na 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa las /
translated: When he knows and sees thus, his mind is liberated from the defilement of sensuality,

original: sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: from the defilement of becoming, and from the defilement of ignorance.

original: bdag gi skye ba ni zad do //
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba ni zad do //
translated: He knows: “My births are destroyed,

original: tshangs par spyod pa ni spyad do //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ni spyad do //
translated: the holy life has been lived,🔽what had to be done has been done,

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan ni mi shes so zhes rnam par grol ba la rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan ni mi shes so zhes rnam par grol ba la rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba 'byung ngo //
translated: there is no more coming to any state of being.”

original: de ltar na n+ya gro dha'i mdos de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la dad pa rnyed pa dang / rab tu byung ba nas zag pa zad pa'i bar du bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na n+ya gro dha'i mdos de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la dad pa rnyed pa dang / rab tu byung ba nas zag pa zad pa'i bar du bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, through the Nyagrodha Sūtra, faith in the Dharma and Vinaya taught by the Tathāgata is attained, and from going forth, the destruction of the defilements is accomplished.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni mdo gzhan rtsis mkhan la sogs pa'i mdos kyang bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni mdo gzhan rtsis mkhan la sogs pa'i mdos kyang bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” indicates that other sūtras such as the Sūtra on the Reckoner should also be accomplished.

original: de ltar phan yon rnam pa mang po yang dag par mthong ba nyid kyis te /
analyzed: de ltar phan yon rnam pa mang po yang dag par mthong ba nyid kyis te /
translated: Thus, through seeing the many benefits,

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: what is it?

original: thos pas chos rnams shes par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: thos pas chos rnams shes par 'gyur // zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba gang yin pa ste /
translated: One understands phenomena through listening.🔽This is the extensive explanation.🔽

original: gus par chos nyan par bya'o /🔽// / rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa /🔽bam po bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: gus par chos nyan par bya'o / // / rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa / bam po bcu bzhi pa /
translated: One understands the Dharma through listening.

original: yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /🔽yang ni rnam grangs gzhan las kyang gus par chos mnyan par bya'o//🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la / yang ni rnam grangs gzhan las kyang gus par chos mnyan par bya'o// ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'dul ba ni legs par gsungs pa yin pas so //🔽slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud kyis 'ga' la yang bar chad ma byas par zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud kyis chos 'dul ba 'ga' la yang bar du bcad par ma byas par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽ji ltar na rten nyid kyis she na /🔽dbyangs yan lag lnga dang ldan pa can yang dag par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'dul ba ni legs par gsungs pa yin pas so //🔽slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud kyis 'ga' la yang bar chad ma byas par zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi dpe mkhyud kyis chos 'dul ba 'ga' la yang bar du bcad par ma byas par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽ji ltar na rten nyid kyis she na /🔽dbyangs yan lag lnga dang ldan pa can yang dag par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should listen to the Dharma with devotion.

original: 'di ltar dbyangs yan lag lnga dang ldan pa ni ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs gsung ba de'i rten yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbyangs yan lag lnga dang ldan pa ni ming dang / tshig dang / yi ge'i tshogs gsung ba de'i rten yin pas so //
translated: Thus, the five branches of melody are the basis for the teaching of the collections of names, sentences, and letters.

original: de ltar na rten nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis @284b chos 'dul ba legs par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rten nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis @284b chos 'dul ba legs par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Dharma and Vinaya of the Blessed One are well-spoken in terms of being a basis.

original: ji ltar na go bar mdzad pa nyid kyis she na /🔽dbyangs gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas par go bar mdzad pa yang dag par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar na go bar mdzad pa nyid kyis she na / dbyangs gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas par go bar mdzad pa yang dag par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: How are they well-spoken in terms of being understood?🔽Because they are well-spoken in terms of being understood in limitless world-realms with a single sound.

original: 'di ltar dbyangs gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas par go par mdzad pa de yang dag par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan yang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ji snyed pa la thug par go bar mdzad pa yang dag par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbyangs gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams mtha' yas par go par mdzad pa de yang dag par gsungs pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ji snyed pa la thug par go bar mdzad pa yang dag par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are well-spoken in terms of being understood in limitless world-realms with a single sound.🔽Moreover, they are well-spoken in terms of being understood in the entire circle of the assembly.

original: 'di ltar 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ji snyed pa la thug par go bar mdzad pa de yang dag par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor ji snyed pa la thug par go bar mdzad pa de yang dag par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are well-spoken in terms of being understood in the entire circle of the assembly.

original: de ltar na go bar mdzad pa nyid kyis te /🔽khong du chud par mdzad pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'dul ba ni legs par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na go bar mdzad pa nyid kyis te / khong du chud par mdzad pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'dul ba ni legs par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is well proclaimed by the Lord because it is understood,🔽because it is comprehended.

original: ji ltar na gdags pa nyid kyis shon /
analyzed: ji ltar na gdags pa nyid kyis shon /
translated: How is it well proclaimed by the Lord because it is designated?

original: mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i lam gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i lam gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the path that abandons the two extremes is taught.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i mtha' spangs pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gsungs pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa dang chad pa la sogs pa'i mtha' spangs pa'i 'phags pa'i lam gsungs pas so //
translated: Thus, because the noble path that abandons the extremes of eternalism and annihilationism, etc., is taught.

original: de ltar na gdags pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'dul ba ni legs par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gdags pa nyid kyis bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'dul ba ni legs par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is well proclaimed by the Lord because it is designated.🔽Because it teaches the roots of virtue.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma chags pa la sogs pa brtan por byed pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba ma chags pa la sogs pa brtan por byed pa ste /
translated: It makes the roots of virtue such as nonattachment firm,

original: 'phel ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'phel ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it is the cause of their increase.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa gong na med pa'i rjes las thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa gong na med pa'i rjes las thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The supramundane is twofold:

original: gong na med pa dang gong ma dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: gong na med pa dang gong ma dang bcas pa'o //
translated: unsurpassed and with a superior.

original: de la gong na med pa gang yin pa de'i rjes las thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la gong na med pa gang yin pa de'i rjes las thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here, it is the subsequent attainment of the unsurpassed.

original: stobs kyi yan lag dang ldan pa'i phyir nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis na snyen cing 'jebs pa'o //
analyzed: stobs kyi yan lag dang ldan pa'i phyir nges pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis na snyen cing 'jebs pa'o //
translated: It is pleasing and agreeable in the sense of the method of verbal expression because it possesses the branches of power.

original: sgrub pas nges par 'byin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci ltar gsungs pa de sgrub pas nges par 'byin pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrub pas nges par 'byin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ci ltar gsungs pa de sgrub pas nges par 'byin pa yin te /
translated: It is the means of deliverance through practice, because it is the means of deliverance through the practice of what is taught.

original: thar pa thob par byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thar pa thob par byed pa yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the means of attaining liberation.

original: bslab pa bca' ba'i thabs bde ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba dang / khyim pa'i bslab pa bca' ba de dag gis bde ba'i phyir mi rtsub pa yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa bca' ba'i thabs bde ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba dang / khyim pa'i bslab pa bca' ba de dag gis bde ba'i phyir mi rtsub pa yin no //
translated: It is not harsh because it is the means of prescribing the training happily, since the training of the laity and the training of those gone forth are prescribed happily by it, not harshly.

original: mi brlang ba ni de las 'das na nges par 'byung ba'i thabs yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar bslab pa de las 'das nas so sor bshags pa la sogs pa'i @285a * //
analyzed: mi brlang ba ni de las 'das na nges par 'byung ba'i thabs yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar bslab pa de las 'das nas so sor bshags pa la sogs pa'i @285a * //
translated: It is not harsh, because it teaches the means of definitely being freed from transgressing it.

original: thabs dag gis nges par 'byung ba yang dag par ston pa yin pas so //
analyzed: thabs dag gis nges par 'byung ba yang dag par ston pa yin pas so //
translated: Thus, it teaches the means of definitely being freed from transgressing that training by way of confession, etc.

original: yongs su gdung ba med pa ni sgrub pa la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med pa ni sgrub pa la 'gyod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not oppressive, because it is not a cause of regret for the one who practices it.

original: 'di ltar de'i don du sgrub pa'i sbyor ba la 'gyod pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i don du sgrub pa'i sbyor ba la 'gyod pa med pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is not a cause of regret for the one who practices it for the sake of that.

original: kun du shes par bya ba ni khong du chud par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
analyzed: kun du shes par bya ba ni khong du chud par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tshig go //
translated: It is to be fully understood, because it is to be comprehended.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that?🔽It is the basis for the perfection of knowledge that arises from hearing.

original: 'di ltar thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa don phyin ci ma log pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar thos pa las byung ba'i shes pa don phyin ci ma log pa phun sum tshogs pa'i rten yin pas so //
translated: Thus, it is the basis for the perfection of unmistaken knowledge that arises from hearing.

original: rang gi don rjes su thob pa rnams zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa rnams so //
analyzed: rang gi don rjes su thob pa rnams zhes bya ba ni dgra bcom pa rnams so //
translated: Those who have obtained their own aim are the Arhats.

original: kun shes par byed pa ni 'dis kun shes par byed pas ni kun shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: kun shes par byed pa ni 'dis kun shes par byed pas ni kun shes par byed pa'o //
translated: The faculty of final and perfect knowledge is the faculty of one who has complete knowledge.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas bzhi po 'di yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas bzhi po 'di yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it correctly teaches the four inconceivable points.

original: 'di ltar thos pa las byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag par ston pas so //🔽bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos de dag kyang ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas bzhi po 'di dag sems na myos par yang 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar thos pa las byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag par ston pas so // bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos de dag kyang ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i gnas bzhi po 'di dag sems na myos par yang 'gyur /
translated: Because it correctly teaches the inconceivable Dharma that arises from hearing.🔽The inconceivable Dharma is as stated by the Blessed One:

original: rmongs par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rmongs par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Monks, if one thinks about these four inconceivable points, one will become confused and deluded.

original: bzhi gang dag che na /
analyzed: bzhi gang dag che na /
translated: What are the four?

original: bdag la sems pa dang / sems can rnams kyi las dang rnam par smin pa la sems pa dang / 'jig rten la sems pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul yin no //
analyzed: bdag la sems pa dang / sems can rnams kyi las dang rnam par smin pa la sems pa dang / 'jig rten la sems pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi yul yin no //
translated: The domain of the Buddhas is the domain of the Buddhas.

original: mdo sde'i dum bu gnyis pa las bzhi po 'di dag ces bya ba las brtsams nas sems can rnams kyi las dang rnam par smin pa dang / bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi yul dang / rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi yul lo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde'i dum bu gnyis pa las bzhi po 'di dag ces bya ba las brtsams nas sems can rnams kyi las dang rnam par smin pa dang / bsam gtan pa rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi yul dang / rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa rnams kyi rdzu 'phrul gyi yul lo zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In the second chapter of the sutra, beginning with the words, “These four,” the domain of sentient beings’ karma and ripening, the domain of the meditative absorptions of the contemplatives, and the domain of the miracles of those who possess miraculous powers are taught.

original: rnam par rig par byed pa ni 'dis rnam par rig par byed pas na rnam par rig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig par byed pa ni 'dis rnam par rig par byed pas na rnam par rig par byed pa'o //
translated: The domain of the knowers is the domain of the knowers.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos de yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos de yang dag par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the inconceivable Dharma, because it is taught in an inconceivable way.

original: 'di ltar bsams pa las byung bas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsams pa las byung bas bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i chos yang dag par ston pa don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not meaningless to teach the inconceivable Dharma, since it arises from such reflection.

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is because it has a result, is the meaning.

original: ka la ping ka'i sgra dbyangs ni rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ka la ping ka'i sgra dbyangs ni rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the kalaviṅka bird is uninterrupted and imperishable.

original: ka la ping ka ni bya yin te /
analyzed: ka la ping ka ni bya yin te /
translated: The kalaviṅka bird is a bird.

original: de'i sgra dbyangs ni rtag par rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / 'jig pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i sgra dbyangs ni rtag par rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / 'jig pa'i phyir te /
translated: Its sound is uninterrupted and imperishable.

original: snyan pa'i @285b phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snyan pa'i @285b phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is pleasant, is the meaning.

original: 'grub pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i bkra shis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grub pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i bkra shis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is auspicious because it precedes all accomplishments.

original: 'di ltar shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs 'grub pa thams cad la bkra shis par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar grub pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis bkra shis pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar shang shang te'u'i sgra dbyangs 'grub pa thams cad la bkra shis par 'gyur ba dang 'dra bar grub pa thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba nyid kyis bkra shis pa yin no //
translated: Just as the sound of the kalaviṅka bird is auspicious for all accomplishments, so it is auspicious because it precedes all accomplishments.

original: rnga'i sgra ni bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnga'i sgra ni bdud dang phyir rgol ba thams cad las rnam par rgyal ba'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The sound of the drum is the forerunner of victory over all demons and adversaries.

original: 'di ltar bdud thams cad dang / phyir rgol ba thams cad las rnam par rgyal bar byed pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pas de'i phyir rnga'i sgra'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdud thams cad dang / phyir rgol ba thams cad las rnam par rgyal bar byed pa'i sngon du 'gro ba yin pas de'i phyir rnga'i sgra'o //
translated: Thus, it is the sound of the drum because it is the forerunner of victory over all demons and adversaries.

original: sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa ni brda sprod pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad la rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra thams cad kyi rjes su zhugs pa ni brda sprod pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad la rjes su zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the embodiment of all sounds because it is the embodiment of all aspects of the characteristics of all languages.

original: 'di ltar dbang pos byas pa la sogs pa'i brda sprod pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad la rjes su zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang pos byas pa la sogs pa'i brda sprod pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid rnam pa thams cad la rjes su zhugs pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is the embodiment of all aspects of the characteristics of all languages, such as those created by the gods, etc.

original: de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It has that characteristic.

original: de lta bas na mtshan nyid thams cad rjes su zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshan nyid thams cad rjes su zhugs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the embodiment of all characteristics.

original: tshig zur chag med pa ni bsnyel te de mi gsung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig zur chag med pa ni bsnyel te de mi gsung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is without distortion because it is not forgotten, since it is never silent.

original: 'di ltar bsnyel bas tshig zur chag de mi gsung bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bsnyel bas tshig zur chag de mi gsung bas so //
translated: because he does not speak with a stammering voice due to forgetfulness.

original: ma tshang ba med pa ni gdul bar bya ba la dus thams cad du nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar gdul ba'i bya ba la ste /
analyzed: ma tshang ba med pa ni gdul bar bya ba la dus thams cad du nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar gdul ba'i bya ba la ste /
translated: It is not deficient, because he is always present for those who are to be trained.🔽In this way, he is always present for the activities of those who are to be trained.

original: gleng ba dang / dran par bya ba dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / gdams pa'i chos bstan pa'i bya ba dag la dus thams cad du nye bar gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gleng ba dang / dran par bya ba dang / rjes su bstan pa dang / gdams pa'i chos bstan pa'i bya ba dag la dus thams cad du nye bar gnas pa ste /
translated: In the activities of teaching the Dharma, which consist of: conversation, recollection, instruction, and counsel.

original: ji ltar nyan thos kyis las rgya cher bstan pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos kyis las rgya cher bstan pa lta bu yin no //
translated: Just as it is for the disciples in the extensive teaching of the Dharma.

original: bsnyengs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsnyengs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'jigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because he is free from fear, means because he is free from fright.

original: chub ba ni sems can rnams kyis de dag gi don thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chub ba ni sems can rnams kyis de dag gi don thams cad sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is fulfilled, because he accomplishes all the aims of sentient beings.

original: 'di ltar des sems can rnams kyi don mtha' dag sgrub pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar des sems can rnams kyi don mtha' dag sgrub pas so //
translated: In this way, he accomplishes all the aims of sentient beings.

original: de lta bas na nges pa'i tshig gis na chub pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na nges pa'i tshig gis na chub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is fulfilled by means of the etymological explanation.

original: 'bel ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs su nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bel ba ni rnam pa sna tshogs su nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is connected because it is present in various forms.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa sna tshogs pa tshig dang yi ge'i rnam pa dag tu nye bar gnas pas so //🔽sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pas ni gsung gcig las sgra'i rnam pa du ma rnam par rig par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar rnam pa gcig gis sgra du ma rnam par rig par nye bar gnas pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa sna tshogs pa tshig dang yi ge'i rnam pa dag tu nye bar gnas pas so // sgra thams cad rdzogs par byed pas ni gsung gcig las sgra'i rnam pa du ma rnam par rig par nye bar gnas pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar rnam pa gcig gis sgra du ma rnam par rig par nye bar gnas pas so //
translated: It is present in various forms, in the aspects of words and letters.🔽It satisfies all faculties because it is present in the cognition of many aspects from a single sound.

original: dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa ni gcig las don du ma'i rnam par rig pa nye bar gnas @286a * //🔽pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di ltar gcig las don du ma'i rnam par rig pa nye bar gnas pas so //
analyzed: dbang po thams cad tshim par byed pa ni gcig las don du ma'i rnam par rig pa nye bar gnas @286a * // pa'i phyir ro // 'di ltar gcig las don du ma'i rnam par rig pa nye bar gnas pas so //
translated: It is present in the cognition of many aspects from a single sound.

original: ma smad pa ni dam bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma smad pa ni dam bcas pa ji lta ba bzhin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is irreproachable because it is in accordance with its promise.

original: 'di ltar ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pa gang yin pa de de kho na bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pa gang yin pa de de kho na bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa yin la /
translated: Whatever is taught in accordance with reality is just so, such as impermanence, etc.

original: yon tan gang gsungs pa de yang gsungs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
analyzed: yon tan gang gsungs pa de yang gsungs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
translated: And not only did he teach those qualities,

original: de kho na bzhin du bsgrubs pas so //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du bsgrubs pas so //
translated: but he also practiced them just as he taught.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ni 'jig rten pa don thams cad dpe'i chos su bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa ni 'jig rten pa don thams cad dpe'i chos su bsgyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is endowed with the best of all aspects because all mundane and supramundane aims are transformed into the Dharma of the Buddha.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i don thams cad dpe'i chos su sgyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa'i don thams cad dpe'i chos su sgyur ba ste /
translated: In this way, all mundane aims are transformed into the Dharma of the Buddha.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba bstan pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba bstan pa'i mdo las /
translated: As it says in the Sutra Teaching the Appearance of the Tathagata:

original: rgya mtshos bcom ldan 'das bsngags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rgya mtshos bcom ldan 'das bsngags pa lta bu'o //
translated: O Bhagavat, it is like the ocean.

original: de lta bas na rnam pa thams cad dang / chos mchog phul de dang ma bral ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam pa thams cad dang / chos mchog phul de dang ma bral ba'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because it is not separated from the best of all aspects and the best of all Dharmas, it is endowed with the best of all aspects.

original: de ltar na yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa de nyid kyis de bstan pa'i rnam pas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'dul ba legs par gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yon tan yongs su 'dzin pa de nyid kyis de bstan pa'i rnam pas bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'dul ba legs par gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Bhagavat's Dharma-Vinaya is well-spoken because it teaches that very possession of good qualities.

original: yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni yang ci'i phyir gus par chos mnyan par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni yang ci'i phyir gus par chos mnyan par bya zhe na /
translated: “Again” is stated because one should listen to the Dharma with devotion.

original: 'di ltar 'khor lo legs par sbyar ba yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khor lo legs par sbyar ba yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas so //
translated: “Again, because the wheel is well-constructed” is stated in detail.

original: don dam pa'i chos dang ma bral ba ni chos dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i chos skye ba dang mthun pa ni chos dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos dang ma bral ba ni chos dang ldan pa yin zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i chos skye ba dang mthun pa ni chos dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: “One who is not separated from the Dharma of ultimate reality is endowed with the Dharma” means that one who is endowed with the Dharma is in accord with the arising of the Dharma of ultimate reality.

original: rigs pa yang chos yin te /
analyzed: rigs pa yang chos yin te /
translated: Reason is also the Dharma.

original: ji skad du zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: As it is said, “The Dharma is the Dharma of reason.”

original: de lta bas na rigs pa'i chos dang ma bral ba ni chos dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rigs pa'i chos dang ma bral ba ni chos dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, one who is not separated from the Dharma of reason is endowed with the Dharma.

original: 'khor lo dang chos mthun pas 'khor lo yin no /
analyzed: 'khor lo dang chos mthun pas 'khor lo yin no /
translated: It is a wheel because it is similar to a wheel.

original: chos mthun pa de ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos mthun pa de ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is the similarity to a wheel?

original: sa gzhan du 'dril ba'o //
analyzed: sa gzhan du 'dril ba'o //
translated: It is the rolling on to another stage.

original: chos dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: One who is not endowed with the Dharma is not like that,

original: rigs pa'i chos dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa'i chos dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is separated from the Dharma of reason.

original: de rnams kyi thar pa'i thabs bstan pa de ni rang bzhin dang / skyes bu dang / nang gi shes pa la sogs pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi thar pa'i thabs bstan pa de ni rang bzhin dang / skyes bu dang / nang gi shes pa la sogs pa ston pa ste /
translated: The teaching of the method of liberation of those is the teaching of the nature, the person, inner consciousness, and so on.🔽

original: rigs pa dang bral ba yin no //🔽de ltar zhes bya ba ni ji skad du dus su dang / gus par zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs pa ltar ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang bral ba yin no // de ltar zhes bya ba ni ji skad du dus su dang / gus par zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs pa ltar ro //
translated: The method of liberation taught by them is devoid of reasoning, because it teaches that liberation is due to the nature of things, to the person, to internal consciousness, etc.

original: nyan pa'i dus na gzhan dang bdag rjes su 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: nyan pa'i dus na gzhan dang bdag rjes su 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Thus, at the time of listening, one should be concerned with the welfare of others and oneself.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'chad pa po'i bsam pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'chad pa po'i bsam pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The teacher should be concerned with the welfare of others and oneself.

original: bya ba gnyis dus gcig pa nyid du bsams pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba gnyis dus gcig pa nyid du bsams pa ste /
translated: The teacher should be concerned with two things at the same time:

original: smra ba'i bya ba dang / 'gro ba'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: smra ba'i bya ba dang / 'gro ba'i bya ba'o //
translated: the activity of teaching and the activity of going.

original: dper na mar @286b zos na brta bar byed do zhes bya ba yang zos pa nyid na brta bar mi byed par bsams pa'o //
analyzed: dper na mar @286b zos na brta bar byed do zhes bya ba yang zos pa nyid na brta bar mi byed par bsams pa'o //
translated: For example, when it is said, “One becomes strong by eating butter,” it is not the eating that makes one strong, but the strength that results from eating butter.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of the expression “one becomes strong by eating butter”?

original: mar zos pa'i rgyus brta bar byed do zhes bya ba bsams pa yin no /
analyzed: mar zos pa'i rgyus brta bar byed do zhes bya ba bsams pa yin no /
translated: It means that one becomes strong by the cause of eating butter.

original: skal ba med par lta ba log par zhugs pa dang / rna ma blags pa yang chos bstan pa la gus par nyan pa med na mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: skal ba med par lta ba log par zhugs pa dang / rna ma blags pa yang chos bstan pa la gus par nyan pa med na mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: It is the same for those who are unfortunate, who have entered into false views, and who are not attentive, for they do not listen respectfully to the teaching of the Dharma.

original: de lta bas na long ba dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na long ba dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: That is why the root text says that it is like a blind man, and so on.🔽Faith is acquired with regard to the five benefits and the three trainings together with their actions.

original: phan pa rnam pa lnga la yang dad pa rnyed pa dang / las dang bcas pa'i bslab pa gsum las brtsams par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dad pa rnyed pa las brtsams par rig par bya zhing las dang bcas pa'i bslab pa gsum las brtsams par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phan pa rnam pa lnga la yang dad pa rnyed pa dang / las dang bcas pa'i bslab pa gsum las brtsams par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dad pa rnyed pa las brtsams par rig par bya zhing las dang bcas pa'i bslab pa gsum las brtsams par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Faith is acquired with regard to the five benefits and the three trainings together with their actions.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is that?

original: de la dad pa rnyed pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: de la dad pa rnyed pa las brtsams nas /
translated: With regard to the acquisition of faith,

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung la dad pa bskyed pas gdul ba'i rgyud bangs par byed pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa ni phan pa dang so sor rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung la dad pa bskyed pas gdul ba'i rgyud bangs par byed pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa ni phan pa dang so sor rig par bya'o //
translated: the stream of those to be trained is moistened by the generation of faith in the Buddha's word, which is called the benefit of faith.

original: las dang bcas pa'i bslab pa dang po lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: las dang bcas pa'i bslab pa dang po lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa las brtsams nas /
translated: The first training together with its activity, beginning with the training in superior morality, is called “the removal of the stain of immorality.”

original: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma sel ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa ni phan pa gnyis par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma sel ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa ni phan pa gnyis par rig par bya ste /
translated: This should be known as the second benefit.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i las ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma sel ba yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa'i las ni 'chal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma sel ba yin no //
translated: The activity of the training in superior morality is the removal of the stain of immorality.

original: las dang bcas pa'i bslab pa gnyis pa lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: las dang bcas pa'i bslab pa gnyis pa lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa las brtsams nas /
translated: The second training together with its activity, beginning with the training in superior mind, is called “the removal of the burning of desire.”

original: 'dod pa'i yongs su gdung ba sel ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa ni phan pa gsum par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yongs su gdung ba sel ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa ni phan pa gsum par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the third benefit.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'i las ni 'dod pa'i yongs su gdung ba sel ba ste /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa'i las ni 'dod pa'i yongs su gdung ba sel ba ste /
translated: The activity of the training in superior mind is the removal of the burning of desire.

original: med par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: med par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is the removal of the burning of desire.

original: las dang byed pa'i bslab pa gsum pa lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa las brtsams nas /
analyzed: las dang byed pa'i bslab pa gsum pa lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa las brtsams nas /
translated: The third training together with its activity, beginning with the training in superior wisdom, is called “the removal of the darkness of nescience.”

original: yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba gang yin pa ni phan pa bzhi pa dang / lnga pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa zhi bar byed pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba gang yin pa ni phan pa bzhi pa dang / lnga pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The fourth and fifth benefits should be understood as the pacification of craving for future existence and the generation and increase of the qualities of the wings of enlightenment.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa de'i las ni yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa zhi bar byed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i yon tan rnams skyed pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'i las can yin no //🔽skyes pa ni de rnams 'byung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa de'i las ni yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa zhi bar byed pa dang / byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i yon tan rnams skyed pa dang / 'phel bar byed pa'i las can yin no // skyes pa ni de rnams 'byung bar byed pa'o //
translated: The function of the training in higher wisdom is the pacification of craving for future existence, the generation of the qualities of the wings of enlightenment, and the increase of those already generated.🔽It generates those not yet arisen.

original: 'phel bar byed pa ni skyes pa rnams rgyas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'phel bar byed pa ni skyes pa rnams rgyas par byed pa'o //
translated: It increases those already arisen.

original: skyo bar byed pa @287a * //
analyzed: skyo bar byed pa @287a * //
translated: It causes disgust.

original: rnams dang / the tshom zos pa dang / lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams la lam dang lam ma yin pa yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skyon gyi the tshom zos pa'i lam la zhugs pa rnams dang / lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams la yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnams dang / the tshom zos pa dang / lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams la lam dang lam ma yin pa yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni skyon gyi the tshom zos pa'i lam la zhugs pa rnams dang / lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams la yang dag par rab tu ston pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and those who have doubts and those who have entered bad paths, because it correctly shows the path and what is not the path. This means that it correctly shows the path to those who have entered the path because of the fault of doubt and to those who have entered bad paths.

original: ras 'gul ba dang / dri ma can dang / thag thug nyid kyi skyon gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gul ba nyid kyi skyon gyi phyir dang / dri ma can gyi skyon gyi phyir dang / thag thug nyid kyi skyon gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ras 'gul ba dang / dri ma can dang / thag thug nyid kyi skyon gyi phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gul ba nyid kyi skyon gyi phyir dang / dri ma can gyi skyon gyi phyir dang / thag thug nyid kyi skyon gyi phyir ro //
translated: Because of the faults of shaking, being soiled, and being obstructed. This means because of the fault of shaking, because of the fault of being soiled, and because of the fault of being obstructed.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba dang sgrib pa dang sngon gyi sgrib pas zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng bas 'gul ba'i skyon dang / sgrib pas dri ma can nyid kyi skyon dang / sngon gyi las kyi sgrib pas mi mnyam pa nyid kyi skyon no //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba dang sgrib pa dang sngon gyi sgrib pas zhes bya ba ni rnam par g-yeng bas 'gul ba'i skyon dang / sgrib pas dri ma can nyid kyi skyon dang / sngon gyi las kyi sgrib pas mi mnyam pa nyid kyi skyon no //
translated: Distraction, obscuration, and prior obscuration are, respectively, the fault of instability due to distraction, the fault of impurity due to obscuration, and the fault of unevenness due to prior karmic obscuration.

original: blun po ni ste /
analyzed: blun po ni ste /
translated: The foolish,

original: glen pa ni ston pa'i yon tan gyis kyang chos bstan pa'i lam mi rnyed do //
analyzed: glen pa ni ston pa'i yon tan gyis kyang chos bstan pa'i lam mi rnyed do //
translated: the dull-witted, do not find the path of teaching the Dharma even through the teacher’s qualities.

original: 'ga' zhig lam log par zhugs na yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig lam log par zhugs na yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba nas /
translated: Even if some enter the wrong path,

original: dag gyur 'di yin zhes bya ba nas 'dod pa 'ang srid ces bya ba'i bar ni gnas brtan mkhol gyis 'jig rten de kho na nyid la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dag gyur 'di yin zhes bya ba nas 'dod pa 'ang srid ces bya ba'i bar ni gnas brtan mkhol gyis 'jig rten de kho na nyid la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to “this is the purification,” and “it is possible to desire,” are stated by the elder Upagupta in order to engage the world in reality.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang de'i snyan dang gas 'ga' zhig lam log par ni zhugs na yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba bdag nyid kyis snyan dngags /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang de'i snyan dang gas 'ga' zhig lam log par ni zhugs na yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba bdag nyid kyis snyan dngags /
translated: The master also says, “Even if some enter the wrong path,” and so on, in his own composition.

original: yon tan de gsum zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba bcus thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung gi ched du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yon tan de gsum zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba bcus thub pa'i dbang po'i gsung gi ched du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The three qualities are taught in the ten extensive topics, which are the speech of the Lord of Sages.🔽

original: de la yon tan gsum ni tshigs su bcad pa las dman te /🔽ldog pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dpyod pa dang / 'dod pa tsam yang skye ba zhes bya bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la yon tan gsum ni tshigs su bcad pa las dman te / ldog pa'i rgyur gyur pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba dpyod pa dang / 'dod pa tsam yang skye ba zhes bya bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The three virtues are mentioned in the verse.🔽The three virtues are mentioned in the verse.🔽The three virtues are mentioned in the verse.🔽The three virtues are mentioned in the verse.🔽The three virtues are mentioned in the verse.🔽The three virtues are mentioned in the verse.

translated: The virtue of protection is the virtue of abandoning the evil destinies.🔽The virtue of protection

original: de'i sman 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni mir bya ba'i sman gang yin pa de don du gnyer bas so //
analyzed: de'i sman 'dod pas zhes bya ba ni mir bya ba'i sman gang yin pa de don du gnyer bas so //
translated: The phrase because of desiring its medicine means because of seeking whatever is the medicine for the body.

original: lus dang 'dra ba'i nad med ces bya ba ni lus dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus dang 'dra ba'i nad med ces bya ba ni lus dang 'dra ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase the body-like disease means the disease that is like the body.

original: 'dis ni lus kyi nad 'di la skyon drug po na ba dang 'brel pa nyid ni sdug bsngal myong zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: 'dis ni lus kyi nad 'di la skyon drug po na ba dang 'brel pa nyid ni sdug bsngal myong zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: This passage shows that the body's disease has six faults: (1) It is related to pain, as the phrase experience of suffering indicates.

original: lus thams cad la khyab pa nyid ni khyab pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: lus thams cad la khyab pa nyid ni khyab pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: (2) It pervades the entire body, as the phrase pervasiveness indicates.

original: bar chad med par 'jug pa nyid ni rtag pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: bar chad med par 'jug pa nyid ni rtag pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: (3) It is uninterrupted, as the phrase constancy indicates.

original: gsor mi rung ba nyid ni thabs med ces bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: gsor mi rung ba nyid ni thabs med ces bya ba 'dis so //
translated: (4) It is incurable, as the phrase no remedy indicates.

original: gnod pa mang ba nyid ni gnod pa mang ba zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: gnod pa mang ba nyid ni gnod pa mang ba zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: (5) It is a great harm, as the phrase great harm indicates.

original: srog 'phrog pa nyid ni 'joms byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: srog 'phrog pa nyid ni 'joms byed pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: (6) It is a killer, as the phrase destroyer indicates.

original: gtan du 'byin par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni gtan du phyis mi skyo bar byed pas na gtan du 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gtan du 'byin par byed pa yin zhes bya ba ni gtan du phyis mi skyo bar byed pas na gtan du 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: It is a permanent removal, because it is a removal that is not subject to future arising.

original: yan lag brgyad ldan pa /
analyzed: yan lag brgyad ldan pa /
translated: The collection of substances that is endowed with eight parts

original: rdzas kyi tshogs zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i rdzas kyi tshogs so//
analyzed: rdzas kyi tshogs zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa'i rdzas kyi tshogs so//
translated: The collection of substances that is endowed with eight parts is the noble path that is endowed with the eight parts.

original: @288a * // nam yang bsgrub par mi nus so //
analyzed: @288a * // nam yang bsgrub par mi nus so //
translated: It is never possible to accomplish

original: lan 'ga' yang bsgrub bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lan 'ga' yang bsgrub bar mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is never possible to accomplish, that is, it is never possible to obtain.🔽From what does it arise?

original: de yang gang las 'byung zhe na zhes bya ba ni sdang dang bag med rmongs na go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: de yang gang las 'byung zhe na zhes bya ba ni sdang dang bag med rmongs na go rims bzhin du /
translated: From aversion, from heedlessness, and from confusion, respectively,

original: dad dang skye dang rtogs pas te //🔽zhes bya ba gang yin pa de'o //
analyzed: dad dang skye dang rtogs pas te // zhes bya ba gang yin pa de'o //
translated: faith, birth, and understanding arise.

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan thos na mnyan pa'i rgyu skyo ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan thos na mnyan pa'i rgyu skyo ba 'byung ngo //
translated: When one hears about the virtues of the Three Jewels, aversion arises as the cause of listening.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of aversion?

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi chos ni legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das de ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi chos ni legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos kyi dge 'dun ni legs par zhugs pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The phrase “The Blessed One is thus” occurs in the passage that begins with the words “The Blessed One is thus,” and continues, “The Dharma of the Blessed One is well-proclaimed,” and concludes, “The community of the Blessed One’s disciples is well-directed.”

original: skyon ni sdig 'dod srid rten can //
analyzed: skyon ni sdig 'dod srid rten can //
translated: The faults are the basis for sin, desire, and existence.

original: skyon gang la rten sdig pa dang // 'dod pa dang srid pa yod pa de ni sdig pa dang / 'dod pa dang / srid pa'i rten can te /
analyzed: skyon gang la rten sdig pa dang // 'dod pa dang srid pa yod pa de ni sdig pa dang / 'dod pa dang / srid pa'i rten can te /
translated: The basis for sin, desire, and existence is the basis for sin, desire, and existence.

original: de thos na mnyan pa'i dngos po'i rgyu skyo ba 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de thos na mnyan pa'i dngos po'i rgyu skyo ba 'byung ngo //
translated: When one hears about it, one becomes disgusted with the things that are to be heard.

original: sdig pa dang 'dod pa rnams dang srid pa'i yin no zhes bya ba ni de la sdig pa ni tshul khrims nyams pa yin no //
analyzed: sdig pa dang 'dod pa rnams dang srid pa'i yin no zhes bya ba ni de la sdig pa ni tshul khrims nyams pa yin no //
translated: The basis for sin, desire, and existence is the basis for sin, desire, and existence.

original: de'i skyon ni gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i skyon ni gsod pa dang 'ching ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The faults of that basis are killing, binding, and so on.

original: 'dod pa ni dngos po'i 'dod pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa ni dngos po'i 'dod pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: Desire is desire for things and desire for the defilements.

original: de rnams kyi skyon ni ji skad du mdo las /
analyzed: de rnams kyi skyon ni ji skad du mdo las /
translated: The faults of these are as stated in the sutra:

original: 'dod pa'i rgyu dang / 'dod pa'i gzhi dang / 'dod pa dbang du bya bas ma dang bu lta bu lhan cig rtsod par byed do zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyu dang / 'dod pa'i gzhi dang / 'dod pa dbang du bya bas ma dang bu lta bu lhan cig rtsod par byed do zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: “Because of desire, on account of desire, and being dominated by desire, mother and son, as well as sisters, will fight each other. ”

original: srid pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
analyzed: srid pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o //
translated: Existence is the five aggregates of attachment.

original: de'i skyon ni /
analyzed: de'i skyon ni /
translated: The faults of these are:

original: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / mya ngan la sogs pa'o //
translated: birth, old age, death, sorrow, and so on.

original: de ltar na skyon rnam pa gsum po de ni sdig pa dang / 'dod pa dang / srid pa'i rten can yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na skyon rnam pa gsum po de ni sdig pa dang / 'dod pa dang / srid pa'i rten can yin no //
translated: Thus, these three faults are based on evil, desire, and existence.

original: mtshan nyid rnam gnyis ni phung po la sogs pa dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid rnam gnyis ni phung po la sogs pa dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid dang / spyi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The two characteristics are the specific characteristics of the aggregates, etc., and their general characteristics.

original: de la re zhig phung po lnga po rnams kyi re re'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba'i phyir dang / myong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig phung po lnga po rnams kyi re re'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba'i phyir dang / myong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: First, the specific characteristics of each of the five aggregates are, respectively, that which can be physically impacted, that which experiences, that which cognizes, that which conditions, and that which is aware.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Their general characteristics are impermanence, etc.

original: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig la sogs pa dag gi rang gi mtshan nyid ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i rten gzugs dang ba'o //
translated: Similarly, the specific characteristics of the eye, etc., are the clear form that is the basis of the eye consciousness, etc.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Their general characteristics are impermanence, etc.

original: mig gi khams la sogs pa dag gi yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: mig gi khams la sogs pa dag gi yang de bzhin te /
translated: The same is true of the eye constituent, etc.

original: de lta bu'i don de'i nges pa thob nas so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don de'i nges pa thob nas so //
translated: Having attained certainty about such an object,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i @288b mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs la sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis po dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don gyi nges pa thob nas so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i @288b mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni ma rig pa dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa dang / ming dang gzugs la sogs pa srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis po dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi don gyi nges pa thob nas so //
translated: The characteristic of the connection between cause and effect is the ascertainment of the meaning of the characteristic of the connection between cause and effect of the twelve members of existence, i.e., ignorance, the formative forces, consciousness, name-and-form, etc.

original: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don gyi nges pa thob nas gnyen po'i dngos po'i rgyu rtogs pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba la sogs pa 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po dag gi rgyu dang 'bras bur 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don gyi nges pa thob nas gnyen po'i dngos po'i rgyu rtogs pa 'byung ngo //
translated: The ascertainment of the meaning of the characteristic of the connection between cause and effect of the four noble truths, i.e., suffering, origination, etc., is the realization of the cause of the entity that is the counteragent.

original: de bas na yon tan 'di dag ni dam pa'i chos mnyan na yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na yon tan 'di dag ni dam pa'i chos mnyan na yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, these qualities should be known as existing when the true Dharma is listened to.

original: de la gus par bya'o //
analyzed: de la gus par bya'o //
translated: One should be devoted to it.

original: nyan pa'i skye bo dag ni phal cher phyir phyogs pa dang / nyan pa'i skye bo dag ni phal cher te mang du legs par bshad pa 'di dag las phyir phyogs pa de dag ni nyan pa'i skye bo dag ni phal cher phyir phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyan pa'i skye bo dag ni phal cher phyir phyogs pa dang / nyan pa'i skye bo dag ni phal cher te mang du legs par bshad pa 'di dag las phyir phyogs pa de dag ni nyan pa'i skye bo dag ni phal cher phyir phyogs pa'o //
translated: Most of the people who listen turn away from these good explanations, and most of the people who listen turn away from these good explanations.

original: yongs su 'dzin par byed pa phal cher 'das pa dang / legs par bshad pa 'di dag yongs su 'dzin par byed pa phal cher 'das pa de dag ni yongs su 'dzin par byed pa phal cher 'das pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su 'dzin par byed pa phal cher 'das pa dang / legs par bshad pa 'di dag yongs su 'dzin par byed pa phal cher 'das pa de dag ni yongs su 'dzin par byed pa phal cher 'das pa'o //
translated: Most of the people who uphold these good explanations have passed away, and most of the people who uphold these good explanations have passed away.

original: nye bar rnam par bshad pa dag gis mthu bcom zhing /
analyzed: nye bar rnam par bshad pa dag gis mthu bcom zhing /
translated: Their power is destroyed by the explanations of faults.

original: legs par bshad pa 'di dag gis mthu ste nus pa bcom pa de dag ni mthu bcom pa'o //
analyzed: legs par bshad pa 'di dag gis mthu ste nus pa bcom pa de dag ni mthu bcom pa'o //
translated: The power, the ability, of these good explanations is destroyed.

original: gang dag gis she na /🔽nyes pa rnam par bshad pa dag gis te /
analyzed: gang dag gis she na / nyes pa rnam par bshad pa dag gis te /
translated: By whom?🔽By the explanations of faults.

original: log par rnam par bshad pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: log par rnam par bshad pa dag gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: By the wrong explanations, is what it means.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni deng sang zhes smos pa'i phyir deng sang phyogs gnyis la ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni deng sang zhes smos pa'i phyir deng sang phyogs gnyis la ste /
translated: This verse shows that the teaching of the Buddha is now declining in two ways,

original: khyim pa'i phyogs dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yongs su nyams pa rnam pa bzhi las khyim pa'i phyogs la ni gcig / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la ni gsum du ston to /
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa yongs su nyams pa rnam pa bzhi las khyim pa'i phyogs la ni gcig / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la ni gsum du ston to /
translated: in the way of the householder and in the way of the monk.

original: nub la thug pa nyid du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: nub la thug pa nyid du ston pa yin no //
translated: It shows that the decline will continue until the end.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is it that the teaching of the Buddha is declining?

original: nyan pa'i skye bo dag ni phal cher phyir phyogs dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas so //
analyzed: nyan pa'i skye bo dag ni phal cher phyir phyogs dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas so //
translated: Because the people who listen to the teaching are mostly turned away.

original: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: de nyid la zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la'o //
translated: In the way of the monk,

analyzed: bkra shis kyi 'byung khungs yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bkra shis kyi 'byung gnas zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: don bzang ba nyid kyis brjod par bya ba phun sum tshogs pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is excellent in meaning, it is perfect in what is to be expressed.

original: nyon mongs pa'i dug thams cad sel bar mdzad pa'i don gyis te zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dug thams cad sel ba'i don sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'di la yod pas 'di ni nyon mongs pa'i dug thams cad zhi bar mdzad pa'i don to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i dug thams cad sel bar mdzad pa'i don gyis te zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dug thams cad sel ba'i don sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'di la yod pas 'di ni nyon mongs pa'i dug thams cad zhi bar mdzad pa'i don to //
translated: Because it has the meaning of removing all the poisons of the afflictions, this Buddha speech has the meaning of removing all the poisons of the afflictions, so it is the meaning of pacifying all the poisons of the afflictions.

original: 'phags pa'i nor bdun sgrub pa'i phyir nor dang ldan pa ni nor bdun ni dad pa'i nor dang / tshul khrims kyi nor dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i nor dang / khrel yod pa'i nor dang / thos pa'i nor dang / gtong ba'i nor dang /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nor bdun sgrub pa'i phyir nor dang ldan pa ni nor bdun ni dad pa'i nor dang / tshul khrims kyi nor dang / ngo tsha shes pa'i nor dang / khrel yod pa'i nor dang / thos pa'i nor dang / gtong ba'i nor dang /
translated: Because it accomplishes the seven noble riches, it is endowed with riches. The seven riches are the riches of faith, ethics, conscience, shame, learning, generosity,

original: shes rab kyi nor ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi nor ro //
translated: and wisdom.

original: skyon bdun 'khru ba'i phyir bsod nams ni skyon bdun ni phra rgyas bdun te /
analyzed: skyon bdun 'khru ba'i phyir bsod nams ni skyon bdun ni phra rgyas bdun te /
translated: The seven stains are the seven latent proclivities.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas dang / khong khro ba'i phra rgyas dang / nga rgyal gyi phra rgyas dang / ma rig pa'i phra rgyas dang / lta ba'i phra rgyas dang / the tshom gyi phra rgyas so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas dang / khong khro ba'i phra rgyas dang / nga rgyal gyi phra rgyas dang / ma rig pa'i phra rgyas dang / lta ba'i phra rgyas dang / the tshom gyi phra rgyas so //
translated: The latent proclivity of desire realm attachment, the latent proclivity of existence attachment, the latent proclivity of anger, the latent proclivity of pride, the latent proclivity of ignorance, the latent proclivity of views, and the latent proclivity of doubt.🔽It is auspicious because it is the forerunner of all good qualities.

original: yon tan thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir bkra shis pa nyid ni 'di ltar 'jig rten pa de dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba ste snga ltas yin pas de'i phyir bkra shis pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba'i phyir bkra shis pa nyid ni 'di ltar 'jig rten pa de dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yon tan thams cad kyi sngon du 'gro ba ste snga ltas yin pas de'i phyir bkra shis pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is auspicious because it is the forerunner, the harbinger, of all mundane and supramundane good qualities.🔽It is beneficial for life because it is the basis of the eternal brahma-charya.

original: gtan gyi tshangs par spyod pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir tshe la phan pa ni 'di ltar 'dir gtan gyi tshangs par spyod pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: gtan gyi tshangs par spyod pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir tshe la phan pa ni 'di ltar 'dir gtan gyi tshangs par spyod pa'i dbang du mdzad pa yin te /
translated: It is beneficial for life because it is the basis of the eternal brahma-charya here.

original: ji skad du thog mar dge ba zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du thog mar dge ba zhes bya ba rgya cher gsungs pa lta bu yin no //
translated: As it is said, “First, it is wholesome.”

original: de lta bas na tshe la phan pa'i phyir tshe la phan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na tshe la phan pa'i phyir tshe la phan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is beneficial for life because it benefits life.

original: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa ni ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: Natural purity is purity by nature.

original: dgongs pa 'jam pa zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dgongs pa 'jam pa zhes bya ba ni bcos ma ma yin pa'o //
translated: Gentle intention is not artificial.

original: don dang mthun @289b pa ni tshig 'bru bzang po nyid kyis so //
analyzed: don dang mthun @289b pa ni tshig 'bru bzang po nyid kyis so //
translated: In accordance with the meaning is good wording.

original: 'dul ba dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni skal ba ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa nyid kyis so //
translated: In accordance with discipline is teaching according to fortune.

original: dus la bab pa zhes bya ba ni rgyud yongs su smin pa la yongs su bstan pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dus la bab pa zhes bya ba ni rgyud yongs su smin pa la yongs su bstan pa nyid kyis so //
translated: In a timely manner is teaching to a fully ripened continuum.

original: ran par bshad pa zhes bya ba ni ji srid du gdul ba'i mdzad pa nyid kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: ran par bshad pa zhes bya ba ni ji srid du gdul ba'i mdzad pa nyid kyi bar du'o //
translated: Appropriate explanation is up to the point of taming activity.

original: 'du byed pa'i khyad par gyis ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba gnyis 'bad pa dang mi 'bad pa mngon par 'dus byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed pa'i khyad par gyis ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba gnyis 'bad pa dang mi 'bad pa mngon par 'dus byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the distinction of formations, both wholesome and unwholesome are due to the exertion and non-exertion of formation.

original: 'di ltar dge ba ni 'bad pas mngon sum du bya ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba ni 'bad pas mngon sum du bya ba yin la /
translated: Thus, virtue is directly realized through effort,

original: mi dge ba ni ma 'bad par ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni ma 'bad par ro //
translated: and nonvirtue is directly realized without effort.

original: rnam pa'i khyad par gyis ni zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin dang / phyin ci log pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par gyis ni zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin dang / phyin ci log pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As for the distinction of aspect, virtue has the aspect of reality, and nonvirtue has the aspect of what is contrary to reality.

original: dge ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis dmigs par byed la /
analyzed: dge ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag gis dmigs par byed la /
translated: Virtue is observed through the aspects of impermanence, etc., in accordance with reality.

original: mi dge ba ni gtsang ba dang bde ba la sogs pa dag gis so //
analyzed: mi dge ba ni gtsang ba dang bde ba la sogs pa dag gis so //
translated: Nonvirtue is observed through the aspects of purity, pleasure, etc.

original: mtshungs par ldan pa'i khyad par gyis ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni dge ba thams cad ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pa'i khyad par gyis ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni dge ba thams cad ni dge ba'i rtsa ba gsum po ma chags pa dang / zhe sdang med pa dang / gti mug med pa rnams dang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: As for the distinction of concomitance, all virtue is concomitant with the three roots of virtue: nonattachment, nonhatred, and nonignorance.

original: mi dge ba ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis po ma rig pa dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig dang ngam /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gnyis po ma rig pa dang / 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba gnyis las gang yang rung ba zhig dang ngam /
translated: Nonvirtue is associated with any of the two roots of nonvirtue, ignorance, attachment, or hostility.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig tu ma rig pa dang yang mtshungs par ldan no //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba gcig tu ma rig pa dang yang mtshungs par ldan no //
translated: Nonvirtue is associated with one root of nonvirtue, ignorance.

original: sa'i khyad par gyis ni sa thams cad dang sa gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa'i khyad par gyis ni sa thams cad dang sa gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is associated with all levels bhumi and with one level.

original: dge ba ni skye ba'i sa dgu char du yang yin te /
analyzed: dge ba ni skye ba'i sa dgu char du yang yin te /
translated: Virtue is associated with nine levels of its own bhumi,

original: 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du'o //
translated: from the desire realm to the summit of existence.

original: mi dge ba ni sa gcig pa ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni sa gcig pa ste /
translated: Nonvirtue is associated with one level,

original: 'dod pa'i khams kho nar ro//🔽'bras bu'i rnam grangs kyi khyad par gyis ni 'bras bu rnam pa lnga dang bzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kho nar ro// 'bras bu'i rnam grangs kyi khyad par gyis ni 'bras bu rnam pa lnga dang bzhi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the desire realm alone.🔽It is associated with five and four results.

original: dge ba'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i 'bras bu ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The results of virtue are fivefold.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu'o//
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu'i byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu'o//
translated: the effect of natural outcome, the effect of conscious effort, the effect of dominance, and the effect of separation.

original: mi dge ba'i rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The four effects of unwholesome action are the same as the above,
