original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so //
translated: except for the effect of separation.🔽The effect of unwholesome action is respectively, inferior and superior, because it is the effect of an action that is either inferior or superior.🔽The effect of wholesome action is the opposite of that.

original: dus khyad par du 'phags pa dang ngan par 'bras bur 'gyur ba'i phyir go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: dus khyad par du 'phags pa dang ngan par 'bras bur 'gyur ba'i phyir go rims bzhin te /
translated: The effect of wholesome action is respectively, superior and inferior, because it is the effect of an action that is either superior or inferior.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The effect of unwholesome action is the opposite of that.🔽The effect of unwholesome action is respectively, inferior and superior, because it is the effect of an action that is either inferior or superior.🔽The effect of wholesome action is the opposite of that.🔽The effect of unwholesome action is respectively, inferior and superior, because it is the effect of an action that is either inferior or superior.

original: chung dus mang po yang dag par 'joms pa'i khyad par gyis ni zhes bya ba ni dge ba chung @290a * //
analyzed: chung dus mang po yang dag par 'joms pa'i khyad par gyis ni zhes bya ba ni dge ba chung @290a * //
translated: The effect of wholesome action is the opposite of that.🔽The effect of unwholesome action is respectively, inferior and superior, because it is the effect of an action that is either inferior or superior.

original: dus mi dge ba mang po yang dag par 'joms pa ste /
analyzed: dus mi dge ba mang po yang dag par 'joms pa ste /
translated: The effect of wholesome action is the opposite of that.🔽The effect of unwholesome action is respectively, inferior and superior, because it is the effect of an action that is either inferior or superior.🔽The effect of wholesome action is the opposite of that.🔽The effect of unwholesome action is respectively, inferior and superior, because it is the effect of an action that is either inferior or superior.🔽The effect of wholesome action is the opposite of that.

original: 'di ltar spong ba'i las skad cig ma gcig gis thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa mang po yang dag par 'joms pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar spong ba'i las skad cig ma gcig gis thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa mang po yang dag par 'joms pas so //
translated: The effect of unwholesome action is respectively, inferior and superior, because it is the effect of an action that is either inferior or superior.🔽The effect of wholesome action is the opposite of that.🔽The effect of unwholesome action is respectively, inferior and superior, because it is the effect of an action that is either inferior or superior.🔽The effect of wholesome action is the opposite of that.🔽The effect of unwholesome action is respectively, inferior and superior, because it is the effect of an action that is either inferior or superior.🔽The effect of wholesome action is the opposite of that.🔽The effect of unwholesome action is respectively, inferior and superior, because it is the effect of an action that is either inferior or superior.🔽The effect of wholesome action is the opposite of that.🔽The effect of unwholesome action is respectively, inferior and superior, because

original: dper na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa mang po ste /
analyzed: dper na sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pas thog ma med pa'i dus nas zhugs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa mang po ste /
translated: For example, the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering abandons the many aspects of its opposing factors that have been engaged since beginningless time.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs phra rgyas bcu'i mtshan nyid yang dag par 'joms pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs phra rgyas bcu'i mtshan nyid yang dag par 'joms pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the perseverance for Dharma knowledge of the truth of suffering completely conquers the many aspects of its counteragents that have been engaged since beginningless time.

original: dpe rnams mang po rgya cher 'byung ba ni 'di dag ni mi dge ba bas dge ba stobs dang ldan pa'i dpe yin te /
analyzed: dpe rnams mang po rgya cher 'byung ba ni 'di dag ni mi dge ba bas dge ba stobs dang ldan pa'i dpe yin te /
translated: The many examples that occur extensively are examples of how virtue is stronger than nonvirtue.

original: de tsam dang chos mthun pa yin gyi grangs bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam dang chos mthun pa yin gyi grangs bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: They are similar in that they are examples of this, but they are not similar in number.

original: smras pa / mi dge ba las sa gzhan gyi dge ba bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i sa pa ni de'i sa stobs dang ldan par rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / mi dge ba las sa gzhan gyi dge ba bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa'i sa pa ni de'i sa stobs dang ldan par rigs so zhe na /
translated: Objection: It is reasonable that virtue of the first absorption and so on, which is on a different level from nonvirtue, is stronger than it.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response, Aryadeva explains:

original: dge ba de dang sa gcig pa yin yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba de dang sa gcig pa yin yang dang po'i khyad par rnam pa gsum po rnams kyis mi dge ba'i sa stobs dang ldan pa nyid du
analyzed: dge ba de dang sa gcig pa yin yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba de dang sa gcig pa yin yang dang po'i khyad par rnam pa gsum po rnams kyis mi dge ba'i sa stobs dang ldan pa nyid du
translated: Though it is of the same level as that virtue,

original: rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rig par bya ste /
translated: it should be understood that nonvirtue is stronger than virtue in the desire realm through the three specific aspects of the first.

original: 'du byed kyi khyad par dang / rnam pa'i khyad par dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i khyad par gyis so//🔽gzhan yang mi dge ba zil gyis mnan nas zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sa pas mi dge ba zil gyis mnan nas de'i gnyen pos mi dge ba'i gnyen po gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba gzhan 'dren
analyzed: 'du byed kyi khyad par dang / rnam pa'i khyad par dang / mtshungs par ldan pa'i khyad par gyis so// gzhan yang mi dge ba zil gyis mnan nas zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni 'di ltar 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'i sa pas mi dge ba zil gyis mnan nas de'i gnyen pos mi dge ba'i gnyen po gzugs na spyod pa'i dge ba gzhan 'dren
translated: It is stronger through the specific aspect of formation, the specific aspect of aspect and the specific aspect of concomitance.🔽Moreover, it is said:🔽Nonvirtue is stronger than virtue in the desire realm because it is the cause of the suffering of change and the suffering of the mental afflictions.

original: to // de'i phyir na yang dge ba stobs dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: to // de'i phyir na yang dge ba stobs dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: It is said that nonvirtue is stronger than virtue in the desire realm because it is the cause of the suffering of change and the suffering of the mental afflictions.

original: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni khyad par bcu po 'di rnams kyi'o//
analyzed: bsdus pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni khyad par bcu po 'di rnams kyi'o//
translated: The suffering of change is the suffering of the five sense objects.

original: 'du byed rnam pa mtshungs par ldan //
analyzed: 'du byed rnam pa mtshungs par ldan //
translated: and the formations are similar in their association.

original: sa nyid ces bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni 'du byed pa nyid kyi khyad par dang / rnam pa nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid dang / sa nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sa nyid ces bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni 'du byed pa nyid kyi khyad par dang / rnam pa nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa nyid dang / sa nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The explanation of the term “realm” is as follows: the specific nature of the formations, their specific aspects, their specific association, their specific realm, and their specific twofold result.

original: ji skad du 'bras bu grangs kyi khyad par bstan pa dang / ji skad du mthar phyin pa'i khyad par bstan pa dang / 'chad pa nyid dang / chung dus yang dag par 'joms pa nyid dang / spong ba nyid dang phyogs su gyur pa'i khyad par nyid do //
analyzed: ji skad du 'bras bu grangs kyi khyad par bstan pa dang / ji skad du mthar phyin pa'i khyad par bstan pa dang / 'chad pa nyid dang / chung dus yang dag par 'joms pa nyid dang / spong ba nyid dang phyogs su gyur pa'i khyad par nyid do //
translated: The specific nature of the result is as stated in the verse: “The result is taught as the specific number. ” The specific duration is as stated in the verse: “The specific duration is taught as the ultimate. ” The specific abandonment is as stated in the verse: “The specific abandonment is taught as the ultimate. ” The specific side is as stated in the verse: “The specific side is taught as the ultimate. ”

original: gnyis med ces bya ba ni 'di la sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi rang bzhin gnyis po med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis med ces bya ba ni 'di la sangs rgyas kyi gsung gi rang bzhin gnyis po med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Nondual means that the nature of the Buddha’s speech is not dual.

original: legs 'thob ni legs @290b par rnyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: legs 'thob ni legs @290b par rnyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Well attained means well obtained.

original: bsgrub dka' ni sbyor ba dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub dka' ni sbyor ba dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Difficult to practice means difficult to apply.

original: nad drag yun rings su mi sten //
analyzed: nad drag yun rings su mi sten //
translated: Not to be relied upon for a long time, like a serious illness.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang la nad drag pa dang yun ring ba yod pa de ni nad drag yun ring ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang la nad drag pa dang yun ring ba yod pa de ni nad drag yun ring ngo //
translated: This is the one who has a severe and long-lasting illness.

original: 'di ni 'di skad du nad drag la yun ring po can su zhig sangs rgyas kyi gsung sman dang / grub pa dang / gtan du ba dang / nad thams cad 'joms pa dang / gnyis su med pa dang / legs par 'thob pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ni 'di skad du nad drag la yun ring po can su zhig sangs rgyas kyi gsung sman dang / grub pa dang / gtan du ba dang / nad thams cad 'joms pa dang / gnyis su med pa dang / legs par 'thob pa dang /
translated: This is what is being taught: “What person who has a severe and long-lasting illness would not rely on the medicine of the Buddha’s word, which is effective, permanent, which cures all illnesses, which is nondual, which is well obtained,

original: legs par bsten pa dang / bsgrub dka' ba la rten par mi byed ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: legs par bsten pa dang / bsgrub dka' ba la rten par mi byed ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: which is well attended to, and which is difficult to practice?”

original: rnyed sogs 'dod ces bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni grags pa dang / bsngags pa dang / nor 'dod pa dang / ji skad du bstan pa'i skyon ni chags pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed sogs 'dod ces bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras ni grags pa dang / bsngags pa dang / nor 'dod pa dang / ji skad du bstan pa'i skyon ni chags pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Desire for gain, etc.” The term “etc.” refers to desire for fame, praise, and wealth. The faults of attachment, etc., are as they have been explained.

original: zab mo ni 'jug par dka' ba'i don gyis so //
analyzed: zab mo ni 'jug par dka' ba'i don gyis so //
translated: “The profound” means that which is difficult to understand.

original: 'di la brten na zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'di la gnas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di la brten na zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'di la gnas na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Relying on this” means relying on the Buddha’s word.

original: kha na ma tho med ces bya ba ni rnam par ma smad pa'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho med ces bya ba ni rnam par ma smad pa'o //
translated: “Without reproach” means without blame.

original: phul byung zhes bya ba ni mang po'o //
analyzed: phul byung zhes bya ba ni mang po'o //
translated: “Excellent” means abundant.

original: des pa ni the tshom med pa'o //
analyzed: des pa ni the tshom med pa'o //
translated: “Gentle” means without doubt.

original: 'bras bu mi zad ces bya ba ni 'bras bu zad mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu mi zad ces bya ba ni 'bras bu zad mi shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “The inexhaustible fruit” means the fruit that is inexhaustible.

original: thob pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: thob pa zhes bya ba ni rnyed pa'o //
translated: “Attained” means obtained.

original: thabs gzhan mad ces bya ba ni thabs gzhan na med do zhes bya bya'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thabs gzhan mad ces bya ba ni thabs gzhan na med do zhes bya bya'i tha tshig go //
translated: “There is no other means” means there is no other means.

original: sgrub pa po yangs med ces bya ba ni de'i don du sgrub pa po gzhan yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgrub pa po yangs med ces bya ba ni de'i don du sgrub pa po gzhan yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “There is no other practitioner” means there is no other practitioner for that purpose.

original: 'o na de bya mod ces bya ba ni 'o na de bsgrub par bya mod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'o na de bya mod ces bya ba ni 'o na de bsgrub par bya mod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Then do it” means then accomplish it.

original: bsams pa dang bsgoms pa gnyis kyi dus su yang rjes su 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: bsams pa dang bsgoms pa gnyis kyi dus su yang rjes su 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: He also takes care of them at the time of reflection and meditation.

original: yon tan gnyis ldan ni go bar byed pa dang / nges pa'i tshig legs pa 'di gnyis dang ngo /
analyzed: yon tan gnyis ldan ni go bar byed pa dang / nges pa'i tshig legs pa 'di gnyis dang ngo /
translated: The two qualities are the two: the expression and the good etymology.

original: ci 'os zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: ci 'os zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: What is appropriate is in accordance with the Vinaya.

original: rtogs gyur pa ni bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes so //
analyzed: rtogs gyur pa ni bden pa rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes so //
translated: Realization is the correct knowledge of the four truths.🔽The five benefits of listening to the sublime teaching are extensively explained in the sutras, which state:

original: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la phan yon lnga zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni mdo las dam pa'i chos mnyan pa'i phan yon lnga po gsungs pa gang dag ma thos pa thos par byed pa dang / thos pa yongs su byang bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos mnyan pa la phan yon lnga zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni mdo las dam pa'i chos mnyan pa'i phan yon lnga po gsungs pa gang dag ma thos pa thos par byed pa dang / thos pa yongs su byang bar byed pa dang /
translated: The five benefits of listening to the sublime teaching are that you will hear what you have not heard, you will purify what you have heard,🔽you will abandon doubt, you will rectify your view and you will realize the profound meaning and words with wisdom.

original: som nyi spong ba dang / lta ba drang por byed pa dang / shes rab kyis don dang tshig zab mo rtogs par byed ces bya ba'i yon tan lnga po dag ni mi shes pa dang / the tshom dang log pa'i shes pa dang / bden pa rnams rtogs pa bzhi po 'di dag tu bsdus te /🔽ji ltar byas @291a * //
analyzed: som nyi spong ba dang / lta ba drang por byed pa dang / shes rab kyis don dang tshig zab mo rtogs par byed ces bya ba'i yon tan lnga po dag ni mi shes pa dang / the tshom dang log pa'i shes pa dang / bden pa rnams rtogs pa bzhi po 'di dag tu bsdus te / ji ltar byas @291a * //
translated: These five qualities are subsumed in the four: ignorance, doubt, wrong knowledge and realization of the truths.

original: pas she na /
analyzed: pas she na /
translated: How is that?

original: gnyis kyis mi shes pa ldog ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnyis kyis mi shes pa ldog ba'i phyir te /
translated: Through the first two, ignorance is eliminated.

original: ma thos pa thos par byed pa dang / thos pa yongs su byang bar byed pa zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: ma thos pa thos par byed pa dang / thos pa yongs su byang bar byed pa zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyis so //
translated: These two are: making the unheard heard and purifying what has been heard.

original: gang gi phyir mi shes pa ldog par byed pa de'i phyir ma thos pa thos par byed pa dang / thos pa yongs su byang bar byed pa zhes bya ba yon tan 'di gnyis ni mi shes pa ldog pa zhes bya ba'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi shes pa ldog par byed pa de'i phyir ma thos pa thos par byed pa dang / thos pa yongs su byang bar byed pa zhes bya ba yon tan 'di gnyis ni mi shes pa ldog pa zhes bya ba'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: Since it causes the cessation of ignorance, these two qualities, making the unheard heard and purifying what has been heard, are included in the cessation of ignorance.

original: som nyi spong ba zhes bya ba yon tan 'di ni the tshom gyi shes pa ldog pa'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: som nyi spong ba zhes bya ba yon tan 'di ni the tshom gyi shes pa ldog pa'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: The quality of abandoning doubt is included in the cessation of the consciousness of doubt.

original: lta ba drang por byed ces bya ba 'di ni log pa'i shes pa ldog pa'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: lta ba drang por byed ces bya ba 'di ni log pa'i shes pa ldog pa'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: The quality of straightening the view is included in the cessation of wrong consciousness.

original: shes rab kyis don dang tshig zab mo rtogs par byed ces bya ba yon tan 'di ni bden pa rnams rtogs pa'i nang du 'dus so //
analyzed: shes rab kyis don dang tshig zab mo rtogs par byed ces bya ba yon tan 'di ni bden pa rnams rtogs pa'i nang du 'dus so //
translated: The quality of realizing profound meaning and words through wisdom is included in the realization of the truths.

original: gtan du phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan du ji ltar rigs par mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mtho ris thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan du phan pa dang bde ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan du ji ltar rigs par mya ngan las 'das pa dang / mtho ris thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the sake of lasting benefit and happiness means for the sake of attaining nirvana and heaven, as is fitting.

original: yang dang yang du bsgrub par bya ba dang / sbyor ba gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos ni yang dang yang du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dang / spyor ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dang yang du bsgrub par bya ba dang / sbyor ba gcig pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos ni yang dang yang du bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir dang / spyor ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Dharma is to be practiced again and again and because it is the single means.

original: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i chos la ni sbyor ba gzhan med pas so //🔽des ni zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i chos la ni sbyor ba gzhan med pas so // des ni zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpas so //
translated: For, once nirvana has been attained, there is no other means.

original: nyon mongs mya ngan las 'das pa spang phyir te zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir ni bdag la chags pa zad par bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs mya ngan las 'das pa spang phyir te zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa spang ba'i phyir ni bdag la chags pa zad par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva, by that, i.e. by the Dharma, for the sake of the nirvana of the afflicted, i.e. for the sake of the abandonment of his own affliction.🔽In order to exhaust attachment to self, he should practice the Dharma again and again.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa spang ba'i phyir ni gzhan la chags pa 'phel bar bya ste snying rje bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa spang ba'i phyir ni gzhan la chags pa 'phel bar bya ste snying rje bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For the sake of abandoning nirvana, one should increase one's attachment to others, i.e., one should have compassion.

original: de dag gnyis kyi zhes bya ba ni bdag la chags ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pas so //
analyzed: de dag gnyis kyi zhes bya ba ni bdag la chags ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pas so //
translated: The two refers to attachment to self and to nirvana.

original: shes rab snying brtse de zang 'phel rgyu yin //
analyzed: shes rab snying brtse de zang 'phel rgyu yin //
translated: Wisdom and compassion are the causes of their increase.

original: shes rab ni bdag nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa zad pa'i rgyu yin la /
analyzed: shes rab ni bdag nyid kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa zad pa'i rgyu yin la /
translated: Wisdom is the cause of the exhaustion of one's own defilements.

original: snying brtse ste snying rje ni gzhan la chags pa ste /
analyzed: snying brtse ste snying rje ni gzhan la chags pa ste /
translated: Compassion is attachment to others.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs 'phel ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs 'phel ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: They are the causes of the increase of the factors of enlightenment.

original: gang gi phyir de lta bu yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta bu yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: For this reason,

original: byang chub rtsa ba gnyis su gsungs //
analyzed: byang chub rtsa ba gnyis su gsungs //
translated: the root of enlightenment is said to be twofold.

original: de'i 'phel rgyu ni shes rab dang snying brtse ba de gnyis 'phel ba'i rgyu ni de 'phel rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i 'phel rgyu ni shes rab dang snying brtse ba de gnyis 'phel ba'i rgyu ni de 'phel rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of their increase is the cause of the increase of those two, wisdom and compassion.

original: 'bras bur bcas 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sgrub pas so //
analyzed: 'bras bur bcas 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sgrub pas so //
translated: It is said that they become fruitful because of their accomplishment.

original: dman pa dag / yongs su gzung la 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni dman pa yongs su gzung ba la 'dzin pa ste /🔽chags pa ni dman pa yongs su gzung ba la 'dzin pa'o //🔽de gang @291b dag la yod pa de dag ni dman pa yongs su gzung ba la 'dzin pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: dman pa dag / yongs su gzung la 'dzin pa dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni dman pa yongs su gzung ba la 'dzin pa ste / chags pa ni dman pa yongs su gzung ba la 'dzin pa'o // de gang @291b dag la yod pa de dag ni dman pa yongs su gzung ba la 'dzin pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: Those who are attached to what is inferior are those who are attached to what is inferior.🔽Those who are attached to what is inferior are those who are attached to what is inferior.

original: dman pa yongs su gzung ba la 'dzin pa dang ldan pa de dag gi'o //
analyzed: dman pa yongs su gzung ba la 'dzin pa dang ldan pa de dag gi'o //
translated: Those who are attached to what is inferior are those who are attached to what is inferior.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang zhes bya ba ni de la nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dag po //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams dang zhes bya ba ni de la nyon mongs pa rnams ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dag po //
translated: The afflictions and secondary afflictions are the afflictions such as desire, etc.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / phrag dog dang / ser sna la sogs pa dag go //
translated: The secondary afflictions are shamelessness, lack of abashment, envy, avarice, etc.

original: de las byung ba'i las rnams so zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las byung ba'i las rnams so //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i las rnams so zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa las byung ba'i las rnams so //
translated: The actions that arise from them are the actions that arise from the afflictions and secondary afflictions.

original: sdug bsngal gsum po dag ces bya ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid do //🔽mya ngan la sogs pa dag ces bya ba ni mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khug pa dag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum po dag ces bya ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal nyid dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal nyid do // mya ngan la sogs pa dag ces bya ba ni mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khug pa dag go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The three kinds of suffering are the suffering of conditioned existence, the suffering of change, and the suffering of suffering.🔽Sorrow, etc., means sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and agitation.

original: na ba dang / rga shi la sogs pa dag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni sdug pa dang bral ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: na ba dang / rga shi la sogs pa dag go zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras ni sdug pa dang bral ba dang / mi sdug pa dang phrad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The words, “such as sickness, aging, and death,” include separation from what is pleasant, association with what is unpleasant, etc.

original: mnyan pa dang / 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni mnyan pa dang / 'jog pa'o //
analyzed: mnyan pa dang / 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni mnyan pa dang / 'jog pa'o //
translated: Listening and reflection are listening and reflection.

original: de la mnyan pa ni bstan pa'i chos so //
analyzed: de la mnyan pa ni bstan pa'i chos so //
translated: Listening is the teaching of the Dharma.

original: 'jog pa ni de'i don te /
analyzed: 'jog pa ni de'i don te /
translated: Reflection is its meaning.

original: bdag nyid la yang dag par skyed pa'o /
analyzed: bdag nyid la yang dag par skyed pa'o /
translated: It is the correct generation of the Dharma in oneself.

original: rten la tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis yongs su bsgos pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rten la tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa'i yon tan gyis yongs su bsgos pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the basis is completely suffused with the excellences of morality, learning, fewness of wishes, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni chog shes pa dang / rab tu dben pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni chog shes pa dang / rab tu dben pa nyid la sogs pa ste /
translated: The words “etc.” include contentment, isolation, etc.

original: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdo las ji skad 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: as they are described in the sutras.🔽The great thought is the desire to act.🔽The thought that desires to act is motivated by the cause.🔽The motivation in that moment is the engagement at the time of action.🔽The great thought is the desire to act.

original: byed par 'dod pa nyid kyi sems chen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: byed par 'dod pa nyid kyi sems chen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: The thought that desires to act is motivated by the cause.🔽The motivation in that moment is the engagement at the time of action.🔽The great thought is the desire to act.🔽The thought that desires to act is motivated by the cause.🔽The motivation in that moment is the engagement at the time of action.🔽The great thought is the desire to act.🔽The thought that desires to act is motivated by the cause.🔽The motivation in that moment is the engagement at the time of action.🔽The great thought is the desire to act.🔽The thought that desires to act is motivated by the cause.🔽The motivation in that moment is the engagement at the time of action.🔽The great thought is the desire to act.

original: byed pa por 'dod pa nyid kyi sems ni rgyus kun nas bslang ba yin no //
analyzed: byed pa por 'dod pa nyid kyi sems ni rgyus kun nas bslang ba yin no //
translated: The thought that desires to act is motivated by the cause.

original: skad cig de la kun nas bslang ba ni bya ba'i dus su rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: skad cig de la kun nas bslang ba ni bya ba'i dus su rjes su 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The motivation in that moment is the engagement at the time of action.🔽The great thought is the desire to act.🔽The thought that desires to act is motivated by the cause.🔽The motivation in that moment is the engagement at the time of action.🔽The great thought is the desire to act.🔽The thought that desires to act is motivated by the cause.🔽The motivation in that moment is the engagement at the time of action.🔽The great thought is the desire to act.🔽The thought that desires to act is motivated by the cause.🔽The motivation in that moment is the engagement at the time of action.🔽The great thought is the desire to act.🔽The thought that desires to act is motivated by the cause.🔽The motivation in that moment is the engagement at the time of action.🔽The great thought is the desire to act.🔽The thought that desires to act is motivated by the cause.🔽The motivation in that moment is the engagement at the time of action.🔽The great thought is the desire to act.🔽The thought that desires to act is motivated by the cause.

original: 'gro ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / yon tan khyad par du 'phags pas so zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba khyad par du 'phags pas dang / sdug bsngal ba khyad par du 'phags pas dang / phan 'dogs pa khyad par du 'phags pas dang /
analyzed: 'gro ba dang sdug bsngal ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / yon tan khyad par du 'phags pas so zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba khyad par du 'phags pas dang / sdug bsngal ba khyad par du 'phags pas dang / phan 'dogs pa khyad par du 'phags pas dang /
translated: The motivation in that moment is the engagement at the time of action.🔽The great thought is the desire to act.

original: yon tan khyad par du 'phags pas te /
analyzed: yon tan khyad par du 'phags pas te /
translated: because of the excellence of its qualities.

original: ji skad du chos mngon pa'i mdzod las rgya cher bstan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji skad du chos mngon pa'i mdzod las rgya cher bstan pa lta bu'o //
translated: As it is taught in detail in the Abhidharma-kosa.

original: mjug nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mjug nyid kyis stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro //🔽rab tu dga' @292a * //
analyzed: mjug nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni mjug nyid kyis stobs dang ldan par 'gyur ro // rab tu dga' @292a * //
translated: By its conclusion, it becomes powerful.🔽It is the mental attention of joy.

original: ba yid la byed pa'i kun du rtog pas rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba yid la byed pa'i kun du rtog pas rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is extended by the imagination.

original: de la rab tu dga' ba ni ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su tshul khrims la sogs pa'i tshogs la rnam par lta ba yid bde ba nyid gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la rab tu dga' ba ni ting nge 'dzin la sbyor ba'i gnas skabs su tshul khrims la sogs pa'i tshogs la rnam par lta ba yid bde ba nyid gang yin pa ste /
translated: There, joy is the mental pleasure of one who sees the accumulation of morality, etc. in the situation of application to samadhi.

original: de nyid bdag gi tshogs phun sum tshogs so zhes rab tu dga' ba skyes so //
analyzed: de nyid bdag gi tshogs phun sum tshogs so zhes rab tu dga' ba skyes so //
translated: That is joy, thinking, I have the accumulation of the requisites.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su yid bde ba nyid gang yin pa de ni 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i gnas skabs su yid bde ba nyid gang yin pa de ni 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Mental pleasure in the situation of equipoise is incompatible with that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rab tu dga' ba las dga' ba skye'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rab tu dga' ba las dga' ba skye'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said, joy arises from joy.

original: rab tu dga' ba nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid la byed pa ni rab tu dga' ba'i yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba nyid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i yid la byed pa ni rab tu dga' ba'i yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The attention associated with the state of great joy is the attention of great joy.

original: rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pa rnams kyi kun du rtog pa rnams ni rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pa'i kun du rtog pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pa rnams kyi kun du rtog pa rnams ni rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pa'i kun du rtog pa'o //
translated: The conceptions of those who have the attention of great joy are the conceptions of the attention of great joy.

original: de rnams kyis rgyas pa ni de bsgom pa brtas pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyis rgyas pa ni de bsgom pa brtas pa'o //
translated: Their expansion is the growth of their meditation.

original: rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pa'i kun du rtog pas rgyas pa de'i phyir na rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pa'i kun du rtog pas rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pa'i kun du rtog pas rgyas pa de'i phyir na rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pa'i kun du rtog pas rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the expansion of the conceptions of the attention of great joy,

original: de ltar na mjug nyid kyis te /
analyzed: de ltar na mjug nyid kyis te /
translated: Thus, by the conclusion.

original: mjug gis dge ba stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mjug gis dge ba stobs dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conclusion is the powerful virtue.

original: 'khor de nyid kyis zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni ji skad du mdo las sbyin pa las byung ba'i dge ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba las brtsams nas gzhan dag de la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing bsngags pa brjod la /
analyzed: 'khor de nyid kyis zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni ji skad du mdo las sbyin pa las byung ba'i dge ba dang / tshul khrims las byung ba dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba las brtsams nas gzhan dag de la yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing bsngags pa brjod la /
translated: “Having begun with the virtue arisen from giving, that arisen from morality, and that arisen from meditation, he causes others to take it up, he praises it,

original: chos mthun pa la yang shin tu dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //🔽mya ngan las 'das pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mthun pa la yang shin tu dga' bar 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o // mya ngan las 'das pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and he is very pleased with those who have similar qualities.”🔽Because it is dedicated to nirvana and to unsurpassed, true and complete enlightenment.

original: mya ngan las 'das par yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir dang / bla na med ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das par yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir dang / bla na med ba yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is dedicated to nirvana and because it is dedicated to unsurpassed, true and complete enlightenment.

original: mi dge ba la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par rig par bya ba ni rten nyid kyis ni rten la 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / thos pa med pa dang / 'dod chen che ba nyid la sogs pa yon tan ma yin pas yongs su bsgos pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: mi dge ba la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par rig par bya ba ni rten nyid kyis ni rten la 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / thos pa med pa dang / 'dod chen che ba nyid la sogs pa yon tan ma yin pas yongs su bsgos pa'i phyir ro /
translated: The first is the basis itself, because it is the basis that is stained by immorality, lack of learning, great craving, and so on, which are not virtues.

original: dang po kun nas bslang ba nyid kyis ni rgyus kun nas bslang bas byed par 'dod pa nyid kyi sems chen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽brtson pa drag po nyid kyis ni byed pa'i phyir gus par brtson pa'i phyir dang / yang dang yang du brtson pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dang po kun nas bslang ba nyid kyis ni rgyus kun nas bslang bas byed par 'dod pa nyid kyi sems chen po nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // brtson pa drag po nyid kyis ni byed pa'i phyir gus par brtson pa'i phyir dang / yang dang yang du brtson pa'i phyir te /
translated: The second is the motivation itself, because the intention to commit the act is great.🔽The third is intense effort, because the act is committed with respect and with repeated effort.

original: rtag tu brtson pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu brtson pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The fourth is constant effort, because the act is committed continuously.

original: zhing nyid kyis ni zhing rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: zhing nyid kyis ni zhing rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The fourth is the field, which is of four types:

original: 'gro ba dang / sdug @292b bsngal ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / yon tan khyad par du 'phags pas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang / sdug @292b bsngal ba dang / phan 'dogs pa dang / yon tan khyad par du 'phags pas so //
translated: those who are going, those who are suffering, those who are helpful, and those who are superior in virtue.

original: gzhi nyid kyis ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa mi spong ba'i khyad par gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhi nyid kyis ni srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa la sogs pa mi spong ba'i khyad par gyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the distinction of not abandoning killing, stealing, and so on,

original: bya ba nyid kyis ni gnod pa byed pa'i khyad par gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba nyid kyis ni gnod pa byed pa'i khyad par gyi phyir ro //
translated: because of the distinction of doing harm,

original: mjug nyid kyis ni byas nas rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pa'i kun du rtog pa rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mjug nyid kyis ni byas nas rab tu dga' ba yid la byed pa'i kun du rtog pa rgyas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of the distinction of delighting in what has been done, and because of the distinction of the proliferation of conceptual thoughts.

original: 'khor nyid kyis ni gzhan dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing bsngags pa brjod pa dang / chos mthun pas mthong na shin tu yid dga' ba nyid dag gis so //
analyzed: 'khor nyid kyis ni gzhan dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug cing bsngags pa brjod pa dang / chos mthun pas mthong na shin tu yid dga' ba nyid dag gis so //
translated: because of the distinction of the company, which is the distinction of delighting in seeing those who are similar to oneself.

original: de bzhin du ci rigs par rig par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ci rigs par rig par bya ba yin no //
translated: This should be understood in the appropriate manner.

original: sems la 'dzin pa na legs par gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba'i skabs so //
analyzed: sems la 'dzin pa na legs par gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba'i skabs so //
translated: The section on the well-spoken is concluded.🔽How is it grasped? It is said:

original: ji ltar 'dzin zhe na ba lang rdzis ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dzin zhe na ba lang rdzis ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The cowherd grasps it well.

original: legs ldan 'di zhes bya ba ni legs pa dang ldan pa 'di ni'o //
analyzed: legs ldan 'di zhes bya ba ni legs pa dang ldan pa 'di ni'o //
translated: This good one means this one who possesses the good.

original: legs ldan 'di su yin zhe na /
analyzed: legs ldan 'di su yin zhe na /
translated: Who is this Bhadanta?

original: tshul bzang chu bo tshol ba can //
analyzed: tshul bzang chu bo tshol ba can //
translated: He is the one who seeks the river of the good path,

original: mchog dang mchog tshol mchog min shes pa'i yin //🔽de la tshul bzang chu bo tshol ba can //🔽zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsngags pa tshul dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi dge ba ston pa ni tshul bzang ngo //
analyzed: mchog dang mchog tshol mchog min shes pa'i yin // de la tshul bzang chu bo tshol ba can // zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis bsngags pa tshul dang / byang chub kyi yan lag gi dge ba ston pa ni tshul bzang ngo //
translated: the one who seeks the supreme and the supreme-seeking, the one who knows the supreme and the not supreme.

original: 'di la tshul bzang po'i chu bo tshol ba'i ngang tshul yod pas 'di ni tshul bzang po'i chu bo tshol ba can te /
analyzed: 'di la tshul bzang po'i chu bo tshol ba'i ngang tshul yod pas 'di ni tshul bzang po'i chu bo tshol ba can te /
translated: The one who seeks the river of the good path is the one who has the nature of seeking the river of the good path.

original: tshul bzang po'i chu bo tshol ba can de'i'o //
analyzed: tshul bzang po'i chu bo tshol ba can de'i'o //
translated: This is the one who seeks the river of the good path.

original: mchog dang mchog tshol ni mchog dang mchog tshol bar byed pas na mchog dang mchog tshol te /
analyzed: mchog dang mchog tshol ni mchog dang mchog tshol bar byed pas na mchog dang mchog tshol te /
translated: The one who seeks the supreme and the supreme-seeking is the one who seeks the supreme and the supreme-seeking.

original: mchog dang mchog tshol ba de'i'o //
analyzed: mchog dang mchog tshol ba de'i'o //
translated: This is the one who seeks the supreme and the supreme-seeking.

original: mchog dang mchog min shes pa'i ni gtso bo dang gtso bo ma yin pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mchog dang mchog min shes pa'i ni gtso bo dang gtso bo ma yin pa shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The one who knows the supreme and the not supreme is the one who knows the principal and the not principal.

original: legs ldan 'di gang gi yin par bstan pa'i legs ldan de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: legs ldan 'di gang gi yin par bstan pa'i legs ldan de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the good fortune that is indicated as being his?

original: de yi snying po nyid ni rab tu rnams phye na //
analyzed: de yi snying po nyid ni rab tu rnams phye na //
translated: Having thoroughly analyzed the essence of that,

original: rang gi srog gi rin gyis legs gsungs nyo ba mdzad //
analyzed: rang gi srog gi rin gyis legs gsungs nyo ba mdzad //
translated: he bought the good sayings with the price of his own life.

original: ces bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the extensive explanation.

original: mdzad pa ni mdzad par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mdzad pa ni mdzad par gyur pa'o //
translated: He did it, he did it.

original: snying po nyid ni rab tu rnam phye nas //
analyzed: snying po nyid ni rab tu rnam phye nas //
translated: Having thoroughly analyzed the essence of that,

original: zhes bya ba ni legs par gsungs pa dang rang gi srog gnyis la snying po dang snying po ma yin pa gnyis la rnam par dpyad nas rang gi srog gis legs par gsungs pa nyo ba mdzad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni legs par gsungs pa dang rang gi srog gnyis la snying po dang snying po ma yin pa gnyis la rnam par dpyad nas rang gi srog gis legs par gsungs pa nyo ba mdzad do //
translated: having analyzed the essence and non-essence of the good sayings and his own life, he bought the good sayings with the price of his own life.

original: bsam pa yongs su smin pa dag par 'gyur //
analyzed: bsam pa yongs su smin pa dag par 'gyur //
translated: The intention becomes completely pure.

original: zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽mi mnyes par zhes bya ba ni mi mnyes par zhes bya @293a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin pa dag par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mi mnyes par zhes bya ba ni mi mnyes par zhes bya @293a * //
translated: This means the roots of virtue become completely pure.🔽He did not displease the Victors.

original: ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means he did not displease the Buddhas.

original: yongs su nyams pa rnam pa bzhir yongs su bstan te /🔽yo byad rnams la zang zing lhur len pa nyid kyis yo byad bsnyungs pa yongs su nyams pa ni sbyangs pa'i yan lag rnams 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan to //🔽tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la byams pa yongs su nyams pa ni da ltar ni /🔽dge slong tshogs kyang byams pas phyir phyogs shing zhes bya ba 'dis so zhes yongs su nyams pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa rnam pa bzhir yongs su bstan te / yo byad rnams la zang zing lhur len pa nyid kyis yo byad bsnyungs pa yongs su nyams pa ni sbyangs pa'i yan lag rnams 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis yongs su bstan to // tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la byams pa yongs su nyams pa ni da ltar ni / dge slong tshogs kyang byams pas phyir phyogs shing zhes bya ba 'dis so zhes yongs su nyams pa ni /
translated: Loss of austerity is shown by the words, “he has changed his former austerity. ”🔽Loss of love for his fellow brahmacarins is shown by the words, “now the assembly of monks turns away from him in disgust. ”🔽Loss of the opportunity to practice is shown by the words, “he is a stumbling block to the laity and to the monks. ”

original: sngom brtson skye bo dge 'dun nang dag tu //
analyzed: sngom brtson skye bo dge 'dun nang dag tu //
translated: Loss of striving for the goal is shown by the words, “he has lost the ground of his former meditation. ”🔽“Alas, how he has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!

original: dogs med stag mtshan can dang bya thogs rgyu //🔽zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: dogs med stag mtshan can dang bya thogs rgyu // zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!

original: rang gi don thob par bya ba la mngon par brtson pa yongs su nyams pa ni //
analyzed: rang gi don thob par bya ba la mngon par brtson pa yongs su nyams pa ni //
translated: He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!🔽He has lost the ground of his former meditation!

original: sngon gyi bsam gtan sa ni gang yin pa //🔽kye ma ji ltar 'bras bu'i sa dag byed //
analyzed: sngon gyi bsam gtan sa ni gang yin pa // kye ma ji ltar 'bras bu'i sa dag byed //
translated: He has lost the ground of his former meditation!

original: ces bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: ces bya ba 'dis so //
translated: This is so.🔽🔽

original: de la mnyan pa dang / gzung pa dang / bcang pa dang don dang mthun par sgrub pa dag gis 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mnyan pa dang / gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang don dang mthun par sgrub pas 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: de la mnyan pa dang / gzung pa dang / bcang pa dang don dang mthun par sgrub pa dag gis 'bad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mnyan pa dang / gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang don dang mthun par sgrub pas 'bad par bya'o //
translated: One should strive to listen to it, to take it up, to keep it, and to practice it in accordance with the meaning.

original: myong ba zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: myong ba zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong bar gyur pa'o //
translated: Experience means to experience.

original: bstan pa ji lta bur na mi bya yin //
analyzed: bstan pa ji lta bur na mi bya yin //
translated: How can one not do as the teaching says?

original: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bka' ji ltar na bya ba ma yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi bka' ji ltar na bya ba ma yin par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: means how can one not do as the Blessed Buddhas have said?

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ci zhig bstan ce na //🔽'du byed rnams ni rnam 'jig cing //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'dis zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ci zhig bstan ce na // 'du byed rnams ni rnam 'jig cing //
translated: What does this verse show?

original: zhes bya ba yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yongs su bstan te /
translated: It shows that formations are subject to destruction,

original: gnas skabs su 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba 'dis te /
analyzed: gnas skabs su 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba 'dis te /
translated: and that they are subject to change.🔽The word change means to change from one state to another.

original: 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngang gis skad cig tu 'jig pa yin par yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: 'gro'o zhes bya ba'i rang gi ngang gis skad cig tu 'jig pa yin par yongs su bstan te /
translated: The line “going is taught to be momentary destruction” teaches that going is momentary destruction by nature.

original: gnas par mi mngon la zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: gnas par mi mngon la zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: The line “abiding is not evident” teaches that.

original: gtan du 'jig bar yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: gtan du 'jig bar yongs su bstan te /
translated: The line “destruction is taught to be permanent” teaches that.

original: song zhing song ba mi 'ong zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: song zhing song ba mi 'ong zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: The line “where one has gone and where one has not gone are not going” teaches that.

original: gtan du 'jig pa yin yang chad min zhes bya ba 'di yang yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: gtan du 'jig pa yin yang chad min zhes bya ba 'di yang yongs su bstan to //
translated: The line “destruction is not nihilism, even though it is permanent” teaches that.

original: gsar du skye zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: gsar du skye zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: The line “arising is new” teaches that.

original: 'dus byas 'jig pa de dag la //🔽mi shes bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin //
analyzed: 'dus byas 'jig pa de dag la // mi shes bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin //
translated: With regard to those destructions of conditioned🔽phenomena, the ignorant grasp them as “I” and “mine.”

original: mi shes pas bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi shes pas bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The line “the ignorant grasp them as ‘I’ and ‘mine’” means that they grasp them as “I” and “mine” through ignorance.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan yang gnas skabs 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gang gsungs pa ni'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan yang gnas skabs 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gang gsungs pa ni'o //
translated: The line “furthermore” introduces another explanation of the verse that states, “When there is a change in state . . . ”

original: mi 'jig lta zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams la rtag par lta'o //
analyzed: mi 'jig lta zhes bya ba ni 'du byed rnams la rtag par lta'o //
translated: The line “destruction is not seen” means that they view compounded phenomena as permanent.

original: yun ring 'jig par lta zhes bya ba ni gal te 'du byed 'di dag mi rtag @293b pa yin yang yun ring zhig na 'jig go zhes de ltar lta ba'o //
analyzed: yun ring 'jig par lta zhes bya ba ni gal te 'du byed 'di dag mi rtag @293b pa yin yang yun ring zhig na 'jig go zhes de ltar lta ba'o //
translated: The view that they will perish after a long time is the view that, even if these formations are impermanent, they will perish after a long time.

original: gzhan dag ni 'du byed de dag zhig na mya ngan byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni 'du byed de dag zhig na mya ngan byed do //
translated: Others grieve over the destruction of those formations.

original: gzhan dag ni de dag zhig lta ste chad par lta'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni de dag zhig lta ste chad par lta'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Others view their destruction as annihilation.

original: gang zhig 'du byed la de ltar lta ba de'i ched du /
analyzed: gang zhig 'du byed la de ltar lta ba de'i ched du /
translated: Those who view formations in this way

original: de'i rtsa bzhi yis mi rtag 'di nyid bstan //
analyzed: de'i rtsa bzhi yis mi rtag 'di nyid bstan //
translated: are taught this impermanence through four similes.

original: tshigs su bcad pa de'i rtsa ba bzhi po de dag gis te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa de'i rtsa ba bzhi po de dag gis te /
translated: The four roots of this verse are

original: gnas skabs 'gyur zhes bya ba dang pos dang / gnas par mi mngon zhes bya ba gnyis pas dang song zhing song ba mi 'ong zhes bya ba gsum pas dang / gsar du skye zhes bya ba bzhi pas so //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'gyur zhes bya ba dang pos dang / gnas par mi mngon zhes bya ba gnyis pas dang song zhing song ba mi 'ong zhes bya ba gsum pas dang / gsar du skye zhes bya ba bzhi pas so //
translated: The first root is “change in state,” the second is “not manifest as enduring,” the third is “having gone, the gone does not return,” and the fourth is “newly arisen.”

original: de la rtsa ba gnyis kyis ni 'dus byas rnams la bdag med pa dang bdag gi ba med pa nyid du yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba gnyis kyis ni 'dus byas rnams la bdag med pa dang bdag gi ba med pa nyid du yongs su bstan te /
translated: The first two lines indicate that conditioned states are devoid of self and devoid of mine.

original: gang dag gis she na /
analyzed: gang dag gis she na /
translated: By what means?

original: gnas skabs 'gyur zhing gnas par mi mngon la //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'gyur zhing gnas par mi mngon la //
translated: By the line “They do not remain as they are, they do not endure,”

original: zhes bya ba 'dis dang / song zhing song ba mi 'ong gsar du skye //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis dang / song zhing song ba mi 'ong gsar du skye //
translated: and by the line “What has gone does not return, what has not gone does not go.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: mdo las gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: mdo las gang mi rtag pa de ni sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The sutra says: “Whatever is impermanent is suffering.

original: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa dang / de ni bdag gi med pa dang / de la nga med pa dang bdag de'i nga'i ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal ba de ni bdag med pa dang / de ni bdag gi med pa dang / de la nga med pa dang bdag de'i nga'i ma yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Whatever is suffering is devoid of self, devoid of mine, and I am not that, nor is that mine.”

original: gcig gis ni de dag la bdag dang bdag gir lta ba ste /
analyzed: gcig gis ni de dag la bdag dang bdag gir lta ba ste /
translated: The third line indicates the view of self and mine in regard to those states.

original: 'on kyang bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: However, the line “Yet one engages in the conception of self and mine” indicates that.

original: gcig gis ni de'i rgyu ma rig pas zin pa nyid dang / 'gro ba 'di ni ma rig pa yis med ces bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: gcig gis ni de'i rgyu ma rig pas zin pa nyid dang / 'gro ba 'di ni ma rig pa yis med ces bya ba 'dis so //
translated: The fourth line indicates the cause of that, which is the grasping of ignorance, by the line “This world is without self due to ignorance.”

original: bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gzhi dang / rang bzhin dang rgyu yongs su bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gzhi dang / rang bzhin dang rgyu yongs su bstan pa yin no /
translated: The basis of the error of self, its nature, and its cause have been taught.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: re zhig bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gzhi ni rtsa ba snga ma gnyis kyis yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig bdag tu phyin ci log pa'i gzhi ni rtsa ba snga ma gnyis kyis yongs su bstan to //
translated: The basis of the error of self is taught by the first two roots.

original: rang bzhin ni rtsa ba gsum pas yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni rtsa ba gsum pas yongs su bstan to //
translated: Its nature is taught by the third root.

original: rgyu ni rtsa ba bzhi pas yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu ni rtsa ba bzhi pas yongs su bstan to //
translated: Its cause is taught by the fourth root.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyi don yang snga ma dang mthun par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di gnyis kyi don yang snga ma dang mthun par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of these two verses should be understood in accordance with the above.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: de la re zhig tshigs su bcad pa dang po las byas pa kun mi bya ba ni phyis gang mi bya ba de ni mi bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig tshigs su bcad pa dang po las byas pa kun mi bya ba ni phyis gang mi bya ba de ni mi bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: In the first verse, “one should not do any action” means that one should not do what should not be done.

original: byang chub gsum las brtsams nas thos pa dang // bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung bas rgyud yongs su smin par bya ba gang yin bde mi bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub gsum las brtsams nas thos pa dang // bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung bas rgyud yongs su smin par bya ba gang yin bde mi bya'o //
translated: One should not bring about the maturation of the continuum by listening, reflection, and meditation, beginning with the three enlightenments.

original: yun ring na yang zhi ba 'thob //
analyzed: yun ring na yang zhi ba 'thob //
translated: Even in a long time, one does not attain peace.

original: byas pa mi bya ba des dus ring por gang gi tshe brtson par byed pa de'i tshe thar pa gdon mi tha bar 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byas pa mi bya ba des dus ring por gang gi tshe brtson par byed pa de'i tshe thar pa gdon mi tha bar 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of “what has been done is not to be done” is that when one strives for a long time, one will certainly attain liberation.

original: gang byas pa yin ni gang byas pa yang bya ba yin na zhes bya ba'i tha @294a * //
analyzed: gang byas pa yin ni gang byas pa yang bya ba yin na zhes bya ba'i tha @294a * //
translated: The meaning of “what has been done is to be done” is that one should do what has been done.

original: tshig go // yang bya ba de yis ni shin tu yun ring zhi mi 'thob /
analyzed: tshig go // yang bya ba de yis ni shin tu yun ring zhi mi 'thob /
translated: But by that action, one will not attain peace for a very long time.

original: shin tu dus yun ring por yang thar pa mi 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: shin tu dus yun ring por yang thar pa mi 'thob bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning is that one will not attain liberation for a very long time.

original: ji ltar phyi rol pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag lta bu'o /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dag lta bu'o /
translated: It is like the meditative attainments of non-Buddhists.

original: // / rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa /
analyzed: // / rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa /
translated: The Explanation of the Rational System of Exposition

original: bam po bco lnga pa ste tha ma'o //
analyzed: bam po bco lnga pa ste tha ma'o //
translated: The fifteenth and final chapter

original: gnyis pa las kyang gang byas pa ni mi bya zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen po'i ched kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gang yin pa yang mi bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa las kyang gang byas pa ni mi bya zhes bya ba ni byang chub chen po'i ched kyi bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs gang yin pa yang mi bya'o //
translated: As for “what has been done is not to be done,” one should not do the accumulation of merit and wisdom for the sake of great enlightenment.

original: gang byas pa ste bsgrubs pas de mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang byas pa ste bsgrubs pas de mi bya'o //
translated: What has been done is to be accomplished, but that is not to be done.

original: byas pa mi bya ba des sangs rgyas nyid du srid pa yod /
analyzed: byas pa mi bya ba des sangs rgyas nyid du srid pa yod /
translated: By not doing what is to be done, Buddhahood is possible.

original: des gdon mi za bar sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gang byas pa ste bsgrubs pa bya ba ste /
analyzed: des gdon mi za bar sangs rgyas su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gang byas pa ste bsgrubs pa bya ba ste /
translated: This means that without doubt one will become a Buddha.🔽What is to be done is what is to be accomplished.

original: gang zhig yang bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig yang bya ba yin no //
translated: What is to be done is what is to be done again.

original: byas pa yang bya ba de yis ni thar pa yang srid par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byas pa yang bya ba de yis ni thar pa yang srid par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: By not doing what is to be done, even liberation is not possible.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi 'thob na sangs rgyas nyid lta ci smos bdag la khros te bsad na mi rung ngo //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang mi 'thob na sangs rgyas nyid lta ci smos bdag la khros te bsad na mi rung ngo //
translated: If nirvana is not attained, what need is there to speak of Buddhahood? It would not be right for me to be angry and kill him.

original: bsad par gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsad par gyur na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that it would not be right for me to kill him.🔽Since I am unable to turn back his words,

original: de'i tshig bzlog par yang mi nus nas zhes bya ba ni de'i tshig bzhin mi bya bar yang mi nus nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i tshig bzlog par yang mi nus nas zhes bya ba ni de'i tshig bzhin mi bya bar yang mi nus nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: this means that I am unable to disobey his words.

original: shes te ni shes par gyur te'o //
analyzed: shes te ni shes par gyur te'o //
translated: Having understood,

original: thabs ma yin pa byed pas bud med don du gnyer ba las zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pa 'dod pas bud med don du gnyer ba las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thabs ma yin pa byed pas bud med don du gnyer ba las zhes bya ba ni mi tshangs par spyod pa 'dod pas bud med don du gnyer ba las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “From pursuing women” means from pursuing women out of desire for sexual intercourse.🔽“From the signs of faith” means that the arising of those signs of faith is also from the three:

original: dad pa'i rtags rnams las zhes bya ba ni dad pa'i rtags de dag 'byung ba yang dge slong dag gsum po 'di dag ni dad pa'i rtags dang / mtshan ma dang / dad pa rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: dad pa'i rtags rnams las zhes bya ba ni dad pa'i rtags de dag 'byung ba yang dge slong dag gsum po 'di dag ni dad pa'i rtags dang / mtshan ma dang / dad pa rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: “Monks, these three are the signs, indications, and realizations of faith.

original: gsum po gang dag ce na /
analyzed: gsum po gang dag ce na /
translated: What are the three?

original: dge slong dag dad pa can ni 'phags pa rnams mthong bar 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: dge slong dag dad pa can ni 'phags pa rnams mthong bar 'dod pa yin /
translated: Monks, the faithful desire to see the noble ones.

original: dam pa'i chos nyan par 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos nyan par 'dod pa yin /
translated: They desire to hear the sublime Dharma.

original: skye dgu ser sna'i dri mas dkris pa rnams kyi nang na ser sna'i dri ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis khyim na gnas shing lhug par gtong ba dang / lag brkyang ba dang / rnam par gtong ba la dga' ba dang / mchod spyin khor mor byed pa dang /
analyzed: skye dgu ser sna'i dri mas dkris pa rnams kyi nang na ser sna'i dri ma dang bral ba'i sems kyis khyim na gnas shing lhug par gtong ba dang / lag brkyang ba dang / rnam par gtong ba la dga' ba dang / mchod spyin khor mor byed pa dang /
translated: Among beings who are bound by the stain of stinginess, he lives in the home with a mind free of the stain of stinginess, and he is happy to give, to open his hand, to give gifts, to make offerings,

original: gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyin pa la kun 'ged par dga' ba yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / spyin pa la kun 'ged par dga' ba yin no zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: to be generous, to give completely, and to distribute.

original: de bzhin du rgan zhugs bsnyen par rdzogs su gzhug par ma nus so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgan zhugs bsnyen par rdzogs su gzhug par ma nus so //
translated: In the same way, he was not able to give full ordination to the elder.

original: de bzhin du khyod skyes pa yin nam zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bsnyen par rdzogs par byed du 'jug pas ma bzlas pas so //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyod skyes pa yin nam zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bsnyen par rdzogs par byed du 'jug pas ma bzlas pas so //
translated: In the same way, he was not able to make him repeat the words, “Are you a man?” and so on, in order to give him full ordination.

original: de bzhin du khyod nyan du gzhug ma nus so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du khyod nyan du gzhug ma nus so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, he was not able to make him understand.

original: @294b gson 'drar ni gson ba lta bur ro //
analyzed: @294b gson 'drar ni gson ba lta bur ro //
translated: “Like the living” means like the living.

original: gang zhig thob pas zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni 'bras bu gang zhig thob pas ngan song ba ste ngan song gi 'bras bu can no //
analyzed: gang zhig thob pas zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni 'bras bu gang zhig thob pas ngan song ba ste ngan song gi 'bras bu can no //
translated: The text reads: “One who obtains a certain result is a parinirvāṇa-attainer in the happy realms, and one who obtains another result is a parinirvāṇa-attainer in the lower realms.”

original: nyon mongs pa dang skye ba dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams zad pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang skye ba dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams zad pa yin no //
translated: He abandons the afflictions, birth, and karma that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: re zhig de lta bu ni bslab pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no //🔽yang 'byung ba pa ste /
analyzed: re zhig de lta bu ni bslab pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa yin no // yang 'byung ba pa ste /
translated: This is stated from the perspective of the stages of training.

original: yang 'byung ba pa'i 'bras bu can gyi nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gnyis spangs pa ni dgra bcom pa yin no //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba pa'i 'bras bu can gyi nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa bsgom pas spang bar bya ba gnyis spangs pa ni dgra bcom pa yin no //
translated: One who is a parinirvāṇa-attainer in the lower realms abandons the two afflictions and birth that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation and are to be experienced in the future.🔽He does not abandon the karma that is to be experienced in the future.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni mi smos so / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa ni mi smos so / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ngan song ba'i las spangs pa la ni yang 'byung ba ba'i las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: ngan song ba'i las spangs pa la ni yang 'byung ba ba'i las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par mi gzhag ste /
translated: The karma to be experienced in the future that is abandoned by the path of seeing is not posited as the affliction of karma to be experienced in the lower realms.

original: yang 'byung ba ni dge ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba ni dge ba'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the arising of the latter is the result of virtue.

original: 'di ltar slob pa rnams kyi yang 'byung ba ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs nas bsags pa'i las dge ba las dge ba lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar slob pa rnams kyi yang 'byung ba ni so so'i skye bo'i gnas skabs nas bsags pa'i las dge ba las dge ba lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba dang / skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba'i 'bras bu yin pas so //
translated: Thus, the arising of learners is the result of virtue that is accumulated in the state of an ordinary being, to be experienced in a third life and to be experienced after rebirth.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: slob pa'i gnas skabs kyi 'byung ba pa ma yin te /
analyzed: slob pa'i gnas skabs kyi 'byung ba pa ma yin te /
translated: The arising of learners is not the result of virtue in the state of a learner.

original: de rnams kyi dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'i yin te /
translated: It is the result of virtue that is contaminated,

original: de ni zad par dga' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni zad par dga' ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the exhaustion of joy.

original: nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni mngon par rtogs pa'i bgegs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams ni mngon par rtogs pa'i bgegs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The afflictions that are to be abandoned by the path of seeing are the obstruction to clear realization.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di las bgegs zhes bstan pas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa rnams la bgegs su gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di las bgegs zhes bstan pas bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa rnams la bgegs su gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: Since the word “obstruction” is mentioned in this verse, those that are to be abandoned by the path of meditation are not obstructions to the clear realization of the truths.

original: 'di la mthong ba'i lam la mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kho na'i 'thob pa dag gcod kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di la mthong ba'i lam la mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams kho na'i 'thob pa dag gcod kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the obtainment of those objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing is severed on the path of seeing, but not the obtainment of those objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: nyon mongs pa la yang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa de'i nus pa yod par bstan pa'i phyir bar du de smos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis kyi bar du skye ba smos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la yang skye ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa de'i nus pa yod par bstan pa'i phyir bar du de smos pa yin no zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis kyi bar du skye ba smos pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “birth” is mentioned in the middle of the two afflictions and karma because it demonstrates that the power of the affliction to give rise to karma and birth exists.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bgegs ni ci dag spangs /
analyzed: bgegs ni ci dag spangs /
translated: What obstacles have been abandoned?

original: ngan 'gro rnams las rgal tam ci yin mi bya'i nges pa'i las ni ci zhig thob ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ngan 'gro rnams las rgal tam ci yin mi bya'i nges pa'i las ni ci zhig thob ces bya ba yin no //
translated: What definite karma has been obtained?

original: ngan song ba'i skye ba dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir yang bar du de smos pa yin te /
analyzed: ngan song ba'i skye ba dang / las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa'i dbang du mdzad pa'i phyir yang bar du de smos pa yin te /
translated: The term “birth” is mentioned in the middle of the two afflictions and karma because the two, birth in lower rebirths and the affliction of karma, are stated from the perspective of harming oneself and others.

original: de la bdag la gnod par byed pa ni skye @295a * //
analyzed: de la bdag la gnod par byed pa ni skye @295a * //
translated: The harm-doer is the one who harms you.🔽

original: ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The affliction of birth is that which harms the self.

original: bdag dang gzhan la gnod par byed pa ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //🔽ngan song dang ni yang 'byung 'gyur ba gang //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la gnod par byed pa ni las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'o // ngan song dang ni yang 'byung 'gyur ba gang //
translated: The affliction of karma is that which harms both the self and others.

original: nyon mongs yang lag gsum gnyis zad bya'i phyir //
analyzed: nyon mongs yang lag gsum gnyis zad bya'i phyir //
translated: The three and two branches of affliction are to be eliminated.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yan lag gsum zad par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yan lag gsum zad par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The three branches of affliction are to be eliminated.

original: ngan song du gyur pa gang yin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa zad par bya ba'i phyir de kho na nyid de rtogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ngan song du gyur pa gang yin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa la sogs pa zad par bya ba'i phyir de kho na nyid de rtogs pa med pa'o //
translated: The reality of that which is the lower realms is not realized, because the affliction of the lower realms is to be eliminated.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yan lag gnyis zad par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yan lag gnyis zad par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The two branches of affliction are to be eliminated.

original: yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba zad par bya ba'i phyir de kho na nyid de rtogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa nyon mongs pa dang / skye ba zad par bya ba'i phyir de kho na nyid de rtogs pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The reality of that which is to be born again is not realized, because the affliction and birth that are to be born again are to be eliminated.

original: phra rgyas me rnams kyis bsregs srid pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas so //
analyzed: phra rgyas me rnams kyis bsregs srid pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas so //
translated: The fire of the negative tendencies burns the existences, as the text says.

original: slob pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: slob pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du mdzad nas bshad pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The former explanation is from the perspective of the stage of training.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rgyu gnyis dag gis srog dbugs ma phyin pa las srog dbugs phyin pa thob pa ni gson pa dang 'dra bar nyal bar rung gi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gnyis dag gis srog dbugs ma phyin pa las srog dbugs phyin pa thob pa ni gson pa dang 'dra bar nyal bar rung gi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: One who has obtained the life-force and breath through two causes is suitable to sleep like one who is alive, but not otherwise.

original: rgyu gnyis po gang dag gis she na /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis po gang dag gis she na /
translated: Through which two causes?

original: lung bstan pa thob pa zhes bya ba rgyu 'di ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: lung bstan pa thob pa zhes bya ba rgyu 'di ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: Obtaining the prediction.

original: gzhan yang bshad pa /🔽yongs su nyams pa med par spyor ba'i lam thob pa nyid kyis ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bzod pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang bshad pa / yongs su nyams pa med par spyor ba'i lam thob pa nyid kyis ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bzod pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is explained:🔽By obtaining the path of preparation without complete degeneration, one obtains the acceptance that is a factor conducive to penetrative insight.

original: de thob pa'i phyir na yongs su nyams pa med par sbyor ba'i lam thob pa yin no //
analyzed: de thob pa'i phyir na yongs su nyams pa med par sbyor ba'i lam thob pa yin no //
translated: Because of obtaining that, one obtains the path of preparation without complete degeneration.

original: de thob pas yang ngan song du mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: de thob pas yang ngan song du mi 'gro'o //
translated: Because of attaining that, one does not go to the lower realms again.

original: 'bras bu thob pa nyid kyis ni gang zhig thob pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa nyid kyis ni gang zhig thob pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin no //
translated: By attaining the fruit, one attains that for which one strives, as before.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How?

original: gang zhig thob pas ngan song ba'i nyon mongs pa dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
