original: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / tshul khrims kyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / tshul khrims kyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are obstacles to concentration, wisdom and morality.

original: go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin no //
translated: In order,

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir mos pa'i dgra rnams so //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir mos pa'i dgra rnams so //
translated: They are enemies of interest because they are obstacles to concentration.

original: shes rab kyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir blo gros kyi dgra rnams so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir blo gros kyi dgra rnams so //
translated: They are enemies of intelligence because they are obstacles to wisdom.

original: tshul khrims kyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir tshul khrims zad par byed pa dag yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi bar du gcod pa'i phyir tshul khrims zad par byed pa dag yin no //
translated: They are destroyers of morality because they are obstacles to morality.

original: 'di dang phyi mar zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni da ltar gyi tshe la bde ba'i rgyu gnyis yin pas nor dang 'dra ba'i phyir rdzas dang 'dra ba'i dge ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di dang phyi mar zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni da ltar gyi tshe la bde ba'i rgyu gnyis yin pas nor dang 'dra ba'i phyir rdzas dang 'dra ba'i dge ba yin te /
translated: The virtuous are like wealth because they are the cause of happiness in this life and the next.

original: grags pa'i rdzas dang chos mthun pas so //
analyzed: grags pa'i rdzas dang chos mthun pas so //
translated: because it is similar to a substance that is renowned.

original: de bzhin du phyi mar sdug bsngal yongs su skyob pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas nor dang 'dra ba'i phyir rdzas dang 'dra ba'i dge ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyi mar sdug bsngal yongs su skyob pa'i rgyu nyid yin pas nor dang 'dra ba'i phyir rdzas dang 'dra ba'i dge ba ste /
translated: Similarly, virtue is like a substance because it is like wealth, since it is the cause for protecting against future suffering.

original: grags pa'i rdzas dang chos mthun pas so //🔽dge ba'i chos rnams las thob pa dang ma thob pa yongs su nyams pa nyid kyis yongs su nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grags pa'i rdzas dang chos mthun pas so // dge ba'i chos rnams las thob pa dang ma thob pa yongs su nyams pa nyid kyis yongs su nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is similar to a substance that is renowned.🔽It is a degeneration because it causes the loss of both the obtainment and nonobtainment of virtuous entities.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams las thob pa yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams par byed pa'i phyir dang / de dag nyid las ma thob pa yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams las thob pa yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams par byed pa'i phyir dang / de dag nyid las ma thob pa yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It causes the loss of the obtainment of virtuous entities and the loss of the nonobtainment of those very entities.

original: yang mdor bsdus na zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni yang mdor bsdu na tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni 'dod pa rnams yongs su shes par dga' ba nyid ni tshig gcig gis yangs su bstan te /
analyzed: yang mdor bsdus na zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni yang mdor bsdu na tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni 'dod pa rnams yongs su shes par dga' ba nyid ni tshig gcig gis yangs su bstan te /
translated: Again, in brief, this verse indicates the delight in fully understanding sense objects with a single phrase.

original: shes dka' zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: shes dka' zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: This is the difficulty of understanding.

original: spang bar dka' ba nyid ni tshig gsum dag gis yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: spang bar dka' ba nyid ni tshig gsum dag gis yongs su bstan te /
translated: The difficulty of abandoning is indicated by three terms:

original: bzlog dka' dpung thub dka' ba can rgyu ba /
analyzed: bzlog dka' dpung thub dka' ba can rgyu ba /
translated: difficult to turn back, difficult to overcome, and difficult to realize.

original: rtogs dka' zhes bya ba 'di rnams kyis so //
analyzed: rtogs dka' zhes bya ba 'di rnams kyis so //
translated: The difficulty of realizing is indicated by these three terms.🔽The difficulty of not fully understanding and not abandoning is indicated by three terms:

original: yongs su ma shes shing ma spangs pa dang / ji ltar gang zhig ni gang dag la gnod @296b par byed pa de ni tshig gsum dag gis yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: yongs su ma shes shing ma spangs pa dang / ji ltar gang zhig ni gang dag la gnod @296b par byed pa de ni tshig gsum dag gis yongs su bstan te /
translated: The difficulty of not fully understanding is indicated by the term:

original: de la bzang po'i lam rnams 'joms pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni re zhig ji ltar byed pa de yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de la bzang po'i lam rnams 'joms pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni re zhig ji ltar byed pa de yongs su bstan to //
translated: The difficulty of not abandoning is indicated by the terms:

original: mos dang blo yi dgra yin dang // tshul khrims zad byed ces bya ba 'di gnyis kyis kyang gnod pa mang zhig byed pa yongs su ston to //
analyzed: mos dang blo yi dgra yin dang // tshul khrims zad byed ces bya ba 'di gnyis kyis kyang gnod pa mang zhig byed pa yongs su ston to //
translated: The difficulty of not fully understanding and not abandoning is indicated by these three terms.🔽The difficulty of harming is indicated by three terms:🔽The difficulty of harming is indicated by these three terms.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lhag mas ni gang dag la gnod pa byed pa de yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lhag mas ni gang dag la gnod pa byed pa de yongs su bstan to //
translated: The difficulty of being harmed is indicated by the remaining verse.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: 'dod chags rang dga'i dbang po can rnams kyi zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags rang dga'i dbang po can rnams kyi zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas so //
translated: Those who are dominated by the faculty of attachment.

original: brtan pa yin te /
analyzed: brtan pa yin te /
translated: They are steadfast.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: 'phrigs na yang mi ldog pas so //
analyzed: 'phrigs na yang mi ldog pas so //
translated: They do not turn back even when frightened.

original: thag ring zhing thibs por rgyu ba yin no //
analyzed: thag ring zhing thibs por rgyu ba yin no //
translated: They move far away and into hiding.

original: ji ltar na thibs por rgyu ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na thibs por rgyu ba yin zhe na /
translated: How do they move into hiding?

original: mi mngon pa dang bgrod dka' ba'i gnas su ste /🔽shes par dka' ba nyid kyis ston te /
analyzed: mi mngon pa dang bgrod dka' ba'i gnas su ste / shes par dka' ba nyid kyis ston te /
translated: They move into places that are not visible and difficult to approach.🔽They are taught to be difficult to know.

original: shes dka' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: shes dka' ba zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: This is indicated by the word difficult to know.

original: de lta bu ni srid pa'i sgo nas sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni srid pa'i sgo nas sbyar bar bya ba yin no //
translated: This is how they are applied in terms of existence.

original: snying brtse ba med pa nyid ni bzang po'i lam 'joms pa la sogs pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: snying brtse ba med pa nyid ni bzang po'i lam 'joms pa la sogs pa nyid kyis so //
translated: They are devoid of compassion because they destroy the good path, etc.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa gang dag gi dang po bzang po'i lam 'joms pa yod pa de dag ni bzang po'i lam 'joms pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa gang dag gi dang po bzang po'i lam 'joms pa yod pa de dag ni bzang po'i lam 'joms pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who destroy the good path, etc., at the beginning of morality, etc., are those who destroy the good path, etc.

original: de'i dngos po ni bzang po'i lam 'joms pa la sogs pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni bzang po'i lam 'joms pa la sogs pa nyid de /
translated: The state of that is the destruction of the good path, etc.

original: bzang po'i lam 'joms pa la sogs pa de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bzang po'i lam 'joms pa la sogs pa de nyid kyis so //
translated: because they destroy the good path, etc.

original: mos dang blo yi dgra yin dang // tshul khrims zad byed yin zhes bya ba 'di rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba ma lus par med par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mos dang blo yi dgra yin dang // tshul khrims zad byed yin zhes bya ba 'di rnams kyis dge ba'i rtsa ba ma lus par med par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are the enemies of aspiration and of the mind, and they are the destroyers of morality, because they annihilate all the roots of good.

original: dpe gsum dag gis bstan zhe na zhes bya ba ni mar med me dang / ljon shing dang / chu rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dpe gsum dag gis bstan zhe na zhes bya ba ni mar med me dang / ljon shing dang / chu rnams kyis so //
translated: The three examples are the lamp, the tree, and the water.🔽The Sūtra says: “Due to the power of life, name-and-form is caused to continue.”

original: 'di ni tshe'i dbang gis ming dang gzugs zhes bya brgya cher 'byung ba ni de las ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ste /🔽der gzhol ba'i phyir ro //🔽gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni tshe'i dbang gis ming dang gzugs zhes bya brgya cher 'byung ba ni de las ming ni gzugs can ma yin pa'i phung po bzhi ste / der gzhol ba'i phyir ro // gzugs ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag dang 'byung ba chen po bzhi dag rgyur byas pa ste /
translated: Name is the four non-material aggregates, because they are directed to form.

original: gzugs su rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Form is the four great elements and what is derived from the four great elements and is capable of material form.🔽Life is the support of warmth and consciousness.

original: tshe ni dod dang rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi gzhir gyur pa'i chos gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: tshe ni dod dang rnam par shes pa gnyis kyi gzhir gyur pa'i chos gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is a dharma that is the basis of both warmth and consciousness.

original: srog ces bya ba'i rnam grangs so //
analyzed: srog ces bya ba'i rnam grangs so //
translated: It is a synonym for life-force.

original: de'i dbang gis 'jug ces bya ba ni tshe de med par ming dang gzugs mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis 'jug ces bya ba ni tshe de med par ming dang gzugs mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Because of that” means that name-and-form would not occur without that life.

original: gsum po de phyir ji ltar bur //
analyzed: gsum po de phyir ji ltar bur //
translated: How are the three unstable?

original: mi brtan pa ni zhes bya ba ni tshe dang ming dang gzugs de dag dpe gsum po de'i phyir rnam pa gang gis mi brtan pa ste /
analyzed: mi brtan pa ni zhes bya ba ni tshe dang ming dang gzugs de dag dpe gsum po de'i phyir rnam pa gang gis mi brtan pa ste /
translated: The three examples show that life, name-and-form, and the six sense bases are unstable, impermanent, and subject to destruction.

original: 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa de 'chi 'gyel zad pa las phyogs pa rnams kyis te /🔽de mi brtan pa nyid ni 'chi ba la phyogs pa dang / @297a * //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa de 'chi 'gyel zad pa las phyogs pa rnams kyis te / de mi brtan pa nyid ni 'chi ba la phyogs pa dang / @297a * //
translated: Those who are inclined toward death, falling, and exhaustion

original: 'gyel ba la phyogs pa dang / zad pa la phyogs pa'i mar me ljon shing chu yis bstan /
analyzed: 'gyel ba la phyogs pa dang / zad pa la phyogs pa'i mar me ljon shing chu yis bstan /
translated: The instability of those three is shown by the examples of a lamp, a tree, and water.

original: mar mes ni ming 'chi ba la phyogs pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: mar mes ni ming 'chi ba la phyogs pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: The lamp shows the instability of name, which is inclined toward death.

original: nang par mar me rlung gis bskyod pa 'dra bar zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: nang par mar me rlung gis bskyod pa 'dra bar zhes bya bas so //
translated: “Like a lamp that is shaken by the wind in the morning”

original: ljon shing gis ni gzugs 'gyel ba la phyogs pa nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: ljon shing gis ni gzugs 'gyel ba la phyogs pa nyid du bstan te /
translated: The tree shows the instability of form, which is inclined toward falling.

original: chu bo'i 'gram gyi ljon shing rtsa ba 'gul 'dra bar //
analyzed: chu bo'i 'gram gyi ljon shing rtsa ba 'gul 'dra bar //
translated: This shows that the water of life is flowing out.🔽The eight reasons why one should not strive for this doctrine are explained in detail.

original: zhes bya bas so //🔽chus ni tshe zad pa la phyogs pa nyid du bstan te /🔽snod chag yod pa'i chu ni 'dzag par byed pa ltar //
analyzed: zhes bya bas so // chus ni tshe zad pa la phyogs pa nyid du bstan te / snod chag yod pa'i chu ni 'dzag par byed pa ltar //
translated: The opposite of that is stated in the following verses from the Akshayamati-sutra:🔽“Those who seek the meaning, who do not rest,🔽who are not discouraged, who are not fainthearted,🔽who are not afraid, who are not terrified,🔽who are not overcome with terror,🔽who are not confused, who are not bewildered,🔽who are not confused and bewildered,🔽who are not discouraged, who are not fainthearted,🔽who are not afraid, who are not terrified,🔽who are not overcome with terror,🔽who are not confused, who are not bewildered,🔽who are not confused and bewildered,🔽 Translation: ཆུ་ཡིས་ཚེ་ཟད་པ་ལ་ཕྱོགས་པ་ཉིད་དུ་བསྟན་ཏེ།

original: zhes bya bas so //🔽rgyu brgyad dag gis chos 'di la shin tu brtsal bar mi bya bar 'gyur te zhes rgya cher bstan pa gang yin pa de dang chos mi mthun pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya bas so // rgyu brgyad dag gis chos 'di la shin tu brtsal bar mi bya bar 'gyur te zhes rgya cher bstan pa gang yin pa de dang chos mi mthun pa ni /
translated: Thus.🔽The eight causes by which one should not strive in this doctrine are taught extensively.🔽🔽

original: don gnyer nus dang ma byas par //
analyzed: don gnyer nus dang ma byas par //
translated: And the one who is not able to strive,🔽

original: zhes bya brgya cher 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: zhes bya brgya cher 'byung ba nas /
translated: So it says in the Great Play Sutra.🔽🔽

original: de ni nges par sdig las kyis //
analyzed: de ni nges par sdig las kyis //
translated: That is definitely due to evil deeds.🔽

original: bsgribs shing sdug bsngal mang ston yin //
analyzed: bsgribs shing sdug bsngal mang ston yin //
translated: They are obscured and show much suffering.🔽

original: zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is taught.🔽🔽

original: gzhan yang skyo bar byed pa ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang skyo bar byed pa ni //
translated: Furthermore, it is also a cause of weariness.🔽

original: ngan song thos la yid ches shing //
analyzed: ngan song thos la yid ches shing //
translated: And believe in the lower realms,🔽

original: zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: So it is said in detail.🔽🔽

original: ngan song thos pa ni chos sgrogs pa rnams so //🔽yid ches pa ni ngan song yod do //
analyzed: ngan song thos pa ni chos sgrogs pa rnams so //🔽yid ches pa ni ngan song yod do //
translated: Those who hear of the lower realms are the preachers of the Dharma.🔽Those who believe in the lower realms are the sentient beings who are to be trained.🔽

original: mi dge ba'i las kyis der skye'o snyam du'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i las kyis der skye'o snyam du'o //
translated: One should think, “I will be born there through non-virtuous karma.”

original: de yi gnyen por mi byed pa //
analyzed: de yi gnyen por mi byed pa //
translated: Not making its antidote

original: de'i gnyen por dge ba'i las ngan song du skye ba'i bgegs byed pa dang / bde 'gro thob par byed pa mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por dge ba'i las ngan song du skye ba'i bgegs byed pa dang / bde 'gro thob par byed pa mi byed do //
translated: One does not make the antidote to that, the virtuous karma that obstructs birth in the lower realms and causes attainment of the happy realms.

original: 'jigs pa ni ngan song rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni ngan song rnams la'o //
translated: Fear is in the lower realms.

original: nus dang ldan pa ni dge ba la sbyor ba la'o //
analyzed: nus dang ldan pa ni dge ba la sbyor ba la'o //
translated: Being able is in the application to virtue.

original: tshe thung ba ni re ltar thogs na tshe lo brgya'o //
analyzed: tshe thung ba ni re ltar thogs na tshe lo brgya'o //
translated: Short life is, for example, a life of one hundred years.

original: de yang ma nges pa ni tshe de yang ma nges te /
analyzed: de yang ma nges pa ni tshe de yang ma nges te /
translated: That is also uncertain.

original: res 'ga' ni mngal nyid du 'chi'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni mngal nyid du 'chi'o //
translated: Sometimes one dies in the womb.

original: res 'ga' ni byis par ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni byis par ro //
translated: Sometimes one dies as a child.

original: res 'ga' ni dar la bab pa na'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni dar la bab pa na'o //
translated: Sometimes one dies in the prime of life.

original: mi bya ba ni bya min /
analyzed: mi bya ba ni bya min /
translated: What should not be done is not to be done.

original: dge ba mi dge bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge ba mi dge bar bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that what should be done is virtuous and what should not be done is non-virtuous.

original: byed pa po gzhan med /
analyzed: byed pa po gzhan med /
translated: There is no other agent.

original: de la byed pa po gzhan med pa'o //🔽ma byas par bde legs med /
analyzed: de la byed pa po gzhan med pa'o // ma byas par bde legs med /
translated: There is no other agent than that.🔽Without doing, there is no well-being.

original: dge ba ma byas par sdug bsngal med pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba ma byas par sdug bsngal med pa med pa'o //
translated: Without doing virtue, there is no absence of suffering.

original: byas pa yang mi 'jig dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las bsags pa yang 'bras bur ma smin par chud mi za'o //
analyzed: byas pa yang mi 'jig dge ba dang mi dge ba'i las bsags pa yang 'bras bur ma smin par chud mi za'o //
translated: and what is done is not lost, for the accumulation of virtuous and nonvirtuous karma does not perish without having caused results.

original: de byed mi shes min /
analyzed: de byed mi shes min /
translated: Nor is it that he does not know how to do it.

original: bdag gis ji ltar dge ba bya snyam pa dang / gang gis na ngan song du mi 'gro zhing bde 'gro thob par bya snyam du thabs mi shes pa la yang ma yin bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bdag gis ji ltar dge ba bya snyam pa dang / gang gis na ngan song du mi 'gro zhing bde 'gro thob par bya snyam du thabs mi shes pa la yang ma yin bzhin du'o //
translated: It is not that he does not know the means by which he can avoid the lower rebirths and attain the happy rebirths, thinking, “How can I do what is virtuous?”🔽The verse “If ordinary people” and so on is stated to refute the idea that the desire realm is the essence of the body.

original: gal te so so'i skye bo dag / ces bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni 'dod pa nyid ni zang zing gi phub ma yin pas 'dod pa'i ni zang zing gi phub ma smos pas ni de la @297b snying po nyid 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: gal te so so'i skye bo dag / ces bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni 'dod pa nyid ni zang zing gi phub ma yin pas 'dod pa'i ni zang zing gi phub ma smos pas ni de la @297b snying po nyid 'gog par byed do //
translated: The desire realm is the husk of material things, so the desire realm is called the husk of material things.

original: 'di skad du 'di ji skad du bstan pa de ltar yin na //
analyzed: 'di skad du 'di ji skad du bstan pa de ltar yin na //
translated: This is what is being taught: “It is just as I have taught.

original: ci'i phyir so so'i skye bo 'di 'dod pa'i zang zing gi phub ma la 'jus nas kye ma rab tu myos pa'i glang po che'i nyal ba byed dam ci zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir so so'i skye bo 'di 'dod pa'i zang zing gi phub ma la 'jus nas kye ma rab tu myos pa'i glang po che'i nyal ba byed dam ci zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Why do ordinary people, clinging to the husk of material things in the desire realm, act like elephants in rut?”

original: so so'i skye bo'i zhes bya ba ni skye bo gang bden pa mthong ba rnams las so sor phyi rol du gyur pa de ni so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i zhes bya ba ni skye bo gang bden pa mthong ba rnams las so sor phyi rol du gyur pa de ni so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The term “ordinary person” refers to one who is outside of the group of those who have seen the truth.

original: kye ma 'di ni zhes bya ba ni de la snying brtse bar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: kye ma 'di ni zhes bya ba ni de la snying brtse bar ston pa yin no //
translated: “Alas!” indicates compassion for them.

original: rab myos pa'i glang chen nyal ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu myos pa nyid kyi glang chen nyal ba yin pas na rab tu myos pa'i glang chen nyal ba de'o //
analyzed: rab myos pa'i glang chen nyal ba zhes bya ba ni rab tu myos pa nyid kyi glang chen nyal ba yin pas na rab tu myos pa'i glang chen nyal ba de'o //
translated: “A sleeping elephant in a deep stupor” is a sleeping elephant in a deep stupor.

original: yang rnam pa gzhan gyis skyo bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gzhan gyis skyo bar byed pa ni /
translated: In another way, he causes them to feel revulsion:

original: byis pa kun ni rten yod kyang //
analyzed: byis pa kun ni rten yod kyang //
translated: All fools, though they have a support,

original: zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The verse continues:

original: byis pa kun ni rten yod kyang //
analyzed: byis pa kun ni rten yod kyang //
translated: All fools, though they have a support,

original: zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams ni rten pa yod kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo rnams ni rten pa yod kyang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “All fools” refers to ordinary beings. “Though they have a support” means they have a support.

original: 'dir byas legs zhes bya ba ni kyi hud tshig go //
analyzed: 'dir byas legs zhes bya ba ni kyi hud tshig go //
translated: Here, “alas!” is an expression of sorrow.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams kyis ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di rnams kyis ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: These verses

original: kye ma mi bzad kye ma dka' zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: kye ma mi bzad kye ma dka' zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Oh, how unbearable! Oh, how difficult! and so on.

original: log par bsgrub pa skyon lnga dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni log par bsgrub pa de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: log par bsgrub pa skyon lnga dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni log par bsgrub pa de ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Wrong practice is said to be associated with five faults. Wrong practice is of two kinds:

original: sangs rgyas kyi gsung mi nyan pa'i mtshan nyid yin par 'chad de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi gsung mi nyan pa'i mtshan nyid yin par 'chad de /
translated: it is explained that it is characterized by not listening to the Buddha's teachings.

original: log par bsgrub pa de yang tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gsum dag gis bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas so //🔽tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gsum dag gis bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas gsung zhes bya ba gang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: log par bsgrub pa de yang tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gsum dag gis bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas so // tshigs su bcad pa gzhan gsum dag gis bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas gsung zhes bya ba gang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ste /
translated: And that wrong practice is indicated by the next three verses, as it is said in the extensive version:

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsum po 'di dag gis so //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsum po 'di dag gis so //
translated: indicated by the next three verses.🔽 These are the three verses beginning with What is called the Buddha's teaching?

original: de yang mdor bsdu na sangs rgyas kyi gsung mi nyan pa dang / mi 'dzin pa las brtsams nas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na sangs rgyas kyi gsung mi nyan pa dang / mi 'dzin pa las brtsams nas rig par bya'o //
translated: And that is to be understood in brief, beginning with not listening to and not holding the Buddha's teachings.

original: re zhig mi nyan pa las brtsams nas rig par bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung gang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: re zhig mi nyan pa las brtsams nas rig par bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung gang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ste /
translated: The topic of the non-listening is stated in the passage beginning with “What is the speech of the Buddha?”

original: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi gsung mi nyan pa'i log par bsgrub pa ni sangs rgyas gsung zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas brlag pa'i rgyu /
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas kyi gsung mi nyan pa'i log par bsgrub pa ni sangs rgyas gsung zhes bya ba nas brtsams nas brlag pa'i rgyu /
translated: Thus, the wrong practice of not listening to the speech of the Buddha is taught in two verses beginning with “The speech of the Buddha” up to “the cause of destruction.”

original: grong pa'i sgra la mngon par dga' //🔽zhes bya ba'i bar gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: grong pa'i sgra la mngon par dga' // zhes bya ba'i bar gyi tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: One delights in the sounds of the village.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi gsung gang rnyed par dka' ba dang zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig rnams sangs rgyas gsung zhes bya ba gang zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig rnams su ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi gsung gang rnyed par dka' ba dang zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig rnams sangs rgyas gsung zhes bya ba gang zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i tshig rnams su ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: There, the words “What is the speech of the Buddha?” and so on should be applied appropriately to the words “The speech of the Buddha, which is difficult to obtain” and so on.

original: mi 'dzin pa las @298a * //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa las @298a * //
translated: From not holding.

original: brtsams nas rig par bya ba ni thos nas yang phan par bzhed pa dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: brtsams nas rig par bya ba ni thos nas yang phan par bzhed pa dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The object of knowledge is one who is desirous of benefitting others through teaching.

original: de lta bu'i 'dzin pa'i log par sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'dzin pa'i log par sgrub pa ni /
translated: Such a misapprehension is

original: bdag la phan par brtson rnams kyis ni dgra yin yang //
analyzed: bdag la phan par brtson rnams kyis ni dgra yin yang //
translated: even an enemy to those who strive to benefit oneself.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is indicated by the verse.

original: 'dir yang tshig tu'am don du ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang tshig tu'am don du ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the words and the meaning should be applied as appropriate.🔽That is indicated by the words “intolerable” and so on.

original: de ni mi bzad pa la sogs pa'i sgras bstan to zhes bya ba ni log par sgrub pa de ni mi bzad pa dang / dka' ba la sogs pa'i sgras bstan to /
analyzed: de ni mi bzad pa la sogs pa'i sgras bstan to zhes bya ba ni log par sgrub pa de ni mi bzad pa dang / dka' ba la sogs pa'i sgras bstan to /
translated: That misapprehension is indicated by the words “intolerable,” “difficult,” and so on.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is that done?

original: de rnams kyis log par sgrub pa de mthong nas /
analyzed: de rnams kyis log par sgrub pa de mthong nas /
translated: When they see that misapprehension,

original: kye ma mi bzad kye ma dka' //
analyzed: kye ma mi bzad kye ma dka' //
translated: they say, “Alas, it is intolerable! Alas, it is difficult!

original: kye ma'o sdug bsngal kye ma'o 'jigs //
analyzed: kye ma'o sdug bsngal kye ma'o 'jigs //
translated: Alas, it is suffering! Alas, it is frightening!”

original: zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa smos pa yin no //
translated: and so on.

original: gnod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is the cause of harm.

original: lus la gnod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / sems la gnod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus la gnod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / sems la gnod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of harm to the body and because it is the cause of harm to the mind.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rdeg pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi gnod pa dang / mya ngan gyi gnas yin pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rdeg pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi gnod pa dang / mya ngan gyi gnas yin pa nyid kyis te /
translated: It is the basis of harm from others, such as killing, binding, beating, etc., and it is the basis of sorrow.

original: gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rdeg pa la sogs pa nyid gzhan gyi gnod pa yin pas gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rdeg pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi gnod pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras ni rtsod pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rdeg pa la sogs pa nyid gzhan gyi gnod pa yin pas gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rdeg pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi gnod pa dang / sogs pa'i sgras ni rtsod pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The harm from others, such as killing, binding, beating, etc., is the basis of sorrow. The word “etc.” includes disputes, etc.

original: gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rdeg pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi gnod pa de'i gnas yin pa nyid kyis ni rten yin pa nyid kyis so //🔽de ltar na re zhig sdug bsngal ba ni lus la gnod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsod pa dang / 'ching ba dang / rdeg pa la sogs pa gzhan gyi gnod pa de'i gnas yin pa nyid kyis ni rten yin pa nyid kyis so // de ltar na re zhig sdug bsngal ba ni lus la gnod pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of that harm from others, such as killing, binding, beating, etc., because it is the support of that.

original: sems la gnod pa'i phyir yang yin te /
analyzed: sems la gnod pa'i phyir yang yin te /
translated: Thus, suffering is the cause of harm to the body, and it is also the cause of harm to the mind.🔽How so?

original: mya ngan gyi gnas yin pa nyid kyis ni yid mi bde ba'i rten yin pa nyid kyis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mya ngan gyi gnas yin pa nyid kyis ni yid mi bde ba'i rten yin pa nyid kyis so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is a basis of sorrow, it is the basis of mental dissatisfaction.

original: mya ngan byas pa ni gnas 'jog gi bu sa'i bcud nub pa dang sems can de dag 'dus shing phrad nas kye ma'o sa'i bcud ces mya ngan gyis dub par byed /
analyzed: mya ngan byas pa ni gnas 'jog gi bu sa'i bcud nub pa dang sems can de dag 'dus shing phrad nas kye ma'o sa'i bcud ces mya ngan gyis dub par byed /
translated: When the essence of the earth disappears, sentient beings gather together and lament, “Alas, the essence of the earth!”

original: smre sngags 'don par byed do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: smre sngags 'don par byed do zhes 'byung ba yin no //
translated: They lament and wail.

original: de bzhin du khyed kyis mi khom pa'i rab brgyad phug ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de bzhin du khyed kyis mi khom pa'i rab brgyad phug ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: So too, you should understand that the eight inopportune states are like the eight openings in a fortification.

original: mi khom brgyad po gang dag gi zhe na /
analyzed: mi khom brgyad po gang dag gi zhe na /
translated: What are the eight inopportune states?

original: dge slong dag brgyad po 'di dag ni gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir mi khom pa dang dus med pa dag yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag brgyad po 'di dag ni gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir mi khom pa dang dus med pa dag yin no //
translated: Bhikṣus, these eight are inopportune states, times that are not opportune for attaining the state of pure conduct.

original: brgyad po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: dge slong dag ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa bde bar @298b gshegs pa 'jig rten mkhyen pa /🔽skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa bde bar @298b gshegs pa 'jig rten mkhyen pa / skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
translated: “Monks, when the Teacher, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, the one endowed with wisdom and conduct, the Well-Gone One, the Knower of the World,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: the Unsurpassed One, the Tamer of Men, the Teacher of Gods and Men,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten 'dir byung ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten 'dir byung ste /
translated: the Blessed Buddha appears in this world,🔽and teaches the Dharma that is peaceful and sublime, leading to the complete transcendence of suffering, to the abandonment of suffering,

original: chos nye bar zhi ba can yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa can rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro ba bde bar gshags pas gsungs pa ston par mdzad la sems can de sems can dmyal ba rnams su skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: chos nye bar zhi ba can yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa can rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro ba bde bar gshags pas gsungs pa ston par mdzad la sems can de sems can dmyal ba rnams su skyes pa yin te /
translated: but that being is born among the hell beings,

original: 'di ni gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir mi khom pa dang / dus med pa dang po yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir mi khom pa dang / dus med pa dang po yin no //
translated: this is the first person who, for the sake of abiding in pure conduct, is not free and does not have the right opportunity, as before.

original: de bzhin du dud 'gro rnams su yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dud 'gro rnams su yin no //
translated: Similarly, it is the same for those born as animals.

original: 'di ni gnyis pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gnyis pa ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This is the second, as before.

original: de bzhin du yi dags rnams su yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du yi dags rnams su yin no //
translated: Likewise, they are hungry ghosts.

original: 'di ni gsum pa ste snga ma bzhin no //🔽gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ni gsum pa ste snga ma bzhin no // gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba nas /
translated: This is the third, as before.🔽Moreover, it is said that a bodhisattva who is in the stage of action out of faith

original: sems can de ni lha tshe ring po rnams kyi nang du skyes pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
analyzed: sems can de ni lha tshe ring po rnams kyi nang du skyes pa yin zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /
translated: is born among the long-lived gods.

original: 'di ni bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bzhi pa yin no //
translated: This is the fourth.🔽Moreover, it is said that a bodhisattva who is in the stage of action out of faith

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa ston par mdzad la zhes bya ba'i par dang / sems can de ni yul mtha' 'khob tu gang na 'khor bzhi po dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams mi snang ba'i mtha' 'khob kla klo rnams su skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba nas bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa ston par mdzad la zhes bya ba'i par dang / sems can de ni yul mtha' 'khob tu gang na 'khor bzhi po dge slong dang / dge slong ma dang / dge bsnyen dang / dge bsnyen ma rnams mi snang ba'i mtha' 'khob kla klo rnams su skyes pa yin te /
translated: is born in a border region where the four assemblies of monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen are not present.

original: 'di ni mi khom pa lnga pa yin te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi khom pa lnga pa yin te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: This is the fifth unfavorable condition, as before.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba nas /
translated: Moreover, it is said that a bodhisattva who is in the stage of action out of faith🔽is born in a place where the word “Buddha” is not even known.

original: bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa ston par mdzad la zhes bya ba'i bar dang / sems can de yang yul dbus su skyes nas /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa ston par mdzad la zhes bya ba'i bar dang / sems can de yang yul dbus su skyes nas /
translated: but that sentient being is born in a border region,

original: de glen pa dang / lug ltar lkugs pa dang / lag brda can dang / legs par bshad pa dang nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don shes par mi nus pa yin te /
analyzed: de glen pa dang / lug ltar lkugs pa dang / lag brda can dang / legs par bshad pa dang nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don shes par mi nus pa yin te /
translated: is stupid, mute like a sheep, uses sign language, and is unable to understand the meaning of the teachings that are well spoken or badly spoken.

original: snga ma bzhin du mi khom pa dang / dus med pa drug pa yin no //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du mi khom pa dang / dus med pa drug pa yin no //
translated: As before, this is the sixth inopportune state, the inopportune state of a time of degeneration.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba na /🔽bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa ston par mdzad la zhes bya ba'i bar dang / sems can de yang yul dbus su skyes shing mi glen pa dang / lug ltar lkugs pa ma yin pa dang / lag brda can ma yin pa dang / legs par bshad pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba na / bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa ston par mdzad la zhes bya ba'i bar dang / sems can de yang yul dbus su skyes shing mi glen pa dang / lug ltar lkugs pa ma yin pa dang / lag brda can ma yin pa dang / legs par bshad pa dang /
translated: Moreover,🔽and the Sugata’s teachings are being taught,

original: nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don shes par nus pa yin na /
analyzed: nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don shes par nus pa yin na /
translated: but that sentient being is born in a central region, is not stupid, is not mute like a sheep, does not use sign language, and is able to understand the meaning of the teachings that are well spoken or badly spoken.

original: de log par lta ba can dang / phyin ci log par lta ba can dang / phyin ci log tu lta ba can yin pas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du sbyin pa med do //
analyzed: de log par lta ba can dang / phyin ci log par lta ba can dang / phyin ci log tu lta ba can yin pas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du sbyin pa med do //
translated: They are people who have wrong views, who have distorted views, who have perverted views. They think and say, ‘There is no generosity.

original: mchod sbyin med do //🔽sbyin @299a * //
analyzed: mchod sbyin med do // sbyin @299a * //
translated: There is no offering.

original: sreg med do //
analyzed: sreg med do //
translated: There is no burnt offering.

original: legs par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa med do //
translated: There is no good conduct.

original: nyes par spyad pa med do //
analyzed: nyes par spyad pa med do //
translated: There is no bad conduct.

original: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa dang nyes par spyad pa'i las rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa med do //
translated: There are no results or ripening of good or bad conduct.

original: 'jig rten 'di med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di med do //
translated: There is no this world.

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do //🔽pha med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do // pha med do //
translated: There is no next world.🔽There are no fathers.

original: ma med do //
analyzed: ma med do //
translated: There are no mothers.

original: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do //
analyzed: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do //
translated: There are no beings who are reborn spontaneously.

original: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa med do //🔽yang dag par song ba med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa med do // yang dag par song ba med do //
translated: There are no arhats in the world.🔽There are no those who have correct conduct.

original: yang dag par zhugs pa med do //
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa med do //
translated: There are no those who have entered the correct path.

original: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas bdag gi skye ba zad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas bdag gi skye ba zad do //
translated: Having realized this world and the next world by their own supernormal knowledge, they say, “Our births have come to an end.

original: tshangs par spyod pa bsten to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa bsten to //
translated: I have practiced pure conduct.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: I have done what had to be done.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed pa med do zhes smra ba 'di ni gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir mi khom pa ste /
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed pa med do zhes smra ba 'di ni gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir mi khom pa ste /
translated: I will know no other existence than this one.

original: dus med pa bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: dus med pa bdun pa yin no //
translated: This is the seventh timelessness.

original: gzhan yang sems can de ni yul dbus su skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can de ni yul dbus su skyes pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, that sentient being has been born in a central country.

original: de yang mi glen pa dang / lkugs pa ma yin pa dang / lag brda can ma yin pa dang / legs par bshad pa dang nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don shes par nus pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang mi glen pa dang / lkugs pa ma yin pa dang / lag brda can ma yin pa dang / legs par bshad pa dang nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don shes par nus pa yin la /
translated: He is not a fool or a mute, nor is he one who communicates through gestures, and he is able to understand the meaning of things that are well explained and poorly explained.

original: de yang dag pa'i lta ba can nas bya ba byas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang dag pa'i lta ba can nas bya ba byas pa'o //
translated: He has right view, and so on up to:

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed pa'i bar yang yin na /
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed pa'i bar yang yin na /
translated: he knows that he will know no other existence than this one.

original: ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhags su ldan pa /
analyzed: ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhags su ldan pa /
translated: The Teacher, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One, the one who has knowledge and skill,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: the Sugata,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa /
translated: the Knower of the World,

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /
translated: the Unsurpassed Leader of persons to be tamed,

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa /
translated: the Teacher of gods and humans,🔽the Blessed Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du ma byung zhing chos nye bar zhi ba can /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten du ma byung zhing chos nye bar zhi ba can /
translated: When the Blessed Buddha does not appear in the world, when the Dharma is at peace,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa can /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa can /
translated: when it is completely in Nirvāṇa,

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro ba bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa ston par mi mdzad pa 'di ni gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir mi khom pa dang dus med pa brgyad pa yin no //🔽dge slong dag gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir khom pa de ni gcig pu kho na dang / dus gcig pu yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro ba bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa ston par mi mdzad pa 'di ni gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir mi khom pa dang dus med pa brgyad pa yin no // dge slong dag gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir khom pa de ni gcig pu kho na dang / dus gcig pu yin no //
translated: when the Sugata’s teaching of the happiness of going to complete enlightenment is not being taught, this is the eighth inopportune, untimely situation for a person to abide in pure conduct.🔽Monks, for a person to abide in pure conduct, this is the only opportune, timely situation.

original: dge slong dag gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir khom pa de gcig pu dang / dus gcig pu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong dag gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir khom pa de gcig pu dang / dus gcig pu gang zhe na /
translated: Monks, what is that one opportune, timely situation for a person to abide in pure conduct?

original: dge slong dag ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa /
translated: “Monks, when a teacher—a thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha—appears in the world,

original: bde bar gshegs pa /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa /
translated: he is a blissful one,

original: 'jig rten mkhyen @299b pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen @299b pa /
translated: a knower of the world,

original: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa /🔽lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten 'dir byung zhing chos nye bar zhi ba can /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul ba'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa / lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten 'dir byung zhing chos nye bar zhi ba can /
translated: a charioteer who tames people, an unsurpassed one,

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa can rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro ba bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa ston par mdzad la /
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa can rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'gro ba bde bar gshegs pas gsungs pa ston par mdzad la /
translated: a teacher of gods and humans, a blessed buddha. He teaches the Dharma of complete peace and transcendence, and he teaches the path to perfect awakening, which the blissful ones have proclaimed.

original: sems can de yang yul gyi dbus su skyes shing /
analyzed: sems can de yang yul gyi dbus su skyes shing /
translated: That being is born in the center of a country,

original: de mi glen pa dang / lug ltar lkugs pa ma yin pa dang / lag brda can ma yin pa dang / legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don shes par nus pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de mi glen pa dang / lug ltar lkugs pa ma yin pa dang / lag brda can ma yin pa dang / legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par smras pa'i chos rnams kyi don shes par nus pa yang yin la /
translated: and he is not a fool, a mute like a sheep, or a person who communicates through gestures. He is able to understand the meaning of what is well said and what is badly said.

original: de yang dag pa'i lta ba can dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i lta ba can yin pas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du sbyin pa yod do //
analyzed: de yang dag pa'i lta ba can dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i lta ba can yin pas 'di ltar lta zhing 'di skad du sbyin pa yod do //
translated: They have the right view, the unerring view. They see thus and speak thus: ‘There is giving,

original: mchod sbyin yod do //
analyzed: mchod sbyin yod do //
translated: there is sacrifice,

original: sbyin sreg yod do //🔽legs par spyod pa yod do //
analyzed: sbyin sreg yod do // legs par spyod pa yod do //
translated: there is offering.

original: nyes par spyod pa yod do //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa yod do //
translated: There are good and virtuous deeds and bad and sinful deeds.

original: legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa gnyis kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod do //🔽'jig rten 'di yod do //
analyzed: legs par spyad pa dang / nyes par spyad pa gnyis kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa yod do // 'jig rten 'di yod do //
translated: There are results and fruits of good and virtuous and bad and sinful deeds.

original: 'jig rten pha rol yod do //🔽pha yod do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol yod do // pha yod do //
translated: There is this world and the next world.

original: ma yod do //
analyzed: ma yod do //
translated: There are father and mother.

original: sems can rdzus te skye ba yod do //
analyzed: sems can rdzus te skye ba yod do //
translated: There are spontaneously born beings.

original: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa dang / yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa dang / 'jig rten 'di dang / 'jig rten pha rol rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas bdag gi skye ba zad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten na dgra bcom pa dang / yang dag par song ba dang / yang dag par zhugs pa dang / 'jig rten 'di dang / 'jig rten pha rol rang gi mngon par shes pas mngon sum du byas te bsgrubs nas bdag gi skye ba zad do //
translated: There are in the world ascetics and brahmins who have attained perfection, reached perfection, and proclaim it who are well gone and well directed, and who declare their own direct knowledge and realization of this world and the next world.🔽They say, “Our births have come to an end.

original: tshangs par spyod pa bsten to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa bsten to //
translated: We have lived the spiritual life.

original: bya ba byas so //
analyzed: bya ba byas so //
translated: We have done what needed to be done.

original: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed pa yod do zhes smra ba 'di ni dge slong dag gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir khom pa de gcig pu yin zhing dus gcig pu yin no //
analyzed: 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed pa yod do zhes smra ba 'di ni dge slong dag gang zag tshangs par spyod pa la gnas par bya ba'i phyir khom pa de gcig pu yin zhing dus gcig pu yin no //
translated: Monks, this is the one opportunity that has arisen, the one occasion that has come, for the person who is living the holy life to live it.

original: phag mo thi ba'i phreng ldan ma'i sngon gyi tshul yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: phag mo thi ba'i phreng ldan ma'i sngon gyi tshul yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: The story of the sow Surasā should also be told here.

original: de bzhin du dam pa'i chos mnyen pas zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dam pa'i chos mnyen pas zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it that the Blessed One, having seen a sow with many piglets suckling her, said, Monks, this is the one opportunity that has arisen, the one occasion that has come, for the person who is living the holy life to live it?

original: gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na ste /
analyzed: gleng gzhi ni rgyal po'i khab na ste /
translated: The story goes like this:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis phag mo phru gu mang po dag gis nu ba zhig gzigs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis phag mo phru gu mang po dag gis nu ba zhig gzigs so //
translated: The Blessed One saw a sow with many piglets suckling her.

original: gzigs nas kyang 'dzum pa mdzad pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad pa mthong ngo //
analyzed: gzigs nas kyang 'dzum pa mdzad pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad pa mthong ngo //
translated: Having seen her, he smiled. The venerable Ānanda saw the Blessed One smiling.

original: mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: mthong nas kyang bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: Having seen him, he said this to the Blessed One:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rgyu ma mchis rkyen ma mchis par 'dzum pa mi mdzad na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams ni rgyu ma mchis rkyen ma mchis par 'dzum pa mi mdzad na /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One does not smile without a cause, without a reason.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu ni gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'dzum pa mdzad pa'i rgyu ni gang lags /
translated: Blessed One, what is the cause of your smile?

original: rkyen ni gang lags /
analyzed: rkyen ni gang lags /
translated: What is the reason?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' @300a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' @300a * //
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: stsal pa / kun dga' bo sngon byung ba na rgyal po dbang chen sde zhes bya ba zhig byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: stsal pa / kun dga' bo sngon byung ba na rgyal po dbang chen sde zhes bya ba zhig byung bar gyur te /
translated: “Ānanda, in the past there was a king named Mahendrasena.

original: de la bu mo thi ba'i phreng ldan ma zhes bya ba zhig yod de /
analyzed: de la bu mo thi ba'i phreng ldan ma zhes bya ba zhig yod de /
translated: He had a daughter named Śārikā-mālā.

original: bu mo des pha la tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: bu mo des pha la tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: That girl spoke this verse to her father:

original: gang nas 'gro ba ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: gang nas 'gro ba ldog par 'gyur //
translated: ‘From where will one turn back from going?

original: lam ni gang du ldog par 'gyur //
analyzed: lam ni gang du ldog par 'gyur //
translated: On what path will one turn back?🔽In the world, where does all happiness and suffering cease?’

original: 'jig rten na ni bde ba dang // sdug bsngal ma lus gang du 'gag / ces bya ba 'di smras pa dang / de nas phas bram ze rnams bsdus te 'di ci zhig ces smras na /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ni bde ba dang // sdug bsngal ma lus gang du 'gag / ces bya ba 'di smras pa dang / de nas phas bram ze rnams bsdus te 'di ci zhig ces smras na /
translated: Then her father gathered the brahmins and asked, ‘What is this?’

original: de rnams kyis don khong du ma chud nas ba gros te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis don khong du ma chud nas ba gros te /
translated: Not understanding the meaning of this, they were confused.

original: rgyal po chen po cis yang ma lags so //
analyzed: rgyal po chen po cis yang ma lags so //
translated: “Great King, it is nothing at all.”🔽“It is nothing at all.”

original: ci yang ma lags so zhes smras pa dang / bu mo des mang po dag gi sgra de thos nas sngon de'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshogs yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i phyir rim gyis ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: ci yang ma lags so zhes smras pa dang / bu mo des mang po dag gi sgra de thos nas sngon de'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i tshogs yang dag par bsgrubs pa'i phyir rim gyis ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: The girl heard the words of the crowd and, because she had previously correctly accomplished the accumulations for meditative absorption, she gradually entered the meditative absorption of the sphere of nothingness.

original: rgyu des ci yang med pa'i skye mched dag tu skyes so //
analyzed: rgyu des ci yang med pa'i skye mched dag tu skyes so //
translated: By that cause, she was born in the sphere of nothingness.

original: de nas shi 'phos nas lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi khyad par gyis de ltar phag mor gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de nas shi 'phos nas lan grangs gzhan la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las kyi khyad par gyis de ltar phag mor gyur pa yin no //
translated: Then, after death, by the power of karma to be experienced in other lives, she became a sow.

original: gal te bu mo des tshigs su bcad pa 'dis las /🔽mig dang rnam ba de bzhin sna //
analyzed: gal te bu mo des tshigs su bcad pa 'dis las / mig dang rnam ba de bzhin sna //
translated: If that girl had recited this verse🔽“Eye, form, and likewise ear,

original: lce dang lus dang de bzhin yid //
analyzed: lce dang lus dang de bzhin yid //
translated: Nose, tongue, and likewise mind,

original: ming dang gzugs ni gang dag tu //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs ni gang dag tu //
translated: Name and form, wherever

original: ma lus par ni 'gag 'gyur ba //
analyzed: ma lus par ni 'gag 'gyur ba //
translated: They cease without remainder,

original: de nas 'gro ba ldog gyur pa //
analyzed: de nas 'gro ba ldog gyur pa //
translated: Then, when the sentient being is born in a higher realm,

original: zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'i lan thob na de gnas skabs der mi 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba'i lan thob na de gnas skabs der mi 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: the force of the former action is exhausted.

original: de bzhin du dam pa'i chos mnyan pas sems can rnams mngon par mtho ba'i 'gro bar skyes nas shugs zad pa ni 'phen pa zad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du dam pa'i chos mnyan pas sems can rnams mngon par mtho ba'i 'gro bar skyes nas shugs zad pa ni 'phen pa zad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: Similarly, when sentient beings are born in a higher realm through listening to the holy Dharma, the force of the former action is exhausted, which is to say, the impetus is exhausted.

original: mda' gnam du 'phangs pa slar sal ltung ba bzhin du yang ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mda' gnam du 'phangs pa slar sal ltung ba bzhin du yang ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Like an arrow shot into the air that falls back to the ground, they again go to miserable realms.🔽The verse of inquiry states:🔽“When does the sentient being turn back from going?”

original: 'dri ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gang nas 'gro ba ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba 'di dang / tshigs su bcad pa de'i lan /
analyzed: 'dri ba'i tshigs su bcad pa gang nas 'gro ba ldog par 'gyur zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba 'di dang / tshigs su bcad pa de'i lan /
translated: The answer to that verse states:

original: mig dang rna ba de bzhin sna //
analyzed: mig dang rna ba de bzhin sna //
translated: “The eye, the ear, and likewise the nose,🔽and so on.”

original: zhes rgya cher 'byung bas tshigs su bcad pa'i don dang ldan pa yang shes par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes rgya cher 'byung bas tshigs su bcad pa'i don dang ldan pa yang shes par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the verse should be understood in accordance with this.

original: gzhung mangs kyis dogs pas bdag gis ma bris so //
analyzed: gzhung mangs kyis dogs pas bdag gis ma bris so //
translated: Fearing too many quotations, I will not write more.

original: de lta bas na rnam pa de lta bu'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / gtam dang sngon gyi sbyor ba la sogs pa dag gis te /🔽ji skad ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dag dang / gtam dag dang / sngon gyi sbyor ba la sogs pa dag gis so //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam pa de lta bu'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / gtam dang sngon gyi sbyor ba la sogs pa dag gis te / ji skad ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dag dang / gtam dag dang / sngon gyi sbyor ba la sogs pa dag gis so //
translated: Therefore, by such verses, such stories, such past events, etc.🔽By such verses as are taught, by such stories, by such past events, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni rang gis legs par bshad pa sbyar bdag gis skyo ba'i gtam nye bar bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni rang gis legs par bshad pa sbyar bdag gis skyo ba'i gtam nye bar bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the stories of the past that are told to weary people.

original: gces pa dang ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
analyzed: gces pa dang ni zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la /
translated: “What is dear” is explained in detail.

original: mdo sde'i yang dag par bstan pa la sogs pa gces @300b pa ste dgos pa brjod par bya'o //🔽mdo sde'i dgongs pa can gyi gsung de dag rnam pa mang du ni dgongs pa can gyi gsung ni dgongs pa can gyi gsung ngo //
analyzed: mdo sde'i yang dag par bstan pa la sogs pa gces @300b pa ste dgos pa brjod par bya'o // mdo sde'i dgongs pa can gyi gsung de dag rnam pa mang du ni dgongs pa can gyi gsung ni dgongs pa can gyi gsung ngo //
translated: What is dear, what is necessary in the teaching of the Sutras, should be stated.🔽The statements of the Buddha that have a special intention should be explained as having a special intention.

original: rnam pa mang du ste rnam pa du mar brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa mang du ste rnam pa du mar brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: They should be explained in many ways, in many forms, this is the meaning.

original: tshig go don yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tshig go don yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: The meaning of the words should be stated.

original: brjod pa gang gis brjod par byas ba gang yin pa yang smos par bya zhing brjod par bya'o //🔽mtshams sbyar bsdebs pa 'dra bar ni mtshams sbyar ba ni tshig snga phyi gnyis 'brel bar bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa gang gis brjod par byas ba gang yin pa yang smos par bya zhing brjod par bya'o // mtshams sbyar bsdebs pa 'dra bar ni mtshams sbyar ba ni tshig snga phyi gnyis 'brel bar bya'o //
translated: One should also state and express what is to be expressed by whatever expression.🔽One should connect the two phrases in a sequence.🔽One should connect the two phrases in a sequence.

original: mtshams sbyar ba de'i bsdebs pa ni 'brel bar bya'o //🔽'dra bar ni rig pa'i ngo bo brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtshams sbyar ba de'i bsdebs pa ni 'brel bar bya'o // 'dra bar ni rig pa'i ngo bo brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One should express the meaning of the two phrases in a sequence.

original: 'gal ba shes par bya ba ni brgal ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'gal ba shes par bya ba ni brgal ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: One should understand the contradiction, which is of two kinds:

original: sgra la brgal ba dang / don la brgal bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgra la brgal ba dang / don la brgal bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: contradiction in the words and contradiction in the meaning.

original: lan gdab thabs kyang ni lan gdab ni brgal ba de'i lan no //
analyzed: lan gdab thabs kyang ni lan gdab ni brgal ba de'i lan no //
translated: One should also express the method of reply, which is the reply to the contradiction.

original: lan gdab pa de yang thabs te /
analyzed: lan gdab pa de yang thabs te /
translated: That reply is also a method.

original: thabs de nyid mang du ste mang por brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs de nyid mang du ste mang por brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should express that method in many ways.

original: yon tan 'di dag rnams dang ldan pas /
analyzed: yon tan 'di dag rnams dang ldan pas /
translated: One who possesses these qualities

original: gal te smra na legs smra yin //
analyzed: gal te smra na legs smra yin //
translated: is a good speaker if he speaks.

original: zhes bya ba ni dgos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi yon tan du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dgos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi yon tan du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This shows the quality of being purposeful.

original: gces pa brjod ces bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: gces pa brjod ces bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The word “precious” indicates this.

original: dgongs pa zad pa nyid ni /🔽dgongs pa can gyi gsung dag rnam pa mang du brjod //
analyzed: dgongs pa zad pa nyid ni / dgongs pa can gyi gsung dag rnam pa mang du brjod //
translated: The exhaustion of intention

original: ces bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //🔽mtshan nyid zab pa nyid ni tshig gi don ni brjod par bya /
analyzed: ces bya ba'i tshig 'dis so // mtshan nyid zab pa nyid ni tshig gi don ni brjod par bya /
translated: is indicated by the word “intentional.”

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The profundity of the characteristics is indicated by the word “meaning.”

original: snga phyi 'brel pa nyid ni mtshams sbyar bsdebs pa 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: snga phyi 'brel pa nyid ni mtshams sbyar bsdebs pa 'dra bar zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The connection between the earlier and later words is indicated by the word “similar.”🔽The quality of being connected with reasoning is indicated by the word “contradictory.”

original: rigs pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyi yon tan bstan pa ni 'gal ba dag dang / lan gdab thabs kyang mang du shes par bya //🔽zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: rigs pa dang 'brel pa nyid kyi yon tan bstan pa ni 'gal ba dag dang / lan gdab thabs kyang mang du shes par bya // zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The word “many” indicates the quality of being connected with the means of reply.

original: gang zhig gsal dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni gang zhig don gsal bar smra ba nas gang zhig don go bar byed pa smra ba'i bar ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gsal dang zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni gang zhig don gsal bar smra ba nas gang zhig don go bar byed pa smra ba'i bar ro //
translated: The word “clear” indicates the quality of being connected with the means of reply.

original: rang gi phyogs 'dzugs pa dang chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi phyogs 'dzugs pa dang chos ston pa'o //
translated: and establishing one’s own position and teaching the Dharma.

original: de la rang gi phyogs 'dzugs pa ni phas kyi rgol ba tshar ba can nas rang gi phyogs sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'dzugs pa byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rang gi phyogs 'dzugs pa ni phas kyi rgol ba tshar ba can nas rang gi phyogs sangs rgyas kyi gsung 'dzugs pa byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, establishing one’s own position should be understood as the establishment of one’s own position, the Buddha’s teaching, by one who has defeated the opponent.

original: chos ston pa ni gang zhig chos khon phyin ci ma log par ston cing legs par bye brag phyed nas mkhas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos ston pa ni gang zhig chos khon phyin ci ma log par ston cing legs par bye brag phyed nas mkhas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Teaching the Dharma is the correct teaching of the Dharma by one who is skilled in distinguishing well.

original: de la dang po'i ngag yongs su dag pa ni rang gi phyogs 'dzugs pa yin la /
analyzed: de la dang po'i ngag yongs su dag pa ni rang gi phyogs 'dzugs pa yin la /
translated: Among them, the purity of speech is the establishment of one’s own position.

original: gzhan gyis brgal du zin kyang snyan par smra ba nyid dang / mi snyan pa mi smra ba nyid kyis so //🔽phas kyi rgol ba la snyan par smra @301a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis brgal du zin kyang snyan par smra ba nyid dang / mi snyan pa mi smra ba nyid kyis so // phas kyi rgol ba la snyan par smra @301a * //
translated: Even when one is questioned by others, it is due to speaking pleasantly and not speaking unpleasantly.

original: ba dang / mi snyan par mi smra bas ngag yongs su dag par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: ba dang / mi snyan par mi smra bas ngag yongs su dag par bstan pa yin te /
translated: The purity of speech is taught by speaking pleasantly and not speaking unpleasantly to the opponent.

original: gang gis she na rtsa ba dang po nyid kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis she na rtsa ba dang po nyid kyis so //
translated: By what? By the first root itself.

original: sems yongs su dag pa ni gzhan gyis te /
analyzed: sems yongs su dag pa ni gzhan gyis te /
translated: The purity of mind is by the other.

original: de la bsngags pa dang rgyal ba thob kyang zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa thob cing rgyal ba thob kyang de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi skye bas so //🔽'dir bsngags pa thob cing rgyal ba thob kyang rgyags pa gang yin pa de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi skye ba ni de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'o //
analyzed: de la bsngags pa dang rgyal ba thob kyang zhes bya ba ni bsngags pa thob cing rgyal ba thob kyang de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi skye bas so // 'dir bsngags pa thob cing rgyal ba thob kyang rgyags pa gang yin pa de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi skye ba ni de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'o //
translated: Even if he obtains praise and victory, means even if he obtains praise and obtains victory, his secondary defilements do not arise.🔽Here, even if he obtains praise and victory, his secondary defilements do not arise, and that is his non-arising of secondary defilements.

original: de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i phyir de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi skye ba ste /
analyzed: de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi skye ba'i phyir de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa mi skye ba ste /
translated: Because of the non-arising of his secondary defilements, there is the non-arising of his secondary defilements.

original: sems yongs su dag pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: sems yongs su dag pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching on the purity of mind.

original: rtsa ba gnyis pas so //
analyzed: rtsa ba gnyis pas so //
translated: It is by means of the second root.

original: gnyis pa'i ngag yongs su dag pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa dang mi zlos pa dang / tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba dang / don gsal ba'i tshig brjod pa nyid kyis ngag yongs su dag pa bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i ngag yongs su dag pa ni yongs su rdzogs pa dang mi zlos pa dang / tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba dang / don gsal ba'i tshig brjod pa nyid kyis ngag yongs su dag pa bstan pa yin te /
translated: The purity of speech is taught by means of the complete expression, the non-repetition, the non-contradiction with valid cognition, and the expression of words that clarify the meaning.

original: rtsa ba gsum pas so //
analyzed: rtsa ba gsum pas so //
translated: It is by means of the third root.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is it done?

original: yongs su rdzogs pa brjod pas ngag yongs su dag pa bstan pa ni rgyas pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa brjod pas ngag yongs su dag pa bstan pa ni rgyas pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The purity of speech is taught by the expression of the complete meaning, by the expression of the extensive meaning.

original: mi zlos par brjod pas mi zlos pa brjod pa ste /
analyzed: mi zlos par brjod pas mi zlos pa brjod pa ste /
translated: The expression of the non-repetitive meaning is by the expression of the non-repetitive meaning.

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The expression of the various meanings is by the expression of the various meanings.

original: tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i don gyis na tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i don gyis te /
analyzed: tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i don gyis na tshad ma dang mi 'gal ba'i don gyis te /
translated: The expression of the meaning that is not in conflict with valid cognition is by the expression of the meaning that is not in conflict with valid cognition.

original: 'brel zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //🔽gsal ba'i tshig gis don brjod pas na gsal ba'i tshig brjod pa ste /
analyzed: 'brel zhes bya ba'i tshig 'dis so // gsal ba'i tshig gis don brjod pas na gsal ba'i tshig brjod pa ste /
translated: The expression of the connected meaning is by the expression of the connected meaning.🔽The expression of the clear meaning is by the expression of the clear meaning.

original: go byed ces bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
analyzed: go byed ces bya ba'i tshig 'dis so //
translated: The expression of the understandable meaning is by the expression of the understandable meaning.

original: de'i sems yongs su dag pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i bsam pa'i sems zang zing med pa nyid kyis bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i sems yongs su dag pa ni bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud la dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa'i bsam pa'i sems zang zing med pa nyid kyis bstan pa yin te /
translated: His pure mind is taught by the absence of material motives in his thoughts to generate the roots of virtue in the mind-streams of himself and others.

original: rtsa ba bzhi pas so //🔽mdo sde'i bshad pa'i shan 'di ni mdo sde'i bshad pa ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba bzhi pas so // mdo sde'i bshad pa'i shan 'di ni mdo sde'i bshad pa ste /
translated: This is by the fourth root.🔽The explanation of the sūtras is the explanation of the sūtras.

original: rnam par bshad pa ni mdo sde'i bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa ni mdo sde'i bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the explanation of the sūtras.

original: mdo sde'i bshad pa'i shan te /
analyzed: mdo sde'i bshad pa'i shan te /
translated: The Sūtra-explanation is the other part.

original: phyogs gcig dang cha shas ni mdo sde'i bshad pa'i shan to //
analyzed: phyogs gcig dang cha shas ni mdo sde'i bshad pa'i shan to //
translated: The Sūtra-explanation is the other part.

original: 'di zhes bya bas ni ji skad du bstan pa ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya bas ni ji skad du bstan pa ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word “this” shows what has been taught.

original: slob dpon mngon sum mnyan byas nas //
analyzed: slob dpon mngon sum mnyan byas nas //
translated: Having heard the teacher directly,

original: dad dang ldan pa blo zhan pa //
analyzed: dad dang ldan pa blo zhan pa //
translated: those who are faithful but of weak intellect,

original: de rnams la ni phan 'dod pas //
analyzed: de rnams la ni phan 'dod pas //
translated: desiring to benefit them,

original: rnam bshad rigs pa'i 'grel bshad yin //
analyzed: rnam bshad rigs pa'i 'grel bshad yin //
translated: this is the commentary on the Rational System of Exposition.

original: rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rnam par bshad pa rigs pa'i bshad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The Explanation of the Rational System of Exposition is completed.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po bi shu ddha sing ha dang / sh'akya sing ha dang / lo ts'a ba bande de wendra rakshi tas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po bi shu ddha sing ha dang / sh'akya sing ha dang / lo ts'a ba bande de wendra rakshi tas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
translated: It was translated, edited, and finalized by the Indian preceptors Viśuddhasimha, Śākyasiṃha, and the translator-editor Bandé Devendra-rakṣita.

original: // /'di la tshigs su bcad pa ni bzhi stong chig brgya yod /
analyzed: // /'di la tshigs su bcad pa ni bzhi stong chig brgya yod /
translated: It has 4,100 verses.
